story:
Love and Music

My name is Kara Ali and I am a singer/songwriter and music industry professional based in New York City.  For the past 5 years, I have been performing on the NY scene and honing my craft at venues like Rockwood Music Hall, The Bitter End, Pianos, Bowery Electric and Pete's Candy Store as well as playing intimate shows as part of Sofar Sounds, AcousticQueers and various songwriter's circles.  In the past, my music has been featured in documentaries, web series' and both theater and radio shows, and in late 2016, I self-released a music video for my song "In Blue" on VEVO.  Now, on the heels of my latest single release, "In My Mind", it's time for a complete EP!

To me, music is everything.  It is part of my day life and my night life.  It has helped me face complicated questions in our ever changing world as well as provide a brief reprieve from these questions.  Songwriting provides a level of introspection that is unparalleled. Over the years, my songwriting has most notably helped me face my own questions around self identity and I can say with certainty that music gave me the courage to come out. (I even wrote a love ballad to my girlfriend, which is definitely going to be included!)

With your contribution, you will be breathing life into the rough demos I've had laying around, just waiting to be heard.  The sincerity in songs you may have heard live in the past will be translated to recordings and I will finally be able to take my content to the next level with an authentic finished product I am proud of and you will enjoy listening to.

The Project

I am aiming to create a 5 song EP.  Given that this is a flexible goal campaign, I will scale the project up or back depending on the amount of funding achieved.

Your contribution will be going toward:

  • Pre-Production: I will sit down with my producer and go through each song to determine the best arrangements for the tracks.
  • Recording: After pre-production, we will get into the studio.  I will track guitar, vocals and pianos and loop in musicians as needed to track bass, keys, drums and others sounds.
  • Mixing: Once all recording is done, mixing will ensure the right balance between each instrument and the most artistically authentic sound.
  • Mastering: The final touch.  I will send the songs off to a mastering engineer to ensure they are streaming and radio ready.

(Above) Me while recording "In My Mind" with Producer Rob Farren in Williamsburg, Brooklyn.

In exchange for your contribution, I am offering exclusive perks!

I want to show gratitude to all of you for helping me achieve this milestone as a musician.  Rewards include everything from a signed guitar to a private concert to a day in the studio with me! Many of you friends and fans have been with me since the beginning, so I want to show thanks for your support.  Check out the full list to the right!

Why Now?

If not now, then when?  Over my 5 years in NY, I've gone through ups and downs and a major split with a producer who I had been working toward a full album with.  Despite some setbacks, I've spent the time re-defining and sharpening my sound as well as becoming happy and comfortable with myself as both an artist and as a person.  I feel that now, with a sharpened sense of self and a refusal to be put in a genre box, I can create the most impactful and special music.  Additionally, I can be a vehicle for change and spread love through my music, especially during a time when the world seems to need it most.

A big risk many artists face is a fear of vulnerability.  For me, asking for help was a great fear of mine for a while, but now I am so happy to be making myself open in this way.  In exchange for your contribution I promise to give my whole true self to this music and to this EP to make the best product possible.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help me spread the word by sharing this campaign with your social networks!  Additionally, please consider following me on the socials below and/or joining my mailing list to hear about updates!

  • Spotify
  • Instagram
  • Facebook
  • Twitter
  • Official Website

Email karaalimusic@gmail.comwith any questions or just to say hi. 

 

Want something that's not listed as a reward?

Email me and I will do my best to make that reward available!

story:
ALBION ALBUM

Songs and music are very popular in the Harts, sitting around the campfire at night. It has been suggested to me that the faction would like some new songs to sing around the campfire, as well as a way for people to learn the established ones we all love. It was suggested to me at Midsummer after seeing the Dragon Faction singing that I should record some new and old songs so that people can expand their reportoire and that is when the idea of this album came into being. I mainly require some extra recording equipment, so I am going to give Indiegogo a try. I am trying this way so that basically the more pre-orders I get, means I can create a better album depending upon how much money is raised. It will be availiable as a CD or Digital Download, and after I have purchased the equipment I need, then half of the rest of the profits will go directly into faction funds, so please support my campaign so I can make more music at your faces!

Love & Hugs

James Goulding/Raphael DeMedici


UPDATE 9th July!


Wow! What an amazing response! Thanks very much to everyone who has contributed so far. I'd like at this point to announce a couple of stretch goals. Perks are still available and will remain available until the end of the campaign. I LOVE YOU GUYS!!!

£453 (91%) in 7 days is amaze-balls! This album is going to definitely be a go. As a thanks for (almost) reaching the goal, I have managed to secure a "Secret Backing/Secondary Vocalist".

NEW STRETCH GOALS - ANNOUNCED 9th July

GOAL MET - £600 - Instead of a standard CD cover, a sexy folded insert will be produced containing the lyrics (and hopefully the chords) to the songs, as well as some nice artwork and lots of pretty!

£750 - Music Video! A full music video will be produced and shipped out on DVD (free of charge) to all those who have contributed at Physical CD level or above!

Thanks again for the amazing support! You are all awesome lovely people!

story:
Nick Hillary is a father and care taker of 5 children. He is known by a large and diverse network of family, friends, opponents, former teammates, pupils, student-athletes and soccer folks as a kindhearted, gentle, service oriented human being.  As a student-athlete he excelled in high school and college – on and off the field.  

In August of 1993 Hillary enlisted in the US Army where he rose to an E-4 rank as a corporal and was a part of a cleanup crew for the Persian Gulf war. He was honorably discharged in 1995 after two and a half years of service and earned the US Army achievement medal and the commendation medal for his distinguished service.

 For the last 15 years Nick has worked hard to pay his dues as a coach, educator, and administrator to find his niche as a head coach at Clarkson University.  Until the rug was pulled out from underneath him.

On October 24th, 2011, a 12-year-old boy, Garrett Phillips, tragically lost his life.  This is the single most important part of the story –  a young child is no longer with us.  Justice for Garrett Phillips, is truth for Nick Hillary.

He is being accused of a terrible crime which he did not commit and is 100% innocent. Due to these accusations he has subsequently lost his job and unable to support his family, being the head of the household it's difficult to keep the household running and support all 5 kids without some kind of assistance. Please we require your assistance in helping him and his family during this difficult time. For two and a half years he's had this hanging over his head, imagine not being  able to provide for your kids because of accusations that are false.

For more information on the case and Nick Hillary please visit www.truthfornickhillary.com

story:
The Girl

 

I'm Nikki; a Canadian singer and songwriter, living in Nashville, TN making Country music with a twist of Pop.  I’m so lucky to be in this incredible city, surrounded by amazing talent every day.  I have been singing and writing songs since I was just a little girl in Canada.  Music has always been my dream, my love, my heart….and it’s become a big reality in so many ways over the years.  But now, it’s about to take a big step and become my only reality!  I teamed up with my new management team last year right before the launch of my EP, titled "Let Me Love You", and together we want to get my music and my voice, heard (and loved!) by as many people around the world as we can!


 


The Plan

We're raising $20,000 to use for the radio and marketing campaign that will get my music known and build my following!  More fans, more radio spins, more song downloads, more performances = more opportunities!  This campaign for me, is the difference between being an Indie artist, forced to cut corners and finance projects on my own - to being a major artist, with the freedom to create and perform music full time, on a mass scale.  The success of this campaign will literally change my life forever. 

 

The Funds

Our budget will be allocated to the marketing plan like this:

  • $15,000 - Radio Promotion: These funds are going to the crucial, yet grueling task of my awesome radio team who will be pitching to key stations day in and day out in multiple territories at a time, getting them to play some Nikki Shae!  We are being very strategic in which stations we focus our efforts and budget.  Even so, we are going BIG!
  • $5,000 - Publicist: My publicist is instrumental in getting me interviewed in what I call "heavy hitter" publications that get people "talking".  So when my radio promoters call the stations, they can refer to all the press my publicist has been creating for me.  Another thing my publicist does is get me in the right place at the right time.  Red carpet events, product endorsement deals and opportunities for me to perform, make an appearance, or just get known, is all up to my publicist.

 

And if for some reason we don't reach our goal, we are still going ahead as planned, just shortening the duration of the campaign.  The $20,000 goal gets us a 12 week run, so anything less in funds, just means less time.  Nothing can stop us!

 

The Perks

Since I'm not doing this campaign for the creation of a tangible CD to which I can credit my contributors on the CD itself, I decided to make the perks much more personal, and that much cooler!  I always tell my fans (my peeps!) how much I love them, so I decided it's time we get to know each other more.  We've got great perks that include a Skype chat with me, or even lunch with me in Nashville!  Take a look at the column to the right of the page; I’ve included perks that are more experience oriented.  And I look forward to making some new friends and fun memories together!

 

The Thank You's 

I appreciate each and every single one of you!  And I value your support regardless of what you can or cannot pledge.  Please feel free to pledge whatever you can or share this video campaign with your family and friends!  Don't forget to use the cool IndieGogo sharing tools right here.  Let's get together and MAKE SOME NOISE!

I love you guys!

Nikki
xo

story:
Explain Yourself, Rob!

I've been an improv-comedy guy in Calgary for over 20 years, and I love performing with my dear friends at the Loose Moose Theatre Company.  I have also been a musician and composer for years, but something about the vulnerability of sharing songs has always seemed a bit scarier to me than making "The Jokes"... This summer, a good friend asked me to open up for her music gig, and I suddenly felt brave enough to share my music with people (like you)!

With your support, I'm hoping to get a lot done:

-I'll have the songs professionally mastered and made so pretty!

-I'll print CD's and release my songs to online stores for download!

-I'll get a snazzy album cover designed (probably including a bunch my own basement self portraits).

-I'll get set up to invite you to online concerts from the emotional safety of your very own basement! So Cozy!

-I'll be able to have the local college radio station ship my album all over the place!

-I'll be able to get a venue for an actual, real life concert!

And that's not to mention all the potential for low budget basement music videos down the road, upcoming new music, the chance to print to vinyl, and so much more!

What I Need and What You Get:

I'm looking for help with the following:

About a 20% of the funds are assigned to mastering the album. Then it's all done, the album will be radio ready and comply with all the digital streaming standards and amusement park ride regulations. The songs must be, for example, loud and well balanced enough so that the guy at the summer fair can say "Do you wanna go faster?" and we can't be heard responding.

The next 50% of our goal is printing a limited run of CDs, and getting digital distribution in your favourite online music stores. This is the main element, as this will get the songs out there to humanity, and not just my mom.

Finally, the last 30% of the funding will be used for preparing for online concerts, securing a venue for real life concerts, paying for graphic design (because that's one thing I'm not doing by myself), and getting you your perks delivered!

If, by sheer force of will, we go over the goal, we can start talking about vinyl, more shows, and a digital release of my "Rejected Songs" album, which is full of glorious gems...

So, the PERKS:

- Get The Album:

For most of our contributors, you'll be getting my album in the format of your choice! Want the real thing signed? I'll do that! Want the digital thing signed? I'll figure out a way to do that.

-Get "Rejected Songs":

Get the album, AND For folks with a keen ear for weirdness, you can get a special download of my "Rejected Songs" album, which, as previously mentioned, is full of genius, strangeness, and randomness. Highlights include "Christmas Metal", the 6 second long"Luchadorks", and "There is Something in My Eye", which is exactly like what it sounds like. Plus much, much more!

-Get it on Minidisc?

Get the album in a normal format, and then,yeah, minidisc. I'll burn it for you myself, send over a miniaturized version of the album art and everything. 

-Exclusive Online Concert Live from My Basement!

Get the album, AND a show!  There's no parking fees, no dress code, nobody will shame you for eating an entire bag of candy in one of those "sharing" size bags by yourself! I'm busily rehearsing, and soon I'll start taking requests.

-A Real Live Show in the Real World!

We will all convene at a real venue in the real world, we will come prepared with whatever social anxiety coping mechanisms we require, and then I will rock you folkfully! You'll tell your kids about it, for sure. I can guarantee a very funny show that also features very sincere music!

 

But Rob, what happens if you don't meet your goal?

Well, The mastering is underway, and I will painstakingly and very gradually prepare my album for release some time in the future. But do you really want to miss the musical equivalent of this image? Yeah, nobody does. So photoshoppy!

 

The Impact

Genuinely, your support is going to make a real dream come true for me. I have always imagined myself sharing my songs with everyone! I'm so proud of this album, there's a fun variety, you'll dance, you'll laugh, you'll cry, and also there's that one song about soup.

Risks & Challenges

This one is easy. The album is finished, and all it needs is a final push. I'll take a second job if I have to. There's a pretty sweet gaming store about a block away. 

Other Ways You Can Help

No money? Oh my goodness, please feel free to promote! Share my website, where you can hear demos of songs, see photos, and get news about potential shows!

robmitchelson.com

I'm on Facebook at "Rob Mitchelson's Music n' Such"

I'm on Twitter and Instagram  at RobbieRobTown, and I looooove interacting with fans on Instagram! Just pop in and like a picture or follow my shenanigans! I regularly post dumb videos, unhelpful tutorials, artwork, and pensive self portraits.

I'm on Twitter and Instagram  at RobbieRobTown, and I looooove interacting with fans on Instagram! Just pop in and like a picture or follow my shenanigans! I regularly post dumb videos, unhelpful tutorials, artwork, and pensive self portraits.

story:
Out of The Wilderness: 

The Story

  • Many of you know that I attended Bethel School of Worship this summer and came home with a passion to jump into songwriting and really pursue the calling that God has been placed on my life. 
  • Out of The Wilderness is a look into some of my hardest moments in life, and the amazing lessons I learned along the way. I found God like never before in this part of my life, and I hope people get a clearer picture of Him through this.
  • All donations go to mixing, mastering and producing this EP project, whilst making my dreams come true. 

The Impact

  • I have had a passion for years with all things writing. God has confirmed countless times that this love for writing will change lives, and I fully believe the words He has placed on my heart will do just that. Worship has been an area that I have wanted to be involved in for quite some time, but it never felt like a good fit until now. My songs are my hearts diary on full display for all to see. These are my real life melodies crafted by trials and revelations of His goodness. You can't help but relate to at least one of these songs, and my prayer is that you know Him more because of it.

The Buzz

  • I completely understand if you're not able to financially support this project (I am asking for money after all). Your prayerful support and word of mouth are just as effective and appreciated by me!
  • Indiegogo has some great features so you can share this project on any social media platform available!

The Story

Many of you know that I attended Bethel School of Worship this summer and came home with a passion to jump into songwriting and really pursue the calling that God has been placed on my life. 
Out of The Wilderness is a look into some of my hardest moments in life, and the amazing lessons I learned along the way. I found God like never before in this part of my life, and I hope people get a clearer picture of Him through this.
All donations go to mixing, mastering and producing this EP project, whilst making my dreams come true. 



The Impact
I have had a passion for years with all things writing. God has confirmed countless times that this love for writing will change lives, and I fully believe the words He has placed on my heart will do just that. Worship has been an area that I have wanted to be involved in for quite some time, but it never felt like a good fit until now. My songs are my hearts diary on full display for all to see. These are my real life melodies crafted by trials and revelations of His goodness. You can't help but relate to at least one of these songs, and my prayer is that you know Him more because of it.


The Buzz

I completely understand if you're not able to financially support this project (I am asking for money after all). Your prayerful support and word of mouth are just as effective and appreciated by me!
Indiegogo has some great features so you can share this project on any social media platform available!

story:
The Motivational Edge is a non-profit outreach and after school program serving the inner city youth of Miami, Florida and South Florida. We use culturally relevant arts as a motivational platform to inspire youth toward academic achievement, increased self-confidence and the building of essential life skills.

With your support, we’ll be able to create ME Phoenix and pay for 12 months worth of operation costs.  After that, the programs become completely self sustaining.  Thanks to this unique business model, you can be confident that your donation will continue helping under-served youth and foster youth for many years to come.

In 2005, our Founder and CEO Ian Welsch came to Miami to begin his career in education.  As a public school teacher, he watched from the front row as budget cuts gutted school arts programs. 

In addition to education, Ian is also an entrepreneur who started an in-home tutoring company shortly after he arrived in Florida.  Unfortunately, he came to realize that many of the children who needed his help the most couldn’t afford private tutoring.

Ever the visionary, Ian looked at two big problems and saw one huge opportunity.  In 2008, he founded The Motivational Edge.

The Motivational Edge is a non-profit outreach and after school program serving the inner city youth of Miami, Florida and South Florida. We use culturally relevant arts as a motivational platform to inspire youth toward academic achievement, increased self-confidence and the building of essential life skills.


The Motivational Edge provides academic tutoring as well as instruction in music and art.  At The Motivational Edge, students can take classes in:

-  The Art of Creative Writing and Lyrial Expression

-  Music Production

-  Dance Expression

-  DJing

-  Many Musical Instruments

-  Urban Arts Expression


Our free tutoring services are available to any qualifying child in our community who needs support in order to succeed academically.  Through no fault of their own though, many of these children are facing realities in which scholastic achievement is not the priority. We provide culturally relevant arts instruction to these children free of charge.  In exchange, we require that our young musicians and artists maintain their grades.  Any student running below a "C" average in any of their core courses is required to receive tutoring in order to participate in the music and arts program(s).


The benefits to our kids are undeniable.  Many children who are unable to express and process their emotions verbally can do so through music and art.  When youth participate in our arts program we regularly see:

  • Academic improvement
  • Increased parental involvement
  • Motivation to succeed in and out of school
  • Increased confidence and morale
  • Increased self-awareness and discipline
  • Inspiration of the creative spirit through music and rhythm

In addition, we bring jobs to the community and can be a referral source to other youth organizations.

We have been so inspired and encouraged by the change we've seen in our Miami community and its youth, we want to offer The Motivational Edge's programs to youth across America.  Obviously that won’t happen overnight, so we’re starting small.  One new location at a time, one new city: Phoenix, Arizona. We anticipate to serve over 400 students in the first 12 months of operation, but need your help!


Besides a little community support and a lot of kids ready to learn and have fun, we need $200,000.  With that money, we’ll be able to create ME Phoenix and pay for 12 months worth of operation costs.  After that, the programs become completely self sustaining.  Thanks to this unique business model, you can be confident that your donation will continue helping under-served youth and foster youth for many years to come.

If you’d like to learn even more about The Motivational Edge and the people who work tirelessly to make it such a success, please visit us at: 

  • www.themotivationaledge.org
  • www.facebook.com/motivationaledge
  • http://instagram.com/motivationaledge
  • www.twitter.com/motivedge

story:
Summary

I am looking at an international career in opera and would very much appreciate your help in aiding me to pay for a doctoral program in the UK.

  • I hold a BA in music, voice emphasis, from Whitworth University in Spokane, WA. He is also finishing up his masters in music, classical voice emphasis, at the University of Montana in Missoula, MT. I have won several National Association of Teachers of Singing competitions, sung with orchestras in Spokane and Seattle, performed with All-State and All-Northwest choirs, and performed my first opera role this past school year as Dr. Falke in Johann Strauss' "Die Fledermaus".
  • I am raising funds to help me study in the United Kingdom at either the Royal Conservatoire of Scotland or the University of Cardiff. I have been given a great gift and am looking at an international opera career. This career would be greatly aided by a degree from a reputable European university, such as both previously mentioned schools. 
  • By studying in the United Kingdom, I would kickstart my career on stages such as the Welsh National Opera in Cardiff, Wales, I would be able to sing in houses including the Sydney Opera House, Covent Garden, La Scala, perhaps even the Bayreuth Festspielhaus. This would all be due to your help in funding my education at the doctoral level.

Beyond a simple desire to go to Europe, I am feeling called to follow my giftings out of the United States and use them in a much larger arena for the Lord's glory and praise. I would like to thank those who are able to give even the smallest amount to help me achieve my goals, dreams, and vocation.

Where Is It All Going?

Here are some of the details included in funding:

  • I am trying to raise $20,000 (USD). This includes roughly $13,000 to prove to the visa office that I can survive in the UK without a job if need be (though I would be allowed to work 20 hours a week and plan to do so). The rest would go to airfare (upwards of $2500 one-way), the first few months' rent (between £87-200 per week, or $140-320), as well as start-up costs such as utilities, groceries, and public transportation.
  • There are several perks you get when you donate! A $1-199 donation will get you access to a private blog about my time in the UK and up-to-date information on my education and career. A $200-999 gets you a copy of my World Premiere Album, due out in April as well as access to my blog and an autographed headshot. $1000+ gets you everything mentioned before as well as a live video recording of my graduate recital, being performed this coming November. 
  • Even if I do not reach my goal, any amount my friends, family, and other donors will have aided me in my education as I continue to save up to go to the UK.

Other Ways You Can Help

I completely understand if you cannot contribute. I, obviously, am in the same boat. However, here are a few ways you can help even if you cannot donate. 

  • Spread the word to those you know! Word of mouth is the best way to raise funds for any project.
  • Pray! As I am following God's calling I would very much appreciate your prayers and well-wishes as I embark on this chapter of my life far away from family and close friends.

Again, thank you so much for taking the time to read through my information and if you are able to donate, know that I will be forever grateful.

story:
America's Disaster Relief First Aid Kit Project

This campaign is raising funds on behalf of America's Disaster Relief, a verified nonprofit organization. All tax-deductible contributions made to this campaign go to America's Disaster Relief, with the exception of the tee shirts fabrication and shipping costs. All contributions are considered unrestricted gifts and cannot be directed to any particular purpose.

America's Disaster Relief is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization, whose purpose is to help people get back on their feet after major natural disasters occurring in the continental United States.  When fire, floods, tornadoes, and hurricanes strike, America's Disaster Relief is a second responder.  After the first responders leave survivors still need help.  America's Disaster Relief arrives to help those survivors put their lives back together.  When possible, disaster victims are fed for free in their neighborhoods.  Personal and household items are also delivered by 18 wheelers to prearranged distribution locations.

All personnel, including board members donate their time, so contributions go directly to helping people in need.  Like most relief organizations however, America's Disaster Relief is limited in how much they can help by the amount of charitable gifts they receive.  There are no professional fundraisers on the payroll, so getting enough donations of cash and supplies is always a challenge.

The purpose of this Campaign is to kick off a privately funded First Aid Kit product, which will be offered for sale on Amazon.com.  America's Disaster Relief will receive half of the profits from this venture in exchange for endorsing the First Aid Kit and licensing the use of America's Disaster Relief branding on the Kit.  The expected revenue from this project is not intended to replace normal charitable giving, but could be an important source of supplemental income that America's Disaster Relief will put to good use for many years.  

The America's Disaster Relief First Aid Kit has been designed with quality as a top priority.  Most of the items in the Repair Kit will be manufactured in the United States, and the Kits will also be assembled in the U.S.  That does mean that the Kit is a little more expensive to make than some of our competition, however we feel that being able to ensure consistent quality justifies the added cost.  We also believe potential customers will be more supportive of U.S. made products and have more confidence in them.  In addition, we expect to win many customers who need a First Aid Kit, but also want to support America's Disaster Relief.  Finally, the profit margin we have priced into the First Aid Kits is very modest, so we're able to offer a great kit at an affordable price.  We believe this combination of quality, affordability and support for America's Disaster Relief will result in many sales for many years.

What's in the First Aid Kits?

The core of the America's Disaster Relief First Aid Kit consists of the most important items in any First Aid Kit, as defined and specified by the American National Standards Institute. Our kit contains all of those items, plus a number of other first aid kit items that go beyond what is found in other ANSI compliant kits.  The Wound Seal Pour Packs, CPR barrier shield and Cold Pack are three items in particular that bumped up the cost of our kits, but allow us to offer better first aid protection to our customers than many other ANSI compliant kits sold on Amazon.





What about Risks?

We believe we have identified the most likely risks of product failure, and have kept those risks as low as possible by designing a high quality, affordable first aid kit, with attractive branding.  In the unlikely event of product failure however, the entire risk will be borne by Oregon Origins LLC.  America's Disaster Relief has made no financial investments nor commitments to this project beyond our profit sharing agreement.


What We Need

We need supporters of America's Disaster Relief who will purchase First Aid Kits.  With a donation to America's Disaster Relief, we'll provide you with a discount code to buy one of our $29.95 First Aid Kits on Amazon for only $1.00.  The number of discounted First Aid Kits is limited, so please make your contribution to America's Disaster Relief right away!


What You Get

Take a look at the perks we have for you, described in detail on the right side of this page.

As our thank you for your gift of $25 to America's Disaster Relief, here's what your ADR Tee Shirt will look like.  Just let us know your size, XS through 3XL from the chart below and we'll have it shipped to you.

 


We would also love to provide you with an America's Disaster Relief First Aid Kit if you're one of the first donors to America's Disaster Relief at the $25 level or higher.

Other Ways You Can Help

Buy an America's Disaster Relief First Aid Kit directly from Amazon.  These kits would also make great birthday or holiday gifts. Recommend this First Aid Kit to your friends and family.

story:
It's Not to good to be true ;)

Please take a moment to watch the video, hear our story and see if this is a project that you'd like to support and share to help get off the ground. 

The Computer Crashes...

Willow Park set out on a journey to release it's 1st 5 song EP the end of Feb 2013 and.....it didn't happen ;(    In the middle of recording, we got the infamous blue screen of death and then zap....no power.  It's a horrible feeling when we were on a roll and had great momentum.  We let it stop us in our tracks for a few months but then decided the music was too special not to move forward.

We used all the money we saved for the project to fix the computer that crashed mid project, software that was too outdated to work on the upgraded system and the hardware that well, you guessed it....stopped working. 

We're back to square one with all the tunes almost complete and in need of a little help. 


What We Decided to do...

We decided to utilize Indiegogo to pre-sell our digital EP to raise funds for the release.  In order to help us share our music with the WORLD, we are offering you access to download all 5 songs on the EP for $1.00....no tricks..no gimmicks....we do ask one favor however....

In return, all we request is that you share it with your friends and family on your social networks, letting them know that they too can buy it for $1.00...then, ifyou have Facebook, simply like our page at www.facebook.com/willowparkproject 

That is it, you will be sent a link and password to download our tunes.

Your contribution will allow us to: Mix, Master and Press the EP (Album with artwork) with anything left over going towards a CD Release/Listening Party, Radio Promotion & Tour Support.

Costs:

Mixing $300-$500 per song  - $2500

Master $100-$250 per song - $1250

Press $1500 for 1000 CD's - $1000

CD Release Party (Franklin Theatre) yes, we are dreamers - $1500 (1/2 day)

                                             Musician Fees, Sounds guy...etc $1500-2000

Radio Promotion -  $2400 (8 week campaign)

Tour Support - (Lodging, Musicians, Food, Transportation) - $10,000 (8 weekend tour)

For a MUY GRANDE Total of.....drum roll......$20,650  


It's EXPENSIVE to do music for a living...

If we reached the "Grande Total Amount" we would be ecstatic, however we realize we have to do our part as well and are therefore only asking for your help to get the ball rolling....

Please listen to our music, hear our story, check out our videos and see if it's something you would like to support.  If so, we graciously thank you and can't wait to meet you at a show in your hometown.

Other Ways You Can Help...

Even if you are unable to contribute $1.00, please consider helping us bring this grassroots fundraising campaign to life by sharing with your fellow social network family and friends.  Indiegogo has the tools to help you share it with the world.

And that’s all there is to it....thank you in advance for your support....

You just might be getting the best deal on the net ;)


ENJOY THE MUSIC!!!


Love,

WP


www.facebook.com/willowparkproject

www.willowparkproject.com

www.twitter.com/willowparkmusic

http://www.youtube.com/user/WillowParkProject

Even if you are unable to contribute $1.00, please consider helping us bring this grassroots fundraising campaign to life by sharing with your fellow social network family and friends.  Indiegogo has the tools to help you share it with the world.

And that’s all there is to it....thank you in advance for your support....
You just might be getting the best deal on the net ;)

ENJOY THE MUSIC!!!

Love,
WP

www.facebook.com/willowparkproject
www.willowparkproject.com
www.twitter.com/willowparkmusic
http://www.youtube.com/user/WillowParkProject

story:
The Concept

With the industry shutdown, we've taken matters into our own hands. The Only Thing We Could Really Do at the Moment Tour  is a virtual tour filmed across the West Coast. This project is an effort to revitalize the appreciation for live music.

The Execution

We will be driving through 5 cities to record live performances. Locations span from Los Angeles to San Francisco and concluding in Seattle. Starting October 9th, we will sequentially premiere the performances for each stop of the tour. To begin, Apollo Bebop will release their video, the following day Undecided Future will release theirs, and finally Rocky Angelini will release his video the day after that. This will continue for 5 weeks, culminating in a complete set representing each artist! All videos will be uploaded to each artists respective YouTube channel and backers of this campaign will have early access each week to the performances before released to the public.

Here are some sample videos on what you can expect these performances to look and sound like:

Apollo Bebop - "The Recipe" (Live on the River Trail Bridge)

Out and About with ROCKY ANGELINI | Time Machine

 

The Artists

Apollo Bebop is a hip hop / jazz quintet from Santa Ana, CA.

https://open.spotify.com/artist/5Ar4PuRM6i2krbQ...

 

 

Undecided Future is a pop soul band from Southern California

https://open.spotify.com/artist/1sBCqmBIRFzk6Rd...

 

 

Rocky Angelini with the Sauce is a hip hop / jazz act from Santa Ana, CA

https://open.spotify.com/artist/3Fv7JfJU7wIZmGS...

 

The Purpose

We are entertainers. Being that we have been unable to give you a proper live show experience has weighed heavy on us and we want to do something big for you while staying safe. We created this concept as a unique experience for our fans and those who support the live events industry. Also, with the releases of each video being spread out, it makes it convenient for the viewer to enjoy the content without having to block out large chunks of your day!

 

Please feel free to ask us any questions you have about this campaign!

 

Thank you for your support,

Apollo Bebop, Undecided Future, Rocky Angelini and the Team

 

Click Here for FAQ video in IGTV

story:
Short Summary

My name is Sean Donnelly. I started making music videos with my own music a couple months ago. I reached out to one of my favorite animators and they responded quickly saying that they like my idea for a music video! How freeking cool is that!? They could tell that my budget was pretty limited so they stared to look for ways for me to save money. But I want to be able to pay them the full amount and go all the way!! (And tip them, obviously)

What We Need & What You Get

The music is totally produced and ready to go. My part is totally done. All the money from this campaign up to $1000 will go STRAIGHT to the animator!! If I go over my goal (hey, it could happen!) I'm going to invest the money into making this video and my channel even better.

Other Ways You Can Help!

Thank you for taking the time to read this. If you want to share it with a friend that likes punk music, animation, or video games it could make a huge difference for me :)

story:
Short Summary

'The Fall of the House of Usher', a new chamber opera by Felix Jarrar, is based on Edgar Allan Poe's story of the same name. The story is about a nameless friend (to be played by tenor, Jonas Budris) that visits Roderick Usher (to be played by bass-baritone, Jeremy Hirsch), an old companion from his boyhood, in an unspecified gothic land. When the friend arrives at the House of Usher, the place where Roderick lives, he learns of the illness that has plagued and killed almost all the members of Roderick's extended family. The only surviving members of the Usher family are Roderick and his elusive and decrepit twin sister, Lady Madeline (to be played by soprano, Corrine Byrne). As the friend gradually begins to experience the effects of the Usher illness in the House, his loyalty to Roderick turns into an obsession. The nature of the relationships between all three characters becomes blurred and hazy as they come face to face with their respective destinies. 

The opera is unique in that it tells the famed gothic story from the perspective of Lady Madeline. In Jarrar's libretto and score, the audience gets to hear Madeline's side of the story in all of its horrific ghoulishness. Jarrar draws on various literary theories about the Poe story to create an original, terse and dramatically compelling adaptation of the tale. He is writing the libretto and score for the work as his capstone project for his undergraduate thesis in music composition and piano performance at Marlboro College.

'The Fall of the House of Usher' will receive it's world premiere at Marlboro College's Whittemore Theater in Marlboro, Vermont on Monday March 28th and Tuesday March 29th, 2016 at 8:00 pm. The New York premiere performances of the work will take place at the DiMenna Center for Classical Music in New York City on Friday April 15th, 2016 and Saturday April 16th, 2016 at 8:00 pm. The production will be directed and designed by Kristi Leigh. The piano quartet will consist of Brendan Speltz on violin, Molly Carr on viola, Andrew Janss on cello and Felix Jarrar on the piano.

What We Need & What You Get

$3,000 is required for the rental of the DiMenna Center for Classical Music in NYC. The money would cover two performances, and expenses for moving scenery in and out of the venue.

$3,000 is required to create and design sets for the opera's production.

The great thing about supporting this production on indiegogo is that you get access to perks. Exclusive 'The Fall of the House of Usher' T-shirts, coffee mugs, recordings of the opera and complimentary tickets to the NYC premiere on Friday April 15th, 2016 are among the great perks we will be offering our supporters. 'Perks' are listed on the right hand side of the screen and can be selected by clicking on them. 

The Impact

High-quality performances of engaging and entertaining contemporary opera are a rare treat for audiences nowadays. 'The Fall of the House of Usher' has a musical style that combines the passion and melody of 19th-century Romantic-era music with the harmonies of Messiaen to create a romantic-spectral style that will entertain audiences of all ages. The opera is relevant to today because the work offers new insight into a story that has had a plethora of interpretations by literary critics and audiences since it's publication in 1839. Jarrar's work focuses on the story's disturbing subtext without destroying any of Poe's mysterious symbolism.

Risks & Challenges

The production of an opera is a very time-consuming and expensive labor of love for all parties that it involves. The production team consists of the director, Kristi Leigh, and it's composer, librettist and pianist, Felix Jarrar, who will also be the musical director for the work. They are planning and designing every aspect of the production. Jarrar will be the accompanist for piano score rehearsals and will start rehearsing the work with Leigh and the singing actors this Fall. In the spring, the string players will join the production for rehearsals. Everyone performing in the work has received widespread acclaim and was individually vetted based on meetings, auditions and/or their record catalog. All that is stopping them from making this a complete reality is the money. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute money to the production due to financial difficulty, please get the word out about the campaign and share it with your friends using Indiegogo's share tools. In the campaign's 'Gallery' section, you will be able to check out photos from the opera workshop and see the video of 'In the greenest of our valleys...', an aria from the opera that was workshopped for this campaign.

story:
Above: The Album Sleeve. Model: Megan Lindsay.photographed by Gillian Anderson of Glicious Foto.

Below: The Ltd Xmas CD and Xmas Card bundle

About Us And Our New Album

Ok here goes….

•  We are an Edinburgh based Orchestral Folk Rock Band, named after a Children's Fantasy Novel by C.S Lewis.

•  We've just finished the recording of our 2nd Album, but the label who put out our 1st one are sadly no more, so we're going to put out the new one ourselves.

•  We need help in covering the costs that self-releasing and promoting an album incurs. With your help we can get it out there, and you can get awesome exclusive stuff in return!

We Need You!

The new album is recorded. We did it at our good friend Keith's home studio on the outskirts of Edinburgh. We started in January 2012. It's taken this long to make due to many things, but mainly through losing a couple of members because of personal reasons, which meant having to put recording on hold whilst we auditioned new folks Caroline and Craig to the fold and taught them the songs.

We are now seeking funding to do the following:

•  Professionally Master the album

•  Pay for Promo CD Copies to be pressed and sent out to Press & Media

•  Pay for CD's of the album in Shrink Wrapped Jewel Cases with 8 Page Booklets for you good people out there

•  Pay For a 3 month PR Campaign to successfully promote the album release

We are trying to raise £2500. If we do not raise the full amount we could put some of what we raise towards some of the above, but to allow us to get the album out there, fully promoted, and to do the album justice, it's important we reach the full amount, so please help all you can.

How Your Contribution Will Help & What You Get In Return

See this as a place to pre-order our 2nd Album, but with the added bonus of getting it in your hands before anyone else, anywhere. When you pledge some money today, you will instantly get a digital download of an unheard track demoed for the record.

You can also bag other exclusive stuff like your name in the liner note 'Thank You's', invites to secret album playback parties, free entry to the album launch gigs in the new year, an Acoustic Show in your living room for you and all your friends, and even the hand illustrated Acoustic Guitar that Scott used on the first album and tour!

We want to show our appreciation to you for supporting us in any way we can.

So come on!

Help out and be a part of the release of our wonderful 2nd album!!

Many, Many Thanks

Scott, John, Caroline, Craig and Liam

x

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t afford to contribute. You may be one of them. But that doesn’t mean that you still can’t help!

You can quickly put the word out there by sharing this campaign on Facebook and Twitter etc. Go on!

You can also use the indiegogo share tools too!!

story:
Cher crowd,

SOUVENIRS FROM EARTH TV émet depuis 2007 un programme de vidéos artistiques 24/24h sur le câble en France (Free 169, Orange 167, SFR 185, Bouygues 218) et sur Internet.

Nous avons aujourd’hui plus de 1.5 million de spectateurs par mois - sans pub, sans marketing. 

Rêvée par les pionniers tels Andy Warhol ou Nam June Paik, cette chaîne comme œuvre d’art en soi est un espace de respiration dans un univers encombré. SFE a réussi l'exploit de faire entrer l'art contemporain dans des millions de foyers, de démocratiser l'art vidéo et de lui donner, enfin, une vraie visibilité sociale.

SFE, c'est un catalogue unique au monde constitué de 3000 vidéos d’art, films expérimentaux, vidéos de danse contemporaine, captages de performances, music clips d’avant-garde, films de photographes… tous en constante évolution.

Faire vivre la chaîne économiquement n'a jamais été facile. SFE TV diffuse en HD et sur Internet, et aujourd'hui nous devons, en plus des frais courants, renouveler notre installation technique. C'est surtout pour passer à la vitesse supérieure que nous avons besoin de vous. Si on ne se renouvelle pas techniquement, on meurt! Or nous ne souhaitons pas nous faire acheter par un grand groupe media. Nous voulons préserver notre liberté et l’intégrité de notre programmation artistique.

Permettez-nous de rester indépendants avec cette campagne, pour que SOUVENIRS FROM EARTH ne soit pas qu’un souvenir...

Regardez, donnez, partagez et profitez-en! http://www.sfe.tv/

Enfin, un grand MERCI pour votre soutien!



Donnez, partagez, et profitez-en !
http://www.sfe.tv/

Marcus Kreiss
CEO et Fondateur

story:
Our Goal:

We are on a mission to raise an additional $5,000 to establish a start-up fund for the 2012-2016 One Million Strong Traveling Photo Essay Exhibit, which kicked off at the Hayti Heritage Center in Durham, North Carolina on October 2, 2012 and closes on February 25, 2013. 

*If you donated to the previous campaign for the exhibit launch and would like to donate again, please know that the featured images for all the perks in this campaign are different than the last, so even if you donate at the same level, you'll get 2 distinct gifts in return.*

Any money raised in excess of our funding goal will be used to pay our grant writer and event consultant for additional weeks - or if you're feeling really generous - additional months of work.

About One Million Strong:

The One Million Strong Traveling Photo Exhibit captures the essence of the Million Man March (Washington, D.C.) and the 10 years of subsequent political/cultural gatherings it inspired: The World Day of Atonement in New York City (1996); The Million Women March in Philadelphia (1997); The Million Youth March in Harlem (1998); The Million Youth Movement in Atlanta (1998); The Million Family March in Washington, DC. (2000); and the Millions More Movement March in Washington, DC (2005).

The One Million Strong Exhibit consists of one hundred 16" x 20" photos, as well as essay text and video, and caters to community and educational groups. This the first full-showing of the collected work and it will become a traveling exhibit, available to colleges, community centers, and museums.

Installations of this work have previously been shown at the North Carolina Museum of History (Raleigh, NC), the International Center & Civil Rights Museum (Greensboro, NC), Delta Fine Arts Center (Winston-Salem, NC), and Lucy Florence Coffee House (Los Angeles, CA).

You may view images here: http://www.facebook.com/onemillionstrong.

Targeted Cities for the Tour Include:

Atlanta; New York; Los Angeles;, Dallas; New Orleans; Washington, DC; Philadelphia; Orlando; Detroit; Chicago; St. Louis; Oakland; Greensboro; Winston-Salem; Houston; Austin; Minneapolis; Cincinnati; Cleveland; Jackson, Mississippi; Tallahassee; Little Rock; Hartford; Boston; Baltimore; Richmond; Seattle; Wilmington, North Carolina; Oklahoma City; Phoenix; and Nashville.

Your Donation Pays for...

• Computer equipment - an Apple laptop, an iMac and a hard drive to be used for editing/printing photos, editing/distributing video from the discussion series, storing important files, laying out the forthcoming book... All equipment will be put to good use.

If you'd like to make a material donation in the form of the aforementioned items, please email katina@katinaparker.com for specs.

• Paying a grant writer to help us get dough so that the project is sustainable.

• Creating a digital press kit, including a video about the exhibit, to send out to potential exhibit venues.

One Million Strong is being used to:

• Celebrate and affirm images of Black people who have engaged in political protest for the betterment of their families and communities.

• Foster critical dialogue about the diversity of political perspectives that exist in Black communities and develop methods to work across our differences.

• Inspire participants (youth in particular) to document their communities.

• Engage, activate, and organize participants around pressing issues that continue to threaten the health of our families like the prison industrial complex, youth violence, housing, education, and unemployment. 

Other Ways You Can Help:

• Get your friends & family to donate.

• Like One Million Strong on Facebook.

• Tweet about One Million Strong. Direct your Tweets @KatinaParker.

• Host an exhibition (for community, academic, and museum spaces only) by emailing katina@katinaparker.com.

• Book Katina Parker to speak about One Million Strong at your school, church, or museum by emailing katina@katinaparker.com.
story_txt:
Our Goal:
We are on a mission to raise an additional $5,000 to establish a start-up fund for the 2012-2016 One Million Strong Traveling Photo Essay Exhibit, which kicked off at the Hayti Heritage Center in Durham, North Carolina on October 2, 2012 and closes on February 25, 2013. 
*If you donated to the previous campaign for the exhibit launch and would like to donate again, please know that the featured images for all the perks in this campaign are different than the last, so even if you donate at the same level, you'll get 2 distinct gifts in return.*
Any money raised in excess of our funding goal will be used to pay our grant writer and event consultant for additional weeks - or if you're feeling really generous - additional months of work.
About One Million Strong:
The One Million Strong Traveling Photo Exhibit captures the essence of the Million Man March (Washington, D.C.) and the 10 years of subsequent political/cultural gatherings it inspired: The World Day of Atonement in New York City (1996); The Million Women March in Philadelphia (1997); The Million Youth March in Harlem (1998); The Million Youth Movement in Atlanta (1998); The Million Family March in Washington, DC. (2000); and the Millions More Movement March in Washington, DC (2005).
The One Million Strong Exhibit consists of one hundred 16" x 20" photos, as well as essay text and video, and caters to community and educational groups. This the first full-showing of the collected work and it will become a traveling exhibit, available to colleges, community centers, and museums.
Installations of this work have previously been shown at the North Carolina Museum of History (Raleigh, NC), the International Center & Civil Rights Museum (Greensboro, NC), Delta Fine Arts Center (Winston-Salem, NC), and Lucy Florence Coffee House (Los Angeles, CA).
You may view images here: http://www.facebook.com/onemillionstrong.
Targeted Cities for the Tour Include:
Atlanta; New York; Los Angeles;, Dallas; New Orleans; Washington, DC; Philadelphia; Orlando; Detroit; Chicago; St. Louis; Oakland; Greensboro; Winston-Salem; Houston; Austin; Minneapolis; Cincinnati; Cleveland; Jackson, Mississippi; Tallahassee; Little Rock; Hartford; Boston; Baltimore; Richmond; Seattle; Wilmington, North Carolina; Oklahoma City; Phoenix; and Nashville.
Your Donation Pays for...
• Computer equipment - an Apple laptop, an iMac and a hard drive to be used for editing/printing photos, editing/distributing video from the discussion series, storing important files, laying out the forthcoming book... All equipment will be put to good use.
If you'd like to make a material donation in the form of the aforementioned items, please email katina@katinaparker.com for specs.
• Paying a grant writer to help us get dough so that the project is sustainable.
• Creating a digital press kit, including a video about the exhibit, to send out to potential exhibit venues.
One Million Strong is being used to:
• Celebrate and affirm images of Black people who have engaged in political protest for the betterment of their families and communities.

• Foster critical dialogue about the diversity of political perspectives that exist in Black communities and develop methods to work across our differences.
• Inspire participants (youth in particular) to document their communities.
• Engage, activate, and organize participants around pressing issues that continue to threaten the health of our families like the prison industrial complex, youth violence, housing, education, and unemployment. 


Other Ways You Can Help:
• Get your friends & family to donate.
• Like One Million Strong on Facebook.
• Tweet about One Million Strong. Direct your Tweets @KatinaParker.
• Host an exhibition (for community, academic, and museum spaces only) by emailing katina@katinaparker.com.
• Book Katina Parker to speak about One Million Strong at your school, church, or museum by emailing katina@katinaparker.com.

story:
Twelve years ago my wife and I founded the Legacy Gift of Music (GOM) Programs. Since GOM’s inception we have assisted hundreds of deserving and at risk youth stay in school and out of trouble with the law.

I’ve been a Social Worker for over 45 years and became interested in helping young people for very personal reasons. My two older brothers both dropped out of school before grade ten - they both lived much of their lives in poverty and eventually both passed away in homeless shelters.

I was very fortunate to not follow this path, rather I followed my passion to help people by obtaining my Master’s Degree in Social Work…no small accomplishment for someone who wasn’t expected to finish high school.

Through this holiday campaign and the communities generosity we are hoping to raise $50,000 that will support approximately 40 - 50 youth through 2017-18…this support includes instruments, lessons, workshops and long-term mentoring alongside the associated program coordination, evaluation and administration costs.

Legacy Gift of Music has become an incredible labor of love for my wife and I and many others. Helping young people stay in school and completing their education and staying on a “positive life path”, all through music and long-term mentoring, has become our life’s passion - we are thankful for the incredible support that we have received over the years and we continue to be in awe of how successful this program is.

By offering instruments, donated by the community, as well as individualized weekly music lessons and workshops in schools and service agencies, we have been able to consistently assist 80% of our youth in completing their education, while at the same time offering them an opportunity that would have most likely never been possible.

I love music! I have absolutely no musical talent but I do know how powerful music is and I’m well aware of the importance of having someone in your life who cares about you and who is going to be there for you, to help you succeed. These people are our instructors, most who have been involved with the same youth, in the same location, for 7-8 years. I can’t begin to tell you how important this is for a young person who is in dire need of this type of relationship and interaction, and who is struggling to keep it all together and stay in school... I feel very fortunate to be doing what I’m doing and I see every day the difference our program is making in the lives of children, youth and families. I Hope you take time to get to know us by following our campaign. I know the young people, who we are here to serve, would very much appreciate you taking the time

It’s no secret that these are difficult times in Alberta with many families struggling and basically losing everything. For these families this type of programming for their child is not within reach, especially when you’re struggling to put food on the table or keep a roof over your head. More than ever these families and youth need us – this is a critical year for Legacy and unfortunately many of the 120 youth we support will have to be cut from the program next year, unless we can find necessary funds to keep them engaged.  This economy has not been kind to anyone and charities are definitely feeling the brunt.

Will your contribution, no matter how large help? Absolutely!!!

Did you know:

143,200 children live in poverty in Alberta - 1 in 10.

It can cost parents $800 - $1,600 per year (10-12 months) for one child to be involved in music lessons.

In Calgary 3000 youth leave school every year, at an estimated cost of $16,000 per youth, per year, or $48,000,000 annually in total.

For the majority of inmates in adult penitentiaries the average education for 75% of the prison population is grade 7, with an annual price tag of 10 billion dollars plus annually…is there a correlation between educational achievement and crime? I would say yes! Could these circumstances have been prevented? Again I would say yes!

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Thank you for your support in making a difference by investing in the lives of both Calgary and Alberta's future.   

If unable to make a monetary donation you can help us immensely by simply sharing our campaign with others, please help us spread the word to Give the 'Gift of Music' this holiday season!  

 

Darryl Wernham, MSW

Chief Executive Officer
The Legacy Children's Foundation - Alberta

Phone: 403-244-3074
www.legacygiftofmusic.com
_____________________________________________
One hundred years from now it will not matter

what my bank account was, what sort of house I

lived in, or the kind of car I drove ... but, the world

may be different because I was important in the life of a child.

 

**Special Credits to: Harm Productions (Calgary, Ab) for the amazing film.

The great people who participated in the interviews.  

Our talented students and instructors.

Axe Music for the partnership and support.

https://www.axemusic.com/

Alberta's Promise for all that they do and did for us during this campaign.

http://www.albertaspromise.org/

 As well as each and every person + organization that has helped fund the program over the years.

 

**Charitable Donation Tax Receipts will be sent for all donations $50.00 or More!**

 

** EMAIL TRANSFER or CHECK DONATIONS CAN BE ARRINGED BY SPECIAL REQUEST PLEASE CALL 403-244-3074 or EMAIL legacychildrens@shaw.ca - Thank you**

story:
The Scoop

My name's Kyle Roberts and my partner J.D. Junkins and I are opening up a new venue in Birmingham, AL on July 7th, 2012. Zion is going to be a place where kids can come hang out and feel safe while enjoying their favorite bands. We are going to be booking shows of all different genres and pride ourselves on a positive atmosphere. By positive atmosphere we mean that there won't be any drinking, smoking, cursing, or fighting. We will also be booking only bands that we see as positive..you won't have to worry about getting called out from the stage for your religious or political beliefs.

 

What We Need

We are asking for a measly $3,500 hundred bucks, but this money means the world to us and your experience at Zion. 

The money will help us to get over the hump of start-up costs, purchase a PA/Sound System and provide you with the best music experience possible. We need to buy banners, lights and concessions that will enhance Zion greatly.

We owe a great deal to The River Church for allowing us to put on shows in their building and the least we can do is help them with what will be a hefty power bill!

Lastly, we want to be able to pay the bands that spent their time rehearsing and drove(probably in a large van) out to our venue to play. 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone is gonna have the money to help financially in the next month, but there are other ways you can help! 

-Spread the word about Zion to everyone you know and those people on Facebook that added you because you may or may not know some mutual peeps.

-Volunteer your time at Zion. We need security guards, concession workers and strong backs to carry in the gear for the bands.

-Thoughts and prayers are needed as much as anything. We are a couple of Christian dudes trying to create a positive experience for young and old alike. HELP US..HELP YOU!

 

The Perks

We have done our best to set up some cool perks for you guys who have taken the time to read our ramblings and donate some of your hard-earned ca$h.

If you have any suggestions of more rewards, or anything related the Zion Music, you can E-mail us at zionvenu@gmail.com

story:
Who are we? We are a married string duo from the California/Nevada border looking to make our very first full-length album! We are inviting you (our friends, family, and fans) to take part in this fantastic journey of delicious Celternative sound-smithing. Ya dig?

What are we doing? The goal is to record and release 12 of our newest originals in CD, Vinyl, and Digital format for your listening pleasure. Writing songs is half the battle - we need your help to make it happen! After running the numbers and carefully cutting out unnecessary expenses, here is what our budget entails:

      • Recording, Mixing & Mastering - $1250

      • Artwork, Photography & Graphic Design - $500

      • Manufacturing & Distribution - $800

      • Marketing & Miscellaneous unforseen costs - $450

      (See video for more details)

 

What's in it for you? Our perks include (but are not necessarily limited to) T-Shirts, Posters, Pint Glasses, Signed copies of CD or Vinyl, Dinner with the Band, etc. Everyone who donates big or small will receive something in return, and it will probably be something... Gnarly.

Want to help in other ways? If you've read this far chances are you have a lot of love in your heart! Spread some of it around by taking the time to share our campaign or video on Social Media - it helps more than you may realize!

 

Thanks for looking, you rock! Xoxo

- Jacob & Emily Nolen, aka The Gnarly Pints

story:
Short Summary

Brett Weller and The Congregation (BWTC) is an inspirational band hailing from New Orleans. Joining with frontman Brett Weller and his unique rhythm-guitar groove, is a collective of artists adding a variety of styles. It has been said that BWTC brings “a gumbo of sound” to the table. Similar to the likes of Switchfoot, Mumford & Sons, and John Mark McMillan, the band does not shy from it’s roots of faith, but channels it into anthems of life, love, and honest humanity. Add this message to the band’s New Orleans’ funk groove, and you will find BWTC brings a sound that is truly music for the soul.

Brett Weller and The Congregation needs your support to record and release a new album! Over the past couple of years, fans of our New Orleans based funk-rock band, have been asking the question, “When will we get to hear these songs on a record?”. The truth of the matter (and one that we all know) is that recording and releasing a record cost a good bit of money. Of course, some bands sign a record deal which covers the studio, release, and promotional cost of a record; however, the band itself still has to find a way to pay that money back. This is not the situation BWTC finds ourselves in for this recording project. What we want to do is find our fans across the country, make new ones along the way, and ask YOU to help us fund this project! In return, we have a number of really special gifts we wish to bestow upon you to show our appreciation of your support!

The next couple of paragraphs are just more info on the band. If you would like to stop here, and start supporting this project then scroll down to "What We Need & What You Get"! 

In 2015, Brett Weller began to collaborate heavily with other members of BWTC in order to discover the core sound of Brett Weller and The Congregation. Later that year the band released their single “Without a Trace” which was unlike anything the group had recorded before. This single set the tone of what the band was looking to bring to the table. Since then, the next step has been to release a full album representing this new wave of BWTC songs. Throughout the past couple of years, the band has continued to write and introduce new songs to fans at shows in order to best determine which songs will make it to the recording floor. 

We are very excited to announce that the songs we have been working on for this album are finally ready to record. We want to do the absolute best we can with your support! As an independent band, there is a limitation to what we can do ourselves. The level of support you provide will determine what we are able to accomplish.

 

What We Need & What You Get

In simple words, we are asking YOU to be our record label. We are currently asking for at least $4,000 to get us started. This will help cover tracking, basic mixing, and distribution. If we exceed this goal then it will only help us to put more funds into the album, pay more talented people to get involved, and make this project the best album we can for you!

For your support we have a entire tour of perks to explore. Visit the perks section of our campaign to take a tour through our home town, New Orleans. Each street you visit will give you something to pick up along way. Start your tour on Canal Street and if you are feeling really generous then head on all the way through the city to the big prize on St. Charles Avenue. Each street's perk adds on to the previous perk's package.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute financially, we understand! There are many ways you can still help us get the word out. Please consider sharing the link to our campaign and/or our promotional campaign video to your Facebook, website, and blogs.  There is a great "share" link at the top of our Indiegogo campaign that will send your followers directly to this campaign page.  

More Info

BWTC is part of The Restoration Collective. Find out more about the Collective and how you can be a part HERE.   Follow BWTC today on Facebook and Instagram!

story:
Hey guys, My Heart to Fear just got out of the studio with our brand new LP "Into The Maelstrom." We are very excited to show all of you the new music and hope you really enjoy it. We have been touring hard these last few years and all of our gear has really taken a beating from the 150-175 shows a year. We need some help raising some funds for some new equipment to continue doing what we love to do. If this is your first time discovering an Indiegogo project, welcome! It’s a fantastic way for family, friends, and fans to financially support the art they love. We have put together a list of items and services we are ready to provide to our contributors. We get to put time and care into each package we send out once the project is done. In doing that, we will also get to know a lot of you better, or for the first time. This might just be the most fun part of our project! Simply put, it breaks down like this: we need 500 people to give $20. Only $20!

 

     The ilovemhtf project will be a milestone for our band, and for us as individuals. We want to make you every bit a part of our musical journey as we are. My Heart to Fear lives, sings, and plays because of your love and support. So help us out! Tell your friends! Spread the word! Every little bit you give helps. Together, you and My heart to Fear will be a part of our journey.

 

My Heart to Fear will be posting videos throughout the next 60 days with updates on our progress!

My Heart to Fear lives, sings, and plays because of your love and support. So help us out! Tell your friends! Spread the word! Every little bit you give helps. Together, you and My heart to Fear will be a part of our journey.    My Heart to Fear will be posting videos throughout the next 60 days with updates on our progress!

story:
`My Story

Since the 6th grade, I have been writing and recording music with many talented musicians. Between the Urban Funk Monkeys, Strike of the Heart, other smaller projects including a jazz quartette, and producing an EP by Jared Vincent, I have put a lot of music on tape. However, throughout all of this time, I have never had the opportunity to record my own music, unless it was done in my basement or apartment using Garageband on my MacBook. Now I am setting out to record my very own, 10 track, nicely polished, solo album.  


The Impact

Aside from playing music, I also perform in musical theater. Over the last few years, I find myself having to submit music, or recordings of me playing different instruments. Productions of Buddy: The Buddy Holly Story, or American Idiot, and the like, require that you play instruments. However, I have never had my own recordings to submit. I would like to finally have material of my own to represent myself professionally, while also trying to branch outside of theater and into the music world.


The Plan

I will be using Studio Crash in Philadelphia, PA, where I have worked previously on a demo for Strike of the Heart. After talking with the owner, Michael Harmon, about the breakdown of each song, how long everything will take to record, master, and then press, we came up with the $7,000 budget that I am asking your help with. After recording, mixing and mastering are complete, the album will be printed on CD and also available online for download!


If I don't reach my goal of $7,000, I still want to record. I will use what I have to produce a shorter EP. I would still  make it available online and use it to represent my own material in the professional world. 


In a nutshell: No matter what the final amount raised, music will be made!


Other Ways You Can Help

I would absolutely love it if, whether or not you can contribute financially, you could help me spread the word about my IndieGoGo campaign. You can post links on your Facebook page, Twitter, or even sending the link through email. More people being aware of my project would help enormously and your help would be greatly appreciated!
