story:
Summary

This is the campaign page dedicated to ultra high performance Geek Source music server, designed and assembled by LH Labs. We put every product technical details and design progress here. And this page is designed for the backers who backed Geek Source music server already. 

Three major design goals: 

  • Build a stable and yet future proof high res music playback platform
  • Design to be "audio" optimized from the software to hardware
  • Provide great connectivity via WiFi, ethernet and easy to expand storage space



How we make it future-proof

Originally Geek Source just like other music servers on the market, we developed a nice PCB from standard PC that with the Intel standard CPU, situate hard drives or solid state drive there. It works ok; but we know that is not ideal. So there are three things we decided to push the envelope a bit more. 

  1. Instead of using more power consuming standard PC CPU, we decide to use a more future-proof Quad core ARM core CPU. It reduced the power related high frequency noise, the system doesn't need a noisy fan inside anymore.
  2. By using System On Module (SOM) design, Geek Source could even upgrade the CPU in future when you needed. All related power supply and cache got upgraded too. All you need to do is pop-out the SOM card and insert the new one. Job done! 
  3. USB 2.0 audio output like everybody else?  No. Let's make it real 3.0. From the CPU decoding to internal transmission bus, all the way to the end of USB 3.0 SuperSpeed output IC. No compromise here. Not limited to 480M bps transmission speed anymore, now you have 5G bps. 10X more.
     


Geek Source Overview

As its name suggests, Geek Source is THE BEST music source in your home stereo. Geek Source is the most powerful and high-end music server available for under $1500. It was also specifically designed with the modern high definition DAC in mind. 

  • Geek Source features a whopping 2TB (4TB optional) of internal hard drive storage space. That's enough space to store 5000+ Hi-Rez tracks or 50,000+ CD quality tracks!
  • Built in Double Phase Re-Clock Jitter Elimination circuit for all output digital circuits. Every digital output is precisely timed making it the perfect fit for any system that has a dedicated DAC.
  • Many of us have trouble playing FLAC or DSD files with iTunes. Fret no more. Geek Source is a high resolution music playing specialist. Looking to play FLAC, DSD, DSD2, DXD and 384K? Geek Source handles it all.
  • Dedicated USB 3.0 audio port output with a noise free power supply. This isn't your Grandpa's PC or MAC music server. Geek Source is a super high speed playback machine.
  • Less noise, more music. Geek Source has an external power supply, keeping the bad noise at bay while letting the good noise (your tasty tunes) in.


Industry leading USB 3.0 output HD music server 

Connect a nice USB cable from Geek Source to Pulse DAC and you're ready to rock. Did we mention that the USB output for Geek Source is in SuperSpeed USB 3.0 port? By this future-proof design, you would be able to play even higher resolution or multichannel high resolution music file in future. If you have our LightSpeed USB 10G cable too, you could make sure your music system definitely has enough bandwidth for your highest sampling rate music file.


Optional Triple Femto Clocks

In the beginning of the design, we put optional Dual Femto clocks for all the SPIDE/AES audio outputs. One is for 44.1K band sampling rate (44.1K/88.2K/176.4K) and the other is for 48K band sampling rate (48K/96K/192K).
 With several deep researches, we decided to put optional 3rd Femto level clocks that dedicated to USB 3.0 interface alone. Benefit? We will reduce the USB audio output signal jitter even lower which translated into a much more stable sound stage and natural music when you use your USB DAC.


The technical specifications of Geek Source  (Platform part)

We know you care about every details of this design. So let's start with the essential platform part. 

(Please download the PDF here)

This platform use Quad Core ARM core CPU with ultra-fast NAND storage and eMMC flash as secondary cache. SATA II interface will direct connect to your 2T or 4T or higher capacity hard drive there. The power supply of these hard drive has special design to block out the mechanical generated power surge noise. 

Geek Source has full size SDXC card slot, high speed WiFi interface and 1000M Ethernet to provide all the extension and connectivity you need. 

You could choose Solid State Drive (SSD) as an option. So there will be NO mechanical spinning parts inside your Geek Source. Absolute quiet! The life span of SSD should be more stable too. 


The technical specifications of Geek Source  (Audio related part)

Second part of specifications will give you more details about "Audio related" design. 

(Please download the PDF here)

First of all, SPDIF and AES/EBU output will be well controlled by ultra low jitter TCXO audio clocks. Again, this is not ordinary PC music server. If you ask something even better, Geek Source Femto will provide dual audio master clocks that controls all the digital audio outputs? These Femto clocks' jitter is 100 times less the the ordinary clocks you will find on the market.

The AOS (Audio optimized Operation System) is another essential part of the whole platform. We wrote the software dedicated to all audio transmission path. From CPU, to internal bus transmission, to USB 3.0 IC all the way out. The whole system boot up super fast and still kept very stable for running in weeks. 

DSD native output via either DSD over PCM (DoP) or native DSD protocol are all provided. Compared to the original specification we had, now we make it even higher to DSD256. 


Unique Dual Power Design

Larry designed a complex power supply star system for the whole Geek Source board. From the beginning of power input, we have TWO separated 12V DC input sockets. One dedicated to audio related circuit, if you have Pulse LPS4 or LPS8, that is the place you should plug-in. It will use its Super Quiet Linear Power to power up the master audio clocks (Femto clocks), USB 3.0 output part, and digital clocks transmission IC.

The other socket provide the power for the rest, including CPU, WiFi, Hard drive, and our 5'' touch screen. 

For your convenience, if you want to plug-in one power only. That is no problem. The main power socket will automatic power up the audio power socket if there is no audio power plug-in. 


Chassis Design



The design goal is to make the chassis fully integrated with your potential Vi DAC and Pulse DAC. The different element we have considered is the internal chassis volume that is good enough for air flow and mechanical hard drive. Also, our goal is to make swap hard drive in/out EASILY enough that you don't need to send back your unit. 

Front panel design is a complete new design of works that inherit the spirit of Vi DAC design elements. (See the "V" shape there). Due to the center touch screen size, it is not 100% copy and clone from Vi DAC chassis.

The chassis dimension is FULL rack mount size. 16.5'' wide, with a good 4.5'' height that could fit in our 6.5'' inches lovely touch screen. The touch screen is capacitive type and has its own separate software module to work with AOS. We could separately  update this User Interface firmware when necessary. 

Dimension:  16.5'' (420mm) Width , 8.3'' (210mm) Depth,  4.5'' (113mm) Height.


Indiegogo Crowd-design only perks

* USB 3.0 Audio Output Upgrade
Yes. We love to provide you upgrade possibilities. Future proof. And this time, thanks for your patience for our design time. (We know it is been one year and more), we decide to make this upgrade FREE for every Geek Source backers!!

* Ultra-low ESR Power Cap Upgrade

Larry believes the best power supply is the foundation of everything. We will install 5 special low ESR Power capacitors in strategic important places for the mother board. Where is the most important places?  Core S.O.M, digital audio output and USB 3.0 port! thanks for your patience for our design time. We decide to make this upgrade FREE for every Geek Source backers!!


* Power Cap upgrade Plus: For the people who back the power cap upgrade before, We will enhance the following: Besides the 5 low ESR caps that everyone has, there will be 10 more ultra high speed PPS bypass power caps to replace the original MLCC capacitors. Bring down the 10M Hz above noise 6 dB more around the digital audio output and USB 3.0 audio output. 

Let's call it "Power Cap upgrade Plus"!


* Geek Source Plus upgrade.  The original design in the campaign was the Intel PC architecture. Now we change to ARM core based with SOM modular design. The benefit of that is future proof. Also bring one good benefit: We don't need to boot up the operation system from hard drive. All Geek Source boot up from the EMMC flash. So in the spirit of "Plus" upgrade, we add the 64G ultra high speed flash as separate cache  and add more layer of cache dedicated to USB audio output usage which will further reduce the output jitter. 


* Dual Femto Clocks Upgrade

Upgrade the two audio clocks inside Geek Source to customized, lowest-jitter, USA-made Crystek TCXO clocks. This special upgrade will belong to the Indiegogo backers who pledge this upgrade during the campaign. Expect the price will be at least double for this configuration in MSRP. 

As for the third Femto clock that works with USB 3.0 output. We will update more information for the final details.


Roon and Tidal support in software

In our current internal beta software, we already structured a good framework for support these two great services in near future. With Roon service enabled, you could use Geek Source with local/remote music library, and works perfectly with Tidal lossless music service too. 


Current Development Progress 

[updated in Dec.8-2015]

The whole development progress is a long journey. Thanks for the support from our backers. We are able to focus on the technology improvement and make the best music server on the market. 


There are five more items need to be finished as we saw in the chart. Internal storage (hard drive) mechanical design is the target this month. And we are working with our WiFi module provider to make sure what is the problem. Software part is very time consuming but our plan is to ship something has core function smooth and add the new features via software upgrades. 
The most important thing here is definitely USB 3.0 interface. We already optimized the 5V power supply there, tested noise level is 5.7uV (20~20K), but we really hope to maximize the signal through put by the putting an even better USB 3.0 IC which has been used in many advanced industrial grade computer server.
We will keep this section updated bi-weekly until we finish all the remaining pieces.

FAQ


1. Will Geek Source support I2S over HDMI?
Answer: Yes. 
2. How Geek Source connect with Pulse DAC or Vi DAC?
Answer: You could choose from USB (preferred) or AES/EBU or Coaxial (least preferred)
3. Why design team decide to change from Intel CPU to ARM core CPU?
Answer: We tested between different platforms. ARM Core CPU's OS foot print is smaller and energy consumption is lower. So we could provide cleaner and better decoupling caps there which will lower the potential output high frequency noise. 
4. Why you let OS all run from flash instead of hard disk?
Answer: The boot up time is faster. It works quiet.  And you could make your mechanical hard drive a TOTAL music file storage. Easier for you to swap.
5. How will you guys design the power supply? Is it linear?
Answer: We will update another concise chart for power distribution. All of the core audio circuit and USB 3.0 related circuit are powered by ultra low noise linear power supply. Not a single point compromised.

story:
Hello friends!

Here I am, humbly asking for your support to make a new record of songs written to the poetry of Edna St. Vincent Millay.

Last summer, stuck in a bit of a writing rut, I took the advice of my therapist and opened a book of poetry and sat at the piano. I had only read a poem or two of Millay in the past, but hers was the book I chose. Within 2 hours, I had written 3 songs. Our voices seemed to mingle quite well. The next day, I sat down at the piano again, re-visited the songs I had written, liked them, and decided to keep going. By the end of the third day, I had 12 songs.

They sat in my voice memos for about 6 months. I checked in on them once in a while, still liked them and thought, "What am I going to do with these?" I really connected with her writing. It is liberating to sing someone else's words, and Edna has a beautiful mix between heavy/sorrowful and light/playful.

One day I sat down in the studio and actually starting arranging one of the songs, "Ashes of Life," and I started to get excited about this material. I started on another, "Sorrow," and actually hired some horn players to give it this brassy, bluesy kind of feeling. It is so fun to build songs from the ground up and give these poems new lives.

So I decided I would make a record of all the songs.

But I need help.

The Poems

These are the initial twelve poems I wrote songs to:

  • Ashes of Life
  • Sorrow
  • Elaine
  • She is Overheard Singing
  • Portrait by a Neighbor
  • Daphne
  • Tavern
  • Witch-Wife
  • The Penitent
  • Midnight Oil
  • Mariposa
  • Exiled

When I played them for Sunny, he asked why there wasn't a train song, so I found one called "Travel" which I may include as well.

How you can help

The easiest thing to do is to donate some money to this project. Here are some of my anticipated costs:

  • Co-Producer - While I can do a lot of the heavy lifting of arranging and recording these songs, I need a partner in crime to help me get the sounds I am hearing in my head, to engineer and produce my vocal performances, and to mix the songs when the recording is done.
  • Musicians - I can play a lot of the instruments, but having some other voices in the mix will give this record more variety. Horns, strings - these are things I cannot do myself
  • Mastering - when the mixes are done, the final touch to make it all sound cohesive.
  • Distribution - the first goal is to make a record for an online release, but if I were to raise enough, I would love to make a physical copy on vinyl.

 

But...

You are a musician and you are broke - "Sure Mustang, I'd throw you a couple of bucks, but I haven't had a gig for a year" - I hear you!

I would gladly accept a donation of a guitar part, a sax solo, or an offer to mix one of the songs. Just let me know and I'll make it work!

Maybe you want to come in and shoot some footage of the creation process - or make a music video! Or some album art.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't throw down, either financially or artistically, I only ask that you share this campaign with anyone you think might have some interest. I really want to get these songs out into the world, and every little bit will help me reach that goal.

Thanks!

Love,

Dave/Mustang

But I need help.
The Poems

These are the initial twelve poems I wrote songs to:

Ashes of Life
Sorrow
Elaine
She is Overheard Singing
Portrait by a Neighbor
Daphne
Tavern
Witch-Wife
The Penitent
Midnight Oil
Mariposa
Exiled

When I played them for Sunny, he asked why there wasn't a train song, so I found one called "Travel" which I may include as well.


How you can help
The easiest thing to do is to donate some money to this project. Here are some of my anticipated costs:

Co-Producer - While I can do a lot of the heavy lifting of arranging and recording these songs, I need a partner in crime to help me get the sounds I am hearing in my head, to engineer and produce my vocal performances, and to mix the songs when the recording is done.
Musicians - I can play a lot of the instruments, but having some other voices in the mix will give this record more variety. Horns, strings - these are things I cannot do myself
Mastering - when the mixes are done, the final touch to make it all sound cohesive.
Distribution - the first goal is to make a record for an online release, but if I were to raise enough, I would love to make a physical copy on vinyl.

 
But...
You are a musician and you are broke - "Sure Mustang, I'd throw you a couple of bucks, but I haven't had a gig for a year" - I hear you!
I would gladly accept a donation of a guitar part, a sax solo, or an offer to mix one of the songs. Just let me know and I'll make it work!
Maybe you want to come in and shoot some footage of the creation process - or make a music video! Or some album art.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't throw down, either financially or artistically, I only ask that you share this campaign with anyone you think might have some interest. I really want to get these songs out into the world, and every little bit will help me reach that goal.
Thanks!
Love,
Dave/Mustang

story:
Now I Am Become Oni Jijo (oh-nee he-ho), an album of music composed by Now I Am Become Death, also known as Blake Ortego, for the in production game, Oni Jijo. A genre-less, instrumental composition created to evoke a sense of space and to provoke an emotional response instead of catering to one. The composition is not bound to or emulating a particular sound, but some influences include Tangerine Dream, Geinoh Yamashirogumi, New Order, Nujabes, Merzbow, and Phil Niblock.

   Oni Jijo is a game in development by Blake Trahan. In it, you play as Grer (gr-air), a young adult woman living in a world at the verge of its technological epoch. An unexpected disaster strikes civilization, killing Grer in the process. After years spanning an unimaginable amount of time, Grer is brought back to life by a strange entity left behind by humanity. Oni Jijo is about leaving home, going back, and leaving again. It's not really knowing what home is supposed to be. It's wondering if home is a worthwhile description for anywhere on this strange planet.

   Though the album can stand alone, it goes hand in hand with the game creatively; they both inspire and influence each other. The album is full of exploration and discovery, as is the game.


   Now I Am Become Oni Jijo is essentially an electronic album, but the objective is to rerecord the music in real world environments to add natural space and feel. The process will involve amplifying the music in various locations such as the desert, mountains, and beach, and recapturing the audio through quality microphones placed at large distances away. The end result will create a very wide and lush stereo experience with natural ambiance and space. This project will also serve a secondary purpose of building a high quality field recording library which will be used for the game Oni Jijo, as well as other future productions.




   The recording process will require time, travel, and funds. With roughly two weeks of travel by car, over 3000 miles, funding will go towards gas, food and lodging. Most of the recording will be done in New Mexico and Colorado, in places such as White Sands, Valley of Fires, Estes Park, and Pike National Forest. 

   Another objective is to release the album on CD. A large percentage of the money raised will be going towards the production of 300-500 quality compact discs and packaging. 

   Additional funds raised will go towards equipment needed for the recording process. While I already own some of what is needed for the recording, there are additional project specific pieces of equipment that will be needed as well. Due to the nature of this project, I will need a portable power supply, a small efficient PA system, various long quality cables, and data storage.

   The remaining funds will cover other expenses which include additional reward costs, shipping the rewards, and Indiegogo fees.



   As the campaign progresses, various rewards will be available to the public according to the total funds raised.


$500 Reached!





   This project is fairly risk free, though the estimated production times could vary. The recording process should be finished by the end of October, though due to variable circumstances, it could take longer.

   With any amount of travel, things such as weather and vehicle trouble could play a roll in delaying schedules. I will be using a newer vehicle in great condition to reduce the potential for road trouble.

   The production of the CD's may also vary in time. I plan on using Disc Makers for the production, who are noted as a reliable company. Though as with any company, there could be delays due to work load at the time of order. I will have the master disc and art work proofed and ready well before hand to ensure the smoothest transaction possible.



   Thank you for your consideration towards Now I Am Become Oni Jijo. Any support is very much appreciated, as this project is very important to me.

story:
Introduction

Caleb Davidson, singer/songwriter from The Big Island of Hawai`i has learned to find peace and understanding through music. His passion for turning his spiritual journey into music has yielded many opportunities to share what God has been teaching him through song. After a tough lesson of trust and reliance through heartbreak, Caleb is excited to share Dreamed, a melancholic song about learning to let go of his preconceived reality of God’s will for his life to embrace a trust in His guidance and power. 

Project Summary

We prayed and dreamed 

and saw colors that we'd never ever seen. 

We play and sing

thinking the voyage was of clairvoyance of scenes

Without giving away too much, these lyrics basically define the concept of the story and shape the visual style of the music video.

Synopsis: A young man finds himself disoriented in the middle of his dreams. A young lady, His treasured love, leads him on a journey of discovery. When things are not as they seem, to make peace between his dream world and reality, he learns to let go and trust in the Creator of love.

Theme: We often get caught up in the search for signs about the future regarding our hopes and dreams that we end up losing touch with ourselves, with reality, and the present journey that is meant to help us grow into our true destiny. 

Visual Style/Mood: Romance drama | Melancholic yet Hopeful | Experimental/Surreal

Location: The story takes place during the fall season in Colorado at a castle surrounded by mountains, lakes, and forests.

Sneak Peek Sketches

What We Need

We need to raise $3,000.

The expenses for this project covers the following:

  • Transportation
  • Gas money
  • Food
  • Location permit/donation (a percentage of the donation is to go to the Charity for New-Born Heart Surgery that help local families without medical insurance)
  • Event Insurance
  • Lodging
  • Production Design Essentials

These include expenses for a crew of five, for a four day trip film shoot.

What You Get

  • Personalized shout-out's and thank you's
  • Opportunity to receive credit in the video
  • Chance to collect a limited-edition of the single's art-prints or the music video's official poster designed by Ryan Brennan with a personalized handwritten message from Caleb.

The Impact

Simply said, your contribution will help make a dream come true. This is not only Caleb's passion project, this is a collaboration of film students who live for the opportunity to share what they have learned about life from a different perspective and make a difference. Supporting this project would help us as a team to grow in our careers. It would be an encouragement to know that others are interested in our story, our work, and future projects as filmmakers and musicians. 

Risks & Challenges

Shooting a video is always challenging especially making sure everyone is on the same page with regards to the vision and coordinating everyone's schedule. Since we plan to film out of state, our biggest challenge will be raising $350 as soon as possible to ensure housing for the crew. With your help, hopefully we can reach our first goal by the end of the month to lock in our reservation. Our housing reservation affects our limited budget which in return affects the opportunity given to film at the preferred location to enhance the story and production value of the music video. Nevertheless, because of the amount of pre-planning already completed we are prepared for whatever issues may arise and are confident that with your help this project will become a reality.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the Word! Utilize our social media tools and tell a friend to tell a friend. Every bit counts!

Blessings!

story:
Dear beings, 

8 years ago I packed my ’86 Ford truck, left Colorado, and moved to California in pursuit of my passions. 

After years of working on many projects and collaborations I am now ready to branch out on my own. Music serves many mediums. I direct mine not only for songwriting, but working with meditation, children and animals.  I feel the calling to sit quiet, listen and write in a redefined space.  One that is both ageless yet young.

I am in the process of making my first solo record. I need your support on this journey. The funds raised will allow me to finish the production of this record! For years now I have been working with a dream that is asking to show itself in real time. There are moments I have been the observer, separate from body, and now I mold the two with the soul. I have learned recently that making music has become a practice.  Something like a ritual where I can embrace a feeling and watch it unfold. It is a place I go to out of curiosity and comfort. A place that forms the expression through the act of nurturing. A place of understanding through body and spirit. 

So far in the process of making this record I have learned to be more gentle with myself and to listen more to the teachings of the earth. I have learned that the voice carries movement for our ancestors and those unable to speak. I see music as health and a source of therapy. I can’t wait to share this record with you.

with love, 

Haile 

 

Where the funds are going...

  • production
  • recording 
  • mixing of songs
  • mastering
  • live tracking room
  • vinyl
  • musicians playing on the record
  • marketing

story:
Since Jan ’17, The Fabricators have been chilling the spines of audiences all over London with their distinct brand of dark alt-rock. They have now captured the noise on record for their debut album, ‘New Bad News'.

Written and recorded in the snow and sun of spring ‘18, the 11 tracks are a daring and original take on guitar music, psychedelia, surrealism and 21st-century paranoia. The results are unexpectedly uplifting – an accompaniment and antidote to the chaos of modern life.

The defining quality of ‘New Bad News’ is its restlessness. Schizophrenic dynamism flows through unique song structures and beguiling rhythm changes, making the album unignorable from start to finish. A heady mixture of gut-punching guitar filth and shimmering melody infect the ears as the audio landscape sways from jagged punk to muscular indie to bullish psychedelia.

It’s a mission statement realised.
It’s screeching, hollering and convulsive.

It’s Emily Ratajkowski wallowing in a sewer.

This is the New Bad News...

We are currently in the midst of mixing and mastering what we think will be an awe-inspiring album!....however...we are running out of money to complete our project. 

Basically, we're skint. And we know full well that an audience as intelligent (and attractive) as you will have twigged what's coming next... 

...Friends, family, fans… once again The Fab Four must ask too much of you…

We need YOUR hard-earned cash to help us complete, promote, release, and tour our first album – a collection of spine-chilling, psychedelic, often funny, always fab, alt-rock bangers.

'What’s in it for me?' we hear you ask whilst reaching confidently and bravely for your wallet.

Not only will we deliver an outstanding debut album into your lives and libraries, and play it in person for you wherever the hell you are, but those who pledge will also get:

- £5: Overt public Facebook compliments from the whole band
- £10: A love poem from Frontman Monsieur James Matejka
- £15: An original song on a theme of your choosing from guitarist Mark Beckett
- £20: A Fabricators ‘New Bad News’ t-shirt
- £30: An original bespoke Marcus Aitken artwork
- £50: All the above in one sweet Fabricators package

- £100: All the above + Free entry to all Fabricators shows for the next year, plus band hugs (if you want them).
- £350: All the above + A special Fabricators private gig
- £500: All the above + Compliant enslavement of all band members until death...or until we break up :0

We would be immeasurably grateful if you could help us get our music out there to people whose lives it will vastly improve.

Long live The Fabricators, and LONG LIVE CHARITY!

Thank you.

To follow our adventure follow our fb page: https://www.facebook.com/thefabricatorsmusic/

To hear our music follow the link to our Spotify page:https://open.spotify.com/artist/4ZcXewysnMshSjD...

Thank you for your support, 

xoxo from The Fabricators

story:
Orange ’Ear 


Orange ’Ear ist eine Konzertreihe in unserer Ladenwohnung in Berlin-Friedrichshain. Begegnen wir Musikern, die uns beeindrucken, öffnen wir unser Wohnzimmer für ein Konzert der besonderen Art: Die Musiker spielen bei freiem Eintritt vor aufmerksamen Publikum in privater Atmosphäre. In unserem videostudioartigen Set zeichnen wir die Live-Auftritte mit mehreren Kameras und aufwendigem Soundrecording auf. Dabei sind wir ganz nah an den Musikern dran und fangen den Live-Charakter der Performance ein.

Orange ’Ear ist ein Non-Profit-Projekt und stellt die veröffentlichten Live-Videos den Künstlern frei zur Verfügung.

Orange 'Ear is a concert series that takes place in our shop/living space in Berlin-Friedrichshain. Musicians who have made a particular impression on us are invited to play for free in our living room before an attentive audience in an intimate atmosphere. We record the live performances with our video-studio-like set-up from multiple cameras and the utmost of care. We therefore remain extremely close to the musicians and are able to capture the live nature of the performances in a unique way.

Orange 'Ear is proudly Non-Profit and makes its live videos available to the artists for free.

Die Orange 'Ear-Tour

Nun möchte Orange ’Ear auf Reisen gehen: Mit ein paar Kameras, einem Tonmischpult, etwas Filmlicht, einer guten Campingausrüstung und ein paar Orangen im Gepäck, möchte Orange ’Ear im Mai 2015 Musik auf Island aufnehmen.

Auf der einmonatigen Orange ’Ear-Tour fahren wir von Ort zu Ort. In kleinen Ansiedlungen abseits der Ringstraße oder in der Metropole Reykjavík bitten wir die ortsansässigen Musiker für Orange ’Ear zu spielen. Dabei spüren wir bestimmt punkrockende Schüler, einen immigrierten ungarischen Tenor, oder Gärtnerinnen, die virtuos die singende Säge spielen, auf.

Damit Du miterleben kannst, was wir entdecken, veröffentlichen wir die auf Island produzierten Videos auf unserer Homepage.

But now it is time for Orange 'Ear to take to the road: with a few cameras, a mixing board, some film lights, a trustworthy bit of camping gear, and a few oranges, in May 2015 Orange 'Ear is going to go on a music recording tour of Iceland. Throughout the month we will be travelling from town to town. In tiny places beyond the ring road as well as in Reykjavík we are going to be asking local musicians to play for us. From punk rock playing school kids, to Hungarian tenors, and gardener – virtuosos of the singing saw  – we are open to and ready for it all. 

So that you can be a part of everything we discover, we will be offering the videos we produce in Iceland through our website.

Island 

Island haben wir in vielen Reisen kennen gelernt. Die Natur, das nordische Licht, die Mentalität und Individualität der Menschen hat uns beeindruckt. Aber wirklich gefangen genommen hat uns der isländische Umgang mit Musik:

In diesem kleinen, zauberhaften Land ist es eine alltägliche Selbstverständlichkeit eigene Songs zu machen. Selbst in kleinsten Dörfern findet man Bands, die anspruchsvolle Musik mit ganz eigenem Sound produzieren.

Bei unseren bisherigen Islandaufenthalten haben wir oft erfahren, dass die Isländer gerne spontan, bereitwillig und unkompliziert auch etwas abwegig erscheinende Anliegen unterstützen. So fragten wir in der Tankstelle des kleinen Ortes Flateyri in den abgelegenen Westfjorden nach dem legendären Tonstudio Tankurinn. Über mehrere schnelle Telefonate, einen Umweg über die Kneipe und einem Abschlusskonzert der ortsansässigen Musikschule konnte uns der Toningenieur noch am selben Nachmittag durch das Studio, das in einem alten runden Betontank der ehemaligen Walstation eingebaut war, führen. Am nächsten Abend hatte er für uns sogar eine spontane Recordingsession mit drei Bands organisiert.

Over the last five years we have gotten to know Iceland through numerous trips. Its nature, the quality of its northern light, the mentality, and the people’s individuality have made an unforgettable impression on us. But what really caught us more than anything else was Iceland’s relationship to music: In this small and magical land making music is almost a part of the daily routine. Even in the tiniest of villages you can find both individuals and bands making singular and challenging music with their totally own sound. 

In our experience Icelanders often eagerly and spontaneously support even somewhat “odd” sounding projects. For example, we remember asking once at the gas station in the town of Flateyri in the remote West Fjords about the legendary Tankurinn studios. After a number of rapid phone calls, a detour through a bar, and a closing concert at the local music school, the recording engineer took us on a tour of his studio, which is built in an old round concrete tank of a former whaling station. The following evening he had even organized an impromptu recording session with three bands for us.

Das Funding

Wir betreiben Orange 'Ear seit 5 Jahren aus unserer Leidenschaft zur Musik. Uns ist es wichtig, dass wir ohne finanziellen Profit Musiker mit unseren Mitteln fördern und Neues entdecken und genießen können. Bei Orange 'Ear zu Hause in Berlin können wir die Unkosten der Konzertreihe aus eigenen Mitteln stemmen.

Auch bei der Orange 'Ear-Tour tragen wir selber die Kosten für den Aufenthalt, die Fahrten und die Produktionskosten auf der Insel.

Um die Kosten vor Ort gering zu halten, möchten wir mit der Autofähre Norröna nach Island fahren. So können wir im eigenen Auto das Orange 'Ear-Equipment transportieren, es fallen keine Kosten für ein Mietauto an und wir können mit unserer island-erprobten Ausrüstung auf Campingplätzen übernachten.

Mit dieser Kampagne möchten wir die 1720 Seemeilen von Hirtshals (Dänemark) nach Seyðisfjörður (Island) und zurück finazieren. Für eine Seemeile benötigen wir 1,50 €. So bringst Du uns schon mit einem einzigen Song (Perk)  3,33333333333333333333333333333333333333 Seemeilen dem Traum Orange 'Ear to Iceland näher.

We have been running Orange 'Ear for five years because of our passion for music. It is important for us to be able to support musicians through our means at no financial profit and to be able to discover, and enjoy, the new. At our home in Berlin, Orange 'Ear is able to cover the costs of the concert series on its own. And even on the Orange 'Ear-Tour we will cover all of the housing, travel, and production costs ourselves. 

In order to keep costs down, however, we plan to take the auto-ferry Norröna over to Iceland. That way we will be able to transport Orange 'Ear’s equipment in our car, and we can use our foreknowledge of Iceland to plan overnight stays at campsites. 

The point of this campaign is to finance the actual 1720-nautical-mile trip from Hirtshals (Denmark) to Seyðisfjörður (Iceland) and back. One nautical mile costs €1.50. Therefore, with the purchase of just a single song you can already bring us 3,33333333333333333333333333333333333333 nautical miles closer to our dream!

(English translation by Alexander Booth)



Orange 'Ear Dankeschöns (Perks)

Free Download
Wir danken allen, die unsere Kampagne verbreiten, unterstützen oder in Gedanken mit Orange 'Ear reisen. Bitte hol Dir hier Dein Dankeschön ab:
Foto-Serie: Close to the North 

Deine Seemeilen – €5
Du erhältst ein Foto per Email der 3,333333333 Seemeilen, die Du bei der Orange 'Ear-Tour unterstützt hast. Wähle bitte: Bug, Luv, Heck, Lee

Song eines Orange 'Ear-Musikers – €5
Wähle einen Download-Song von Deinem Lieblingsmusiker, der schon bei Orange 'Ear aufgetreten ist:
Dizzy Moon – Your Wall
House of Light – House of Love
Jasmina Maschina – Asleep (minit variation)
Mary Ocher – The final embrace (Toto_s song)
Paulina June – All I have
The White Noise Supremacists – How Do You Wish To Go (acoustic)

Fotogruß – €10
Du erhältst einen Fotogruß mit einer Isländischen Landschaft per Email. Bitte wähle: Sonne, Wolken, Regen, Schnee (falls vorhanden)

Eis-Foto – €10
Du erhältst per Email ein Foto von einer Eisformation am Strand vom Jökulsá.
Der Strand aus Lavagestein liegt an der Mündung einer Gletscherlagune vom Vatnajökull. Hier werden die gekalbten Eisbrocken angetrieben und vom Meerwasser langsam geschmolzen. Die bizarren, transparenten Eisformationen auf dem schwarzen Kiesstrand regen uns immer zu ausgiebigen Fotosessions an. Die Foto-Ausbeute, die während der Orange 'Ear-Tour entsteht, möchten wir gerne mit Dir teilen.

Land in Sicht – €10
Nach 860 Seemeilen Schifffahrt erscheint Island am Horizont. Davon erhältst Du ein Foto per Email.

Isländischer Klingelton – €10
Wie nehmen auf  Island drei Töne auf, die für uns typisch isländisch sind und sich als Klingelton für Dein Mobiltelefon eignen. Du kannst wählen:
1. Die Stimme des Heiðlóa (Goldregenpfeiffer), der gut getarnt schwer in den weiten Moos- und Heideflächen zu finden ist, sich aber deutlich durch seinen charakteristischen Sound verrät. Eigentlich klingt er, als ob ein Akku dringend aufgeladen werden müsste.
2. Der Hrossagaukur (Pferdeschnepfe) erzeugt im provozierten freien Fall durch spezielle Flügelstellung einen unverwechselbaren Sound, um zu Balzen und sein Revier abzustecken.
3. Das Geläut der Hallgrímskirkja (Kirche auf dem höchsten Hügel der Innenstadt von Reykjavík) lässt einen von der nördlichst gelegenen Hauptstadt der Welt träumen.

Dizzy Moon (EP/CD)– €10 (limitiert)

Ein Cello & eine Stimme: Dizzy Moon ist ein Soloprojekt, in welchem die reichhaltige Klangwelt des Cellos mit Maryses klarer, sphärischer Stimme in eignenständiger und wundersamer Musik sehr einfühlsam kombiniert wird. Wir sind glücklich, hier Dizzy Moons brandneue EP "Secrets under the banyan tree" anbieten zu können.

Mona la Phona (Album/CD) – €12 (limitiert)
Mona la Phonas erstes Album „Time is a traveler“ besticht durch seinen Abwechslungsreichtum: Es gibt eigentlich nichts, was man nicht zu der Musik tun kann, außer vielleicht Headbangen. Entspannung ohne Langeweile wird garantiert durch verschiedenste Besetzungen: Die beiden Wahlberlinerinnen bekommen gerne Gesellschaft von Tele-Drummer Stefan Wittich und diversen Bassisten und Svenja simuliert gekonnt das Streichensemble, dass Mona La Phona nun auch ganz real live begleitet.

Goða Ferð  (Island-Reise DVD) – €15
Du erhältst den Film über das Reisen auf Island, den Frank 2010 produziert hat. Nähere Infos: www.island-dvd.de

Orange 'Ear Playlist – €25

Du erhältst eine Download-Playlist mit fast allen Musiker, die bisher bei Orange 'Ear gespielt haben. Die Playlist spiegelt die Orange 'Ear-Athmosphäre und -Idee wider. Künstler unterschiedlichsten Genres zeichnen sich durch ihre Einzigartigkeit aus.
Allie – Real Highlights
Anatopia – Quit
Atariame – BCN
Dizzy Moon – Your Wall
Entertainment for the Braindead – Gamble
F.S. Blumm – Hai
Friederike Lilien Abitz – (TBA)
Haruko – Come Home
Islaja – See No Sun
Janin Johannsen – Voiceless
Mary Ocher – The final embrace (Toto_s song)
Mona la Phona – Indefinite Time
Mute Swimmer – A word a curse
My Brother is Pale – Fields/I Forgot
Paulina June – All I have
Señor Marküsen – Pushk
Steev Lemercier – Back to the springs of my dreams
Stella Veloce – Traccia uno

Flaschenpost – €35 (limitiert)
Orange 'Ear verschickt in Deinem Namen eine Flaschenpost von der Norröna (Autofähre von Dänemark nach Island). Dazu teilst Du uns elektronisch oder analog (max. DinA4) die Nachricht mit, die Du in die Welt senden möchtest. Wir versiegeln sie in einer Flasche und übergeben sie während der Überfahrt der See. Du erhältst davon ein Handy-Video per Email und bestimmt eine Antwort auf Deine Nachricht aus der fernen Welt.

Widmung – €50 (limitiert)
Einer der Musiker wird Dir bei der Orange 'Ear-Aufnahme seinen Song auf Isländisch widmen. Du erhälst ein Web-Video deines Songs.

Ort Deiner Wahl – €100 (limitiert)
Du nennst uns einen Ort Deiner Wahl auf Island, der mit einem normalen Auto (kein 4WD!) erreichbar ist. Wir werden dorthin fahren und alles dafür tun, dort einen Musiker finden, der für ein Orange 'Ear-Video spielt. Natürlich kannst Du uns auch zu einem Musiker schicken, den Du persönlich auf der Insel kennst. Du erhälst das/die Web-Video(s) der Session.

Timelapse vom Jökulsárlón – €250 (limitiert)
Wir nehmen exklusiv für Dich eine ca. 30 sekündige Zeitraffer-Aufnahme von den treibenden Eisbergen im Jökulsárlón auf. Darin wird die Dynamik des blauen Eises in der spektakulären Gletscherlagune eingefangen und die erhabene Schönheit dieses außergewöhnlichen Naturschauspiels festgehalten. Da es wetterabhängig ist, wie intensiv blau das Eis leuchtet – dazu muss der Himmel bewölkt sein – können wir leider nicht für tiefblaues Eis garantieren, werden uns aber bemühen, zum richtigen Zeitpunkt mit der Timelapse-Ausrüstung bereit zu stehen, um in 30 min 750 Fotos für Deine Timelapse aufzunehmen. Die Timelapse erhältst Du zu Deiner freien Verwendung.

Sei ein Gast bei Orange 'Ear – €250 (limitiert)
Bist Du Mitte Mai 2015 auf Island? Dann kannst Du Gast bei der Aufzeichnung eines Orange 'Ear-Videos sein. Wir sprechen uns (ganz isländisch) vor Ort ab, wann wir uns wo bei welchem Musiker treffen und werden bestimmt einen unvergesslichen Tag gemeinsam mit dem Musiker verbringen.
story_txt:
Orange ’Ear Orange ’Ear ist eine Konzertreihe in unserer
Ladenwohnung in Berlin-Friedrichshain. Begegnen wir Musikern, die uns
beeindrucken, öffnen wir unser Wohnzimmer für ein Konzert der
besonderen Art: Die Musiker spielen bei freiem Eintritt vor
aufmerksamen Publikum in privater Atmosphäre. In unserem
videostudioartigen Set zeichnen wir die Live-Auftritte mit mehreren
Kameras und aufwendigem Soundrecording auf. Dabei sind wir ganz nah
an den Musikern dran und fangen den Live-Charakter der Performance
ein.

Orange ’Ear ist ein Non-Profit-Projekt und
stellt die veröffentlichten Live-Videos den Künstlern frei zur
Verfügung.
Orange 'Ear is a concert series that takes place in our shop/living space in Berlin-Friedrichshain. Musicians who have made a particular impression on us are invited to play for free in our living room before an attentive audience in an intimate atmosphere. We record the live performances with our video-studio-like set-up from multiple cameras and the utmost of care. We therefore remain extremely close to the musicians and are able to capture the live nature of the performances in a unique way.
Orange 'Ear is proudly Non-Profit and makes its live videos available to the artists for free.
Die Orange 'Ear-Tour Nun möchte Orange ’Ear auf Reisen gehen: Mit
ein paar Kameras, einem Tonmischpult, etwas Filmlicht, einer guten
Campingausrüstung und ein paar Orangen im Gepäck, möchte Orange ’Ear im Mai
2015 Musik auf Island aufnehmen.
Auf der einmonatigen Orange ’Ear-Tour fahren wir
von Ort zu Ort. In kleinen Ansiedlungen abseits der Ringstraße oder
in der Metropole Reykjavík bitten wir die ortsansässigen Musiker
für Orange ’Ear zu spielen. Dabei spüren wir bestimmt punkrockende Schüler,
einen immigrierten ungarischen Tenor, oder Gärtnerinnen, die virtuos
die singende Säge spielen, auf.  

Damit Du miterleben kannst, was wir
entdecken, veröffentlichen wir die auf Island produzierten Videos
auf unserer Homepage. 

But now it is time for Orange 'Ear to take to the road: with a few cameras, a mixing board, some film lights, a trustworthy bit of camping gear, and a few oranges, in May 2015 Orange 'Ear is going to go on a music recording tour of Iceland.
 Throughout the month we will be travelling from town to town. In tiny places beyond the ring road as well as in Reykjavík we are going to be asking local musicians to play for us. From punk rock playing school kids, to Hungarian tenors, and gardener – virtuosos of the singing saw  – we are open to and ready for it all. So that you can be a part of everything we discover, we will be offering the videos we produce in Iceland through our website.
Island Island haben wir in vielen Reisen
kennen gelernt. Die Natur, das nordische Licht, die Mentalität und
Individualität der Menschen hat uns beeindruckt. Aber wirklich
gefangen genommen hat uns der isländische Umgang mit Musik:
In diesem kleinen, zauberhaften Land
ist es eine alltägliche Selbstverständlichkeit eigene Songs zu
machen. Selbst in kleinsten Dörfern findet man Bands, die
anspruchsvolle Musik mit ganz eigenem Sound produzieren.
Bei unseren bisherigen
Islandaufenthalten haben wir oft erfahren, dass die Isländer gerne
spontan, bereitwillig und unkompliziert auch etwas abwegig
erscheinende Anliegen unterstützen. So fragten wir in der Tankstelle
des kleinen Ortes Flateyri in den abgelegenen Westfjorden nach dem
legendären Tonstudio Tankurinn. Über mehrere schnelle Telefonate,
einen Umweg über die Kneipe und einem Abschlusskonzert der
ortsansässigen Musikschule konnte uns der Toningenieur noch am
selben Nachmittag durch das Studio, das in einem alten runden
Betontank der ehemaligen Walstation eingebaut war, führen. Am
nächsten Abend hatte er für uns sogar eine spontane
Recordingsession mit drei Bands organisiert.

Over the last five years we have gotten to know Iceland through numerous trips. Its nature, the quality of its northern light, the mentality, and the people’s individuality have made an unforgettable impression on us. But what really caught us more than anything else was Iceland’s relationship to music: In this small and magical land making music is almost a part of the daily routine. Even in the tiniest of villages you can find both individuals and bands making singular and challenging music with their totally own sound. In our experience Icelanders often eagerly and spontaneously support even somewhat “odd” sounding projects. For example, we remember asking once at the gas station in the town of Flateyri in the remote West Fjords about the legendary Tankurinn studios. After a number of rapid phone calls, a detour through a bar, and a closing concert at the local music school, the recording engineer took us on a tour of his studio, which is built in an old round concrete tank of a former whaling station. The following evening he had even organized an impromptu recording session with three bands for us.
Das FundingWir betreiben Orange 'Ear seit 5 Jahren aus
unserer Leidenschaft zur Musik. Uns ist es wichtig, dass wir ohne
finanziellen Profit Musiker mit unseren Mitteln fördern und Neues
entdecken und genießen können. Bei Orange 'Ear zu Hause in Berlin können
wir die Unkosten der Konzertreihe aus eigenen Mitteln stemmen.
Auch bei der Orange 'Ear-Tour tragen wir selber
die Kosten für den Aufenthalt, die Fahrten und die Produktionskosten
auf der Insel. 

Um die Kosten vor Ort gering zu halten,
möchten wir mit der Autofähre Norröna nach Island fahren. So
können wir im eigenen Auto das Orange 'Ear-Equipment transportieren, es
fallen keine Kosten für ein Mietauto an und wir können mit unserer
island-erprobten Ausrüstung auf Campingplätzen übernachten.
Mit dieser Kampagne möchten wir die
1720 Seemeilen von Hirtshals (Dänemark) nach Seyðisfjörður (Island)
und zurück finazieren. Für eine Seemeile benötigen wir 1,50 €. So bringst Du uns schon mit einem einzigen Song (Perk) 
3,33333333333333333333333333333333333333 Seemeilen dem Traum Orange 'Ear to Iceland
näher.


We have been running Orange 'Ear for five years because of our passion for music. It is important for us to be able to support musicians through our means at no financial profit and to be able to discover, and enjoy, the new. At our home in Berlin, Orange 'Ear is able to cover the costs of the concert series on its own. And even on the Orange 'Ear-Tour we will cover all of the housing, travel, and production costs ourselves. In order to keep costs down, however, we plan to take the auto-ferry Norröna over to Iceland. That way we will be able to transport Orange 'Ear’s equipment in our car, and we can use our foreknowledge of Iceland to plan overnight stays at campsites. The point of this campaign is to finance the actual 1720-nautical-mile trip from Hirtshals (Denmark) to Seyðisfjörður (Iceland) and back. One nautical mile costs €1.50.
 Therefore, with the purchase of just a single song you can already bring us 3,33333333333333333333333333333333333333 nautical miles closer to our dream!(English translation by Alexander  Booth)

story:
Hey guys! My name is Patrick Hayes and I am the vocalist of the death metal band King Pariah from Upstate NY. I've been in the band for almost a year and it's the best thing that's ever happened to me. Music is my life and has been since I was really young. I love to sing but in my band, I only scream. My family doesn't exactly enjoy me being in a death metal band but that doesn't stop me from doing what I love. Singing is a passion for me and I sing every day. I used to say growing up that I would become a famous singer or something of that sort. But, now this band has become my life whether there is or isn't singing. People always tell me that I should be in a band that sings or utilize my singing voice and some parts agree. Music is really the only way I can escape from reality and to release my anger and sadness.
With this campaign, I hope you all will help me record and produce this Solo EP and make it the best release possible! This is my dream and I need your help.

The money is being raised for the following things:

- $500 for the instrumentals for the project

- The costs of recording vocals

- Printing CD's

- Creating the perks


CD's could take a bit more time because of the production schedule of the company. Please allow 3-6 weeks to receive the item you have ordered.

PLEASE ALLOW TIME FOR YOUR ORDER TO ARRIVE. THINGS ARE ORDERED WHEN CAMPAIGN ENDS. THANK YOU.

story:
Short Summary

* Since starting this campaign our youngest daughter was in the childrens hospital and diagnosed with Epilepsy. This adds the additional cost of new medication as well and a very exspensive diet her Dr are putting her on. It is even more important we keep the studio running, and supporting itself, so we can not only continue to help other children, but also our own. 


My name is Adam Sandberg, and I currently own and operate Another Element Recordings with my wife Kelly. Another Element Recordings is fully functional recording studio for all audio needs. I have 15+ years of experience in the music industry, and 8+ years of experience in the Audio Engineering field. A lot of our studio time is donated to helping children with special needs find their voice through music, and well as also giving at risk youth a positive place to showcase their talents as well as learn engineering skills. Any income we receive over covering the bills, we use for additional income to help our family.

Originally we had 6 children of our own, and then we adopted a family member after finding out she was placed in Foster Care. We then took on 2 more children that were family members for the exact same reason. When there is a big travesty in your life at such a young age there also come’s big issues and problems to try and overcome. Due to these circumstances we have dealt with Fetal Alcohol Syndrome, Reactive Attachment Disorder, Oppositional Defiance Disorder, and PTSD (Post Traumatic Stress Disorder) from severe neglect and abuse. On top of all these obstacles we are dealing with we also have 3 children on the Autism Spectrum. So due to these circumstances my wife stays home and takes care of the children and their needs such as doctor’s appointments, counseling, med checks, and she also homeschools some of them.

During the day I work as the Revenue Accountant for the local Food Bank, and at night I work as a producer/Audio Engineer. I work 80+ hours a week so I can take care of my family and provide them with the things they need. My family is the most important thing in my life! So in actuality you would really be helping my family.

What We Need & What You Get

Currently, we are setting a goal of $5,000.00. Here is a breakdown of what we intend to use the money for:

· Rental Security for at least 6 months.

· Marketing for the studio such as a website, flyers, ads for promotion, and any other ways we can get the name out for our studio.

· A better grade of microphones for drums, vocal sessions, and other instrument recording needs. This will help in recording a better quality sound.

· Better quality audio interfaces for more microphone inputs so we can capture the audio at a better quality sample rate.

· If any money is left over after these purchases we hope to acquire additional instruments such as guitars, basses, drum sets, amplifiers, and speaker cabinets for guitar and bass. This helps give the clientele different choices in producing a sound they may not have.

Also, if no one can contribute financially any expertise advice, used equipment, or anything is extremely appreciated.

Unfortunately, I’m not quite sure what I could offer anyone as a perk for your contribution. However, one thing I would like to do for each person that contributes would be a personal thank you letter as well as picture of the studio with my family inside showing the progress of your donation. I know it's not much, but that is all I really have to offer at this point.

If for some reason we cannot reach our goal, any funds that come our way will be used in a prioritized list in order to help maintain our studio.

The Impact

If you chose to help us in efforts to obtain new recording hardware, new computer, and the deposit for our new facility we would be eternally grateful. Having these items would help us develop ourselves to the next level of this profession. With better equipment and a well-maintained facility we can offer more to potential clients, which can produce more income for my family and help with gas to get them to appointments, medicine refills, doctor bills, etc.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute financially I would greatly appreciate it if you could share this link with your friends. The greater amount of people that are aware of our situation the more it could potentially help my family, Another Element Recordings, and me. Also, if you happen to have any music equipment you can donate or know of someone who could donate music equipment to us, which would help us out greatly in our campaign.

Thank you from the bottom of my heart, in any support you can provide.
story_txt: Short Summary* Since starting this campaign our youngest daughter was in the childrens hospital and diagnosed with Epilepsy. This adds the additional cost of new medication as well and a very exspensive diet her Dr are putting her on. It is even more important we keep the studio running, and supporting itself, so we can not only continue to help other children, but also our own. My name is Adam Sandberg, and I currently own and operate Another Element Recordings with my wife Kelly. Another Element Recordings is fully functional recording studio for all audio needs. I have 15+ years of experience in the music industry, and 8+ years of experience in the Audio Engineering field. A lot of our studio time is donated to helping children with special needs find their voice through music, and well as also giving at risk youth a positive place to showcase their talents as well as learn engineering skills. Any income we receive over covering the bills, we use for additional income to help our family.Originally we had 6 children of our own, and then we adopted a family member after finding out she was placed in Foster Care. We then took on 2 more children that were family members for the exact same reason. When there is a big travesty in your life at such a young age there also come’s big issues and problems to try and overcome. Due to these circumstances we have dealt with Fetal Alcohol Syndrome, Reactive Attachment Disorder, Oppositional Defiance Disorder, and PTSD (Post Traumatic Stress Disorder) from severe neglect and abuse. On top of all these obstacles we are dealing with we also have 3 children on the Autism Spectrum. So due to these circumstances my wife stays home and takes care of the children and their needs such as doctor’s appointments, counseling, med checks, and she also homeschools some of them.During the day I work as the Revenue Accountant for the local Food Bank, and at night I work as a producer/Audio Engineer. story:
On Saturday May 9, at 10PM, “Guitar” George Baker will take the stage at Cafe Nine in New Haven, CT for “A Night to Remember.” The concert will be the occasion of a very rare, live, multi-track recording of George and his band. The purpose of this Indiegogo campaign is to help raise funds to pay for recording the show, and the associated post-production and manufacturing costs for making a CD featuring selected performances from the show. We are trying to raise $2000 to supplement the money raised from ticket sales to the event.

You can hear George tell his own story in the video for this campaign, but here is a snapshot - he was raised in Louisiana, and has been a guitarist (jazz, blues, R&B) and singer for nearly 50 years. George was in the House Band at the Apollo Theatre in Harlem, toured with Melba Moore, performed with the Drifters, the Flamingos and others in and around New York, and had a two-year stint as music director and guitarist for Marvin Gaye (1968 - 1970.) He moved to Connecticut in the mid-80s, and has been performing in the region since.

In a career full of milestones, May 9th will be an important one: the first-ever recording of a live performance by George with his own band, for CD and download. The album will be only his second album as a leader. George released “Mojo Lady” in 2006.

Performing with George will be: Willie Moore on bass; Derrick Tappin on drums; Nick Lloyd on keyboards; Lou Ianello on tenor saxophone; and Tony Dioguardi on guitar.

Please join us in helping to make this recording a reality! Anything you give will be helpful.

Tickets for the show are available here:

http://ticketf.ly/1CWSiMG

story:
Who We Are

Burn is a large R&B original music band led by Tom Pergola, who is also the band's Songwriter, Producer, and Guitarist. The band features varies guest artists such as singers and sometimes rappers and dancers, all with high quality talent and listening for live performance enjoyment. Burn performs a high-energy concert style show that is entertaining and fun for all ages.

For several years we have been performing, recording, and expanding on the bands show. Now is our time to get the recognition we feel we deserve. There are many people involved in our cause, and all we need are some funds to help take us to the next level.

With the help of contributors, we will be able to bring the band to the next level of success in the following ways.

  • The money will help pay for higher quality production.
  • We will be able to film a new music video for our hit single.
  • It will provide travel expenses for touring opportunities.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.



We're Attempting To Raise $100,000!

The money will be used to help the band reach the next level of success and get the recognition we deserve.  It will be used for such things as public relations, social media, branding, photo shoots, music videos, CD pressings, merchandising, radio and TV ads, recording and rehearsal studio time, clothing and costumes, personnel salaries, tour support, and more.

If we don’t reach our financial goal, we’ll use the money donated for whatever we see fit and put it in the the most effective places to achieve the most out of what we’ll have to work with.

My band, Burn, is based in Los Angeles and has been in existence for a few years and I believe it’s our time for us to be seen and heard on a mass scale.  Our songs all have a family friendly message and we have an exciting upbeat live concert style show.

Our Retro Pop sound is right in style with the most successful and best selling songs in the world at this time.

As stated in a recent Time Magazine article the top 3 best songs worldwide are  #1 Blurred Lines by Robin Thicke,  #2 Get Lucky by Daft Punk and #3 Treasure by Bruno Mars.  All these songs have heavy 70's roots, in other words, Retro sounds such as ours.

Our songs have had incredible radio success.  We've had the # 1 most requested song in the 10 year history on the largest internet station in the world with over 8 million listeners and 275,000 people per hour.  We gave an exclusive release of airplay for 3 weeks to Sirius Satellite Radio for one of our songs. The song was played worldwide with the top hits.  Also some of our songs were played on over 262 Fox FMs stations throughout the US, parts of Canada, and Europe.

These facts and statistics prove that there is a large market and audience for Burn’s music.  All we need are the tools to expand our audience to reach further visibility and success.  This is why we’re trying to raise money.

When we play live with our big mountain of sound which includes 6 horns, full rhythm section, and 3 talented female vocalists we “knock em dead’ everywhere we perform.

Other Ways You Can Help

If for some reason you can’t contribute and would like to help in various ways please feel free to contact us through our website TheBandBurn.com.  We’ll get back to you to discuss possibilities that you might be able to support our fantastic band, Burn. Please help us get the word out to others to make some noise about our campaign.

story:
Hello, I'm Reid Hendry, the man behind re-ID.

I've been playing music my whole life and making a living from it for the last 8 years. The time has flown by. I've played well over a thousand shows, toured in Canada and the US, played on national television and radio and have been featured in music videos that have been viewed MILLIONS of times! 

During this period of time I was also heavily involved with producing music for myself and other artists. I learned a lot about what I thought sounded good as well as what other people wanted to hear. Producing for other artists is typically a very selfless act. Your ultimate goal is to make them happy with the music that accompanies their song. While I get a great deal of satisfaction from delivering a well produced song, there's always been a part of me wanting to express something totally from my head.

'Clockwork' is the result. It's a 10 song electronic album with a lot of live music elements. It pulls from my influences in world, reggae, soul, funk, hip-hop and pop music. While creating this album, I began to notice that the music I was creating was very thematic. There was a story being told despite there being no lyrics. 

It's always been a dream of mine to have my music in a film or documentary. I'm inspired and intrigued by the use of music in movies to help accentuate an idea or emotion.

While contemplating the release of my album, I realised that without a proper video element it would only go so far. This release also presents the perfect opportunity for me to marry my music with a cinematic video experience.

I've teamed up with two extremely talented video gurus, Greg Gillespie and Jem Garrard. They work together and independently on projects and have made music videos for Linkin Park, Ringo Starr, The Harpoonist and The Axe Murderer and a number of documentaries for the television show/event Playground amongst a myriad of other film projects. 

http://www.jemgarrard.com/

http://heavygrain.com/

http://artaban.ca/productions-portfolio/

http://www.playground.is/ours

By supporting this campaign you will help ensure that the MOST AMAZING VIDEO will be created showcasing how my music can be used in a cinematic experience. The exposure from the video will also greatly improve the awareness of my album release. Everything is in place to be a success, I just need YOU to help kickstart it.


FUNDING

I'm looking to raise $3000 to make this video. I've estimated that it will cost roughly $4500 to complete it.

Where does the money go?

$500 for Camera Rental

$500 for Incidentals (transportation, venue rentals, food, parking)

$1500 for Post Production (editing, graphics, color correction, hard drives)

$2000 for Shooting on multiple days (producer, director, camera op, crew)


WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU

If you don't already know about Indiegogo, it's not a charitable donation. It's a way to be a part of, in this case, an artistic undertaking. You get perks and become part of the team when you contribute. I want you to feel good about this project so I've come up with a number of perks that are useful, practical, affordable and fun! All funding options are located on the right side of this page. 

Album and Shades


Original Hoodie


Hand Drum Lessons

Executive Producer Credit

Produce a Song with Me


DJ and Live Percussion at Your Event



 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not in the position to contribute financially I understand. Getting the word out is really important too. Share this page with your friends on Facebook and Twitter and encourage them to support. The hashtag is #clockworkalbum.

Facbeook - https://www.facebook.com/reIDmusicmix
Website - http://www.re-IDmusic.com
Instagram - http://instagram.com/reidhendry
Twitter - https://www.twitter.com/reidhendry

Thanks so much for taking interest in my project. I'm really excited to make this idea a reality.

story:
What is this?

Hello there!!! My name is Rebeka Kashkin, I am a junior Television-Radio student at Ithaca College, and I have a focus in audio production and design. For my audio capstone/thesis, I will be producing a 4 song EP. In addition to being my capstone, this project is also being produced partially to serve as the soundtrack/score of a cinema thesis, directed by Bass Conde, that will be in production later this year. 

This EP is experimental and conceptual in nature, as we are composing it to ideally mimic the story beats of the script. We plan to incorporate elements of sound design, ambient recording, and both analog and digital recording and mixing techniques. 

Where is my donation going?

You might be wondering why I need donations for this project. I am fortunate enough to attend a school that offers me both facilities and industry-standard equipment to use for projects, free of charge. However, there are a few supplemental costs we need to cover.

I am a firm believer of paying artists for their effort and time. While many students will work for free, I intend to pay each recording artist a flat rate of $75 for composition, and $100 for a studio session. This totals out to $700, accounting for all the artists that we will be working with. We have also worked in an extra $100, to cover costs in case artists need to come back into the studio and re-record.

Aside from that cost, which is the majority of our budget, we have also accounted for a total of $200, to cover any distribution and production costs. This covers streaming services, as well as creating physical media, such as CDs and cassettes. 

By donating this project, you will be supporting all the local artists we are working with, as well as helping supplement some of the unexpected costs of a thesis production (which, believe me, they add up). 

Also, we have a bunch of cool perks for donating! Want your name in a song? We have a perk for that! Want to full on NAME an ENTIRE song? There's a perk for that too! Do you love the preservation of physical media? We have CDs and cassettes up for grabs! 

Risks & Challenges

We have roughly a two-month timeline to compose, record, edit, and mix this entire album. This time crunch is definitely the biggest hurdle in our way. Additionally, as mentioned briefly above, we plan to use analog recording technology. While I do have some experience with analog interfaces, a lot of research and practice will have to be conducted in order to get a quality result. This process will be time-consuming within an already stress-inducing time crunch.

The Team!

Rebeka Kashkin, audio engineer and co-producer

--------------------------------

Bass Conde, co-producer and composer

----------------------------------

Kyra Skye, composer and performing artist

--------------------------------------

Just Scott, composers and performing artists

Can't donate? That's okay!

If you do not have the resources to donate monetarily, do not fret! I still love you! Want to still help out? Please, share this on your social media, send it to your mom, post it in on bulletin boards at work, whatever you must do!

story:
~song preview~ Check "updates" for more info on this track! 
 
 

About this project...

A lot has happened in this country since I released The Lumberjack a year ago. The Global Change Climate Program released its 4th annual Climate Assessment, Toledo Ohio granted human rights to Lake Eerie, the Senate designated 1.3 million acres of wilderness, and the state of Illinois rolled out an agenda to achieve zero carbon by 2050.

Last summer's tour took us around the country and up through Canada. We passed through the smoke of America's most punishing wildfire season in history, stood 30 yards from where lightning struck land during an extreme precipitation event Texas, and narrowly avoided the devastating floods of Hurricane Florence in North Carolina.

The climate is changing and that's what this album is about. 

My name is Eleanor Elektra and I am a singer songwriter and interdisciplinary artist. I have been expressing my connection with nature through music since I started writing songs as a teen. This will be my third release to date and my most ambitious project yet! But more on that later; the inspiration for this album first came to me when I was 16 years old, in the form of a Norse genesis story wherein the earth is born from the corpse of a giant named Ymir. Ymir’s flesh becomes the earth, his blood the rivers, his brains the clouds, his skull the sky. His blood drowns the inhabitants of the world except for two of his offspring who float away in a sea of gore.

Five years later I did an "exquisite corpse" cowrite with a fellow songwriter; we passed the notebook back and forth writing lyrical passages, and the metaphors that conceived these songs came from this.

The Exquisite Corpse is about things that are started by one generation and taken up by another, it’s about the struggling condition of the earth. The Exquisite Corpse is also the cycle of death and regeneration. It’s a way of looking at the Earth that says one thing ends, another begins, and it is also a call to action, compelling us to bring an end to the paradigm of exploitation so a paradigm of restoration can begin. It is the concept of Nature as a body, and it holds physical and spiritual implications about the current condition of the Earth and what it means to us.  

The studio dates are booked, and things are in motion!

won't you join us for these

32 Days of Fundraising

How Can You Help? 

Select a perk that delights you and press go! Or venmo a direct donation to @Eleanor-Larsen-1. 

If you cannot support monetarily that's okay! You can also:

Share this indiegogo page with your friends and family; help me get the word out there and encourage them to do the same!

Join the mailing list on my website (https://www.eleanorelektra.com) to stay up to date on new music, shows, merch and more!

Follow me on social media (instagram: eleanorelektramusic) | (Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/eleanorelektra/)  

~Send me good vibes~

The Team

 

                                                                                                                             

This is the Plan

In just 32 days we hope to raise the funds we need for this album! The band will begin their first day of recording on the 4th of July and we’ll be pulling 12 hour days until July 7th. It’s really gonna be something, recording is fun, exhausting, rewarding and expensive.  That’s a major part of what we’re raising money for! Once that baby’s tracked the mixing begins.

Here's a break down of the costs

 

 

Our initial goal is $3,000 

That will cover four days in the studio, pay these most excellent musicians, and get the record mixed and mastered

Stretch goal I is $5,000

This will pay for all of the above plus manufacturing, a hand printed edition with original artwork, and will also cover copyright, distribution and merch making.

Stretch Goal II is $7,100

This will pay for all of the above plus a good and proper promotion and a music video!! 

Stretch Goal III is $11,500

This is the final goal and it will cover all of the above and also allow us to tour the album with the full band! 

About the impact of your support...

Funding for this project will help bring a new work of art to fruition. This album is meant to contribute to a cultural force that sanctifies Nature—something that has been alternately feared and exploited by the western world for centuries. This task is indelibly related to sustainability, because it shapes the way we treat our planet. The global community does not have much time to drastically change the way it operates and we need to work quickly; this is the reality that my generation has grown up with and now, as young adults, we are closing in on an ultimatum. As an artist, I've been drawn to expressions of nature again and again over the years by a sense of awe, urgency and justice. 

My sound has definitely grown since recording my solo EP Comet on a field recorder in the hills. Arranging these strange songs for an ensemble is not a simple task! But working with these musicians has been such a joy and an incredible learning experience. This record is pushing me to a new level of music and leadership that will bring forth transformative year with your generous support. 

Risks & Challenges

This project is slated to take about a year to complete, and what I'm raising here through indiegogo is just part of the total costs! In the next nine months, I plant to save $6,000 from the two day jobs I hold down to help pay for everything. Managing those jobs, preventing surprise expenses from piling up, and making sure the agenda stays organized and rolling, will be a challenge. But things are looking good so far, as I've already squirreled away $3,000 for this project and managed to keep all the moving parts in working order! Releasing my last album The Lumberjack and touring extensively this past year taught me that things don't always go as planned, and stuff happens on the road, but it also taught me how to deal!
story_txt:
~song preview~ Check "updates" for more info on this track! 
 

 
About this project...
A lot has happened in this country since I released The Lumberjack a year ago. The Global Change Climate Program released its 4th annual Climate Assessment, Toledo Ohio granted human rights to Lake Eerie, the Senate designated 1.3 million acres of wilderness, and the state of Illinois rolled out an agenda to achieve zero carbon by 2050.
Last summer's tour took us around the country and up through Canada. We passed through the smoke of America's most punishing wildfire season in history, stood 30 yards from where lightning struck land during an extreme precipitation event Texas, and narrowly avoided the devastating floods of Hurricane Florence in North Carolina.
The climate is changing and that's what this album is about. 
My name is Eleanor Elektra and I am a singer songwriter and interdisciplinary artist. I have been expressing my connection with nature through music since I started writing songs as a teen. This will be my third release to date and my most ambitious project yet! But more on that later; the inspiration for this album first came to me when I was 16 years old, in the form of a Norse genesis story wherein the earth is born from the corpse of a giant named Ymir. Ymir’s flesh becomes the earth, his blood the rivers, his brains the clouds, his skull the sky. His blood drowns the inhabitants of the world except for two of his offspring who float away in a sea of gore.
Five years later I did an "exquisite corpse" cowrite with a fellow songwriter; we passed the notebook back and forth writing lyrical passages, and the metaphors that conceived these songs came from this.
The Exquisite Corpse is about things that are started by one generation and taken up by another, it’s about the struggling condition of the earth. The Exquisite Corpse is also the cycle of death and regeneration. It’s a way of looking at the Earth that says one thing ends, another begins, and it is also a call to action, compelling us to bring an end to the paradigm of exploitation so a paradigm of restoration can begin. It is the concept of Nature as a body, and it holds physical and spiritual implications about the current condition of the Earth and what it means to us.  
The studio dates are booked, and things are in motion!

story:
Intro:

I've been in the Midwest all my life and I feel it has given me all it has to offer. 
I have been wanting to move to Portland for about 5 years now, and it is time to pull the trigger.
I'm a creative and artistic individual who needs to be with like minded friends and peers to grow as an artist.
I have been wanting to create music with some friends in Portland, and this would greatly help me accmomplish that goal.
I also take photographs that tend to be abstract/surreal and sometimes glitchy in nature. 
My Instagram is a great platform to see what I am all about I post clips of my synth jams and also my artwork. 

What the money will be used for:

I would use this money directly for travel expenses and to help settle down in Portland. I plan on driving from Central Illinois to Portland. Anything extra would be used for new musical equipment.


My main goal is to settle down, make music with my friends, and grow as an artist and a person, something that I feel my current location can not offer me anymore. 


Perks:

There are various perks to choose from if you donate, open the image gallery to see some example of my artwork. 


Instagram: tan_servo

Facebook: facebook.com/tanner23
