story:
What We're Gonna Do:

  • Press the record
  • Send it to your house

If this seems complicated, that's okay, because it is.

Where The Money Is Going

We've basically broken it down into these parts:

  • The Actual Pressing - ~$1850 (Yikes!)
  • Shipping materials - $150
  • Shipping - At LEAST $10 PER ORDER

As you can see, asking for $2000 dollars is not much. We will lose money doing this, but who cares! We both win, you know!?

The Impact

  • We will begin transitioning Neetspeak from a tape label to a (mostly) vinyl only label
  • Luke will have one of his records on vinyl, therefore he will be able to leave his flesh prison on earth and return to the aether
  • I get to spend countless hours at the post office

Risks & Challenges

  • We might not reach $2000 and we will have to use a bunch of our money out of pocket, preventing us from eating normal meals for at least (1) month

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spam this link to your friends and family, begging them to purchase a copy
  • Give us emotional support during this difficult time
  • Share this link
  • Share it again
  • Retweet it on Twitter
  • Share it again

story:
On March 14, 2016 the Philadelphia music community lost a dear, long-time friend: clarinetist, composer, and conductor Arne Running who passed away at age 72 following an illness. 

Arne was a well-loved and respected colleague who had a multi-faceted career as a clarinetist with numerous Philadelphia ensembles, as a composer who wrote pieces for many local music groups (including Orchestra 2001), and as a conductor who formerly led orchestras at Swarthmore College and elsewhere in the area. His presence in our local community will be sorely missed.

Orchestra 2001 would like to honor Arne by asking his musical friends and colleagues to contribute, in his memory, to our newly-created Clarinet Chair, the "Friends and Colleagues Chair in Memory of Clarinetist, Composer, and Conductor Arne Running.”

We would like to encourage those who knew and loved Arne, to make a donation of any amount for the naming of the first year of this Clarinet Chair. Excess funding will be used to continue the chair beyond Year 1 and/or to fund a performance of one of Arne’s compositions on a future Orchestra 2001 chamber music concert or out-of-town tour. 

All individual donations are tax-deductible and will be listed with the indication “In memory of Arne Running” in all Orchestra 2001 program books over the next 14 months. Musicians who have made contributions in 2016 may now have those apply to this fund.

Thank you for your consideration of this remembrance of Arne.

Allison Herz – Musician, Board Member, Orchestra 2001   

Adam Lesnick – Executive Director, Orchestra 2001

story:
Our Story

When I was in first grade, every day at recess I was singing on the swings and singing at the top of my lungs. Somewhere in a dusty old box my parents have a videotape of me at 3 years old, in a pink leotard singing opera to Gloria Estefan's "Miami Sound Machine", on my "stage" AKA the fireplace. (Yes this video actually exists and it is HILARIOUS!) I have known all my life that this is what I was put on this earth to do. I am so lucky that I have had the chance to make a living and see the world doing what I love. Now that I am all grown up I realize what music can mean to people and how powerful it is. That is really what makes me love what I do everyday.

 

I was born and raised in Columbus, Ohio. Although I always sang, I started out my musical education studying the violin then moved on to drums, then piano, with a few experiments in guitar, and bass. I began my singing endeavors with the Columbus Children's Chorus singing with the Columbus Symphony at age 10. By the time I was ready to graduate high school I found that singing would always be my first love. In the fall of 2002 I attended the Berklee College of Music in Boston, MA. It was there that I began to develop my artistic style and I had this crazy notion that maybe jazz vocalists don't have to just sing the standards, solo over "A" then come back in on the bridge. So I began to write original songs, arrangements of popular songs, and dive into the ever expanding world of improvisation. 

 

I am not just a vocalist I am an instrument. I like to use my voice as a storyteller whether through improvisation or through the delivery of lyrics. My stance as an artist is that the music should make people feel something! Jazz shouldn't be approached just from the technical side. I do believe in substance but music that doesn't speak to the heart won't move people and I don't see the point. People connect to a song when it identifies with a piece of their humanity. That is what I try to do. I want to bring joy and excitement to people making every performance an experience to remember.

 

In my professional career, I have been privileged to share the stage with an extraordinary array of musicians such as Kurt Elling, Ellis Marsalis, Meredith Monk, Sheila E., Esperanza Spalding, Riannon, and Bryan Baker. As well as small club performances some of my past performances include The Montreux Jazz Festival, where I was awarded second place in the 2007 vocal competition, The Beantown Jazz Festival, The Boston Pops Jazz Festival, and The International Association of Jazz Educators Convention. In addition to live performances, I have been interviewed as a featured artist on Boston’s 89.7 WGBH National Public Radio. This year I was chosen for the Betty Carter Jazz Ahead Arts In Residence Program at the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts. While focusing on performance, I have also become a deeply committed educator, dedicating my life to the preservation and promotion of American Jazz and its history to future generations.

 

 

The Impact

Let's face it we live in the digital age where everything is available electronically. Record labels don't make the money they used to and many artists are promoting and recording independently. The one thing that helps an independent artist make it to the next level is having a professional recording! Come on, be honest we have enough plastic bubblegum culture out there. With all the constraints of the current economic times people want things simpler, faster, and easier with that the quality of our entertainment has gone down. Musicians are getting paid less and less or even being replaced by machines. Now auto tune can make anyone a star! This project is about promoting real live music and real art! if you are paying the money to go out to a club, buy a record, or see a concert...THE PRODUCT SHOULD BE DAMN GOOD! This is bigger then just my career. Plain and simple, if we don't raise money for projects like this then the substance of our culture just keeps getting degraded further and further. Let's support quality!

 

What We Need & What You Get

It is extremely expensive to make, produce, promote and distribute an album! Record labels spend tens of thousands (sometimes a hundred thousand) dollars on an artist's record cycle. My goal is $7000. Lofty as it may seem, this is what is needed to make this special project and if everyone gives $10 or even $25 we will meet, and even possibly exceed the goal! You don't give for nothing.....you get all sorts of cool prizes. Anything from a free digital download, to lyric sheets, to a mix tape, to original artwork, or a free private concert! The larger the contribution the better the perks. Credit card donations are accepted. We can do it!!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Every little bit helps but what helps even more is getting others involved. Please pass it around to others who might want to help out. Go to my website and sign up to be on the mailing list. Also follow me on Facebook,YouTube, and Twitter get up to date videos and performances and tell a friend! Thank you all very much for checking this out and your tremendous support. You are making amazing things possible!

You are making amazing things possible!

story:
Introduction:

We are Crossroads Duo, an acoustic blues duo performing both original and cover blues music. We have been performing blues music individually for decades and since September, 2015 as Crossroads Duo. We will be representing the 2nd Story Blues Alliance (Lehigh Valley, PA) at the 2017 International Blues Challenge being held in Memphis, TN. We need your help to get us to Memphis. We will incur gasoline, food and hotel room expenses for an entire week. As none of the IBC performances pay and both of us will have to leave our other musical gigs for a week (guitar instructor, radio host) we will need your help to get us to Memphis AND sustain us for the week until we return to our regular jobs and our Crossroads Duo gigs that DO pay...

What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking $3,000 to cover our expenses of gasoline (we're driving there), food (for the whole week) and hotel room (for 6 days). As stated above, we will not be able to work our paying gigs (guitar instructor, radio host and of course Crossroads Duo paid gigs) for the entire week so not only do we need to get ourselves to Memphis and back but we will not have any income for the week. Just to be able to compete in the IBC is a huge thing for the duo. The prestige of performing there we hope will carry us to the next level of the blues music scene. In exchange for your kind contribution you will receive any of the perks we have listed which include autographed posters, CDs, and souvenir memorabilia from our respective instruments...

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people are just not able to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • You can help to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Share our campaign on Facebook and Twitter...

story:
PEACE IS NOW  *  THE VISION 

                                               

Hi, my name is BODHI. I am a musician, producer, music director at Golden Gate Center for Spiritual Living, painter and a conceptual artist. Creating beautiful music and art is the best way I know to contribute to our world. Here is my vision. I am creating a community CD project called PEACE IS NOW. I have written a chant to be sung by many voices and layered in will be the phrase, PEACE IS NOW, in languages from around the world. I have invited many different soloists to add their musical talent to the sonic tapestry. Ben Leinbach, who has produced Jai Uttal, Deva Premal and many other artists, is our amazing recording engineer and co-producer. 

                                                 

                                    The video was produced by Ed Dudkowski.


This project was born from a vision to embrace peace in our being, NOW.  To be it, live it, share it as much as possible in every moment. Through repetitive chant, our sub-conscious mind opens to receive the imprint of our intentions. We have been two years recording already and plan to finish by Summer of 2014. We’ll have a concert with a large choir to celebrate! At the concert, I will be inviting different PEACE organizations to have a presence to share their work.

THE BUDGET:

Promo Video for Indiegogo        1000

Recording Studio                        9000

Musicians                                     3250

Final Mixing                                 2000

Final Mastering                           1000

CD Cover Graphics                     700

CD Replication 2000 copies     2400

Radio Promotion                       4000

Indiegogo Fees                          3000

Internet campaign help               500

Cover Photo cost                        150

Perks Fulfillment                       3000

TOTAL                                   $30,000

ABOUT BODHI

I have been producing music for about 45 years now. I had a #1 CD in 2006 called TRANS UKRAINE. In the last 2 years, my music has had over 5 million plays on PANDORA INTERNET RADIO. It feels good to have the music reaching around the world.  ( Here is one of my pieces: BODHI & Friends Kiev II )


I remember my first recording, at 15 years old, traveling to Big Sur, California to play flute on an album of songs by Ric Masten, a California poet and folk hero. What a thrill and an honor to blow a few notes and hear it coming back in the speaker's, fresh and alive, weaving into the song. The magic of the music is alive today. In fact, this project, PEACE IS NOW, could be my “piece de resistance”, a culmination of many years of visions and dreams. I hope you can help me bring it to life!

WHY INDIEGOGO?

So why a crowdfunding campaign? Over the last couple of years, I have been so inspired by the success of other artists using this fundraising tool; Todd Boston produced a beautiful CD with Will Ackerman, Brindle ran a successful campaign for her music, Jumana in Ashland, Oregon raised funds to launch her amazing water therapy center, Onyay Pheori from Los Angeles raised money for her beautiful violin music and of course the famous Amanda Palmer raised $1.2 million & never spoke a word on the video! She gave the entire message with big hand-drawn cards, like Bob Dylan in his 60‘s video, “Subterranean Homesick Blues” .
And what is so brilliant about all this? It connects the artist directly with the listener. The challenging side is that I wear all the hats: Visionary, composer, performer, producer, pioneer, manager and fund-raiser! As you can see, I can use and appreciate all of your support.

THE GUEST MUSICIANS

An artistic odyssey of this magnitude is never accomplished alone! Some of the amazing artists that will be gracing this music are:

Alejandra Ortiz
Ananda Yogiji
Barbara Juniper
Ben Leinbach
Bouchaib Abdelhadi
Celso Alberti
Diane Patterson
Divino
Don Lax
East Bay Church of Religious Science Choir
Firefly
Jaya Lakshmi
Jef Labes
Joyus
Lakshmi Devi
Murray Kyle
Ramesh Kannan
Robert Powell
Shimshai
Stephen Meese
Todd Boston
Warren Mann
   and more ...


Each one brings a unique and inspiring vibration to the PEACE IS NOW project. Together we create the magic!

GRATITUDE

I really want to thank you for taking the time to read through this program. We are running this indiegogo campaign for 60 days, Dec 15th, 2013 until February 13th, 2014. Our goal is to raise $30,000 dollars. If you can give something, that would be awesome. One dollar, or One Thousand dollars. Every raindrop helps fill the water tank. And there's great perks for every level of contribution.

                                          

If 300 people give $100 each, we are there ... So carpe diem! Seize the day! Share this video with anyone you think might be interested in music for peace. Take this moment to contribute to something amazing, “Transformational Music”. Music that plants the seeds of PEACE in our consciousness, to blossom every day, creating peace, without any pressure or judgement to be something we ‘should’ be. Just allowing the music to take us into a gentle, peaceful place, creating a reference point,
Remembering...

PEACE ... IS ... NOW ...

story:
Short Summary

The Outskirts plan to spend their fall break in Durham, NC at SoJam, an in incredible three-day a cappella festival full of competitions, professional performances, and group workshops. The festival is great for networking groups, learning how to improve performance, and simply sharing a love for a cappella. The 'Skirts hope to put Haverford's name out into the larger a cappella world and hope to share their experiences with other Haverford groups by blogging and hosting workshops sharing what they learned.

What We Need

Although we will receive approximately $600 in funding from Student Council, we face the following costs for sending 13 Outskirts on the trip:

  • All-access passes for 3 days are $80 per person so this will cost $1040 total. 
  • Accommodations for 3 rooms for 2 nights will cost $708.
  • Gas money for 3 cars traveling from the Philadelphia to Durham area is $390.

    The Impact

    The large takeaway from this trip will be the workshops we attend. In line with Haverford's values, the workshops aim to improve leadership and group dynamics in addition to improving sound and performance. Previous SoJam workshops have ranged from teaching group management to singing techniques, beatbox workshops to live sound mixing. 

    We plan to disseminate any and all information we receive on this trip through maintaining a blog and hosting workshops upon our return. By doing so, we hope to encourage more collaboration between all the unique and talented a cappella groups on Haverford's campus.

    Risks & Challenges

    If we do not acquire the funds necessary for the trip, we will not be able to go at all. In which case, all money raised here will go towards other Outskirts initiatives, such as bringing a cappella workshops to Haverford, competing in the International Championship of Collegiate A Capella, and going on tour.

story:
About our project...

Hello and welcome to our campaign! Lets get to know each other! 

We are the All-City Jazz Band. We are a group of musicians between the grades of 10 and 12 and we're really excited about music and love sharing our love of the art with others! That's why we want to go to the smaller communities where there aren't a lot of musical opportunities like there are here in Whitehorse.


The break down...

We need at least $2500 to pay for:

  • Transportation by bus
  • Hotel rooms for band members
  • Hotel room for bus driver

There are many exciting perks that you will receive if you choose to donate to us! Perks include All-City Band merch, shout-outs from our Facebook page, and even a chance to have a private concert by the All-City Jazz Band!

If we don't reach our goal of $2500...

  • All donors will still receive their deserved perks
  • All money raised will go towards the Jazz trip. However, we will be sleeping in gyms and eating rations ;)


How your contributions will help...

By donating to our cause you will be helping not only our band but also the outlying communities. You will be giving the children of Pelly, Carmacks, and Dawson City the chance to see a live performance by hard-working and dedicated student-musicians.

    Our challenges...

    As the All-City Band Society is a not-for-profit organization, it is difficult to finance things such as band trips. That is why we're asking for your help. Without the help of parents, our dedicated volunteers and You!, it would be very difficult to run our band program. So with that, we'd like to thank you.

    Other ways you can help us...

    Can't contribute with money but would still like to help? Send us an email at allcityband@yesnet.yk.ca

story:
Since 2011, nienteForte has been an active force in bringing contemporary music of all varieties to the New Orleans area. The festival’s goal is to bring together a diverse group of composers, performers, moderators, and listeners for open, inviting experiences of and conversations about contemporary music in a region where such music is less commonly showcased. The festival aims to not only present concerts but create a comfortable atmosphere around and foster dialogue about contemporary music through masterclasses, public discussions, and informal receptions. All concerts and associated events are offered free and to the public.

This year nienteForte has partnered with the University of New Orleans and New Orleans-based arts presenter and online periodical FOCI Arts in addition to its regular partnership with Tulane University to host the esteemed TAK Ensemble for a series of concerts and masterclasses. These concerts feature the work of prominent New Orleans-based composers Maxwell Dulaney, Yotam Haber, and Ray Evanoff alongside that of nationally and internationally recognized artists such as Kate Soper, Lewis Nielson, Taylor Brook, and TAK’s own Charlotte Mundy. Performances will include New Orleans-based musicians as well as the members of TAK. The cumulative offerings of the 2017 nienteForte Festival mark an exciting contribution to contemporary music and culture in New Orleans that continue the festival’s aim of fostering aesthetic experiences and dialogue between the local community and national artists.
 

This campaign has been undertaken to raise the final portion of funds necessary for the festival. The entirety of funds raised will go directly to the TAK Ensemble in compensation for their extensive work in the 2017 nienteForte Festival.

story:
Add your voice to the roar of Casse-Tête: A Festival of Experimental Music! www.cassetetefestival.com

 

How We'll Thank Our Supporters

Supporters have a range of slightly surreal perks to choose from, including complete editions of the now-historic Dreamland Magazine! Other perks include artifacts of 2014's Piano Drop; out-of-print chapbooks and CDs by local artists; and other strange little treasures, as well as a sections of a massive, theatre-built plywood shelving unit! 

This Year's Festival

2017’s festival features outstanding artists, including Vancouver's free noise monsters Crawling Human, Calgary's Not now, Hamelin free jazz trio, Mark McGregor, Cathy Fern Lewis and Marina Hasselberg, Christians, Stanley Zappa and Andrew Wedman, Peter Stevenson, and so many more. Like last year, we are relying on donations and sponsorships to cover the expenses related to such an undertaking, most of which are artists’ fees or travel expenses. 

Like last year, sponsors like Theatre North West have been immensely generous and supportive; the festival’s budget is very lean and carefully planned; and almost all of our costs are artists’ fees, and yet the artists almost all shoulder a share of their own costs to perform here because they simply care that much. We need your help in welcoming them as warmly, and supporting them as thoroughly as we can.

How we started

2013 witnessed the founding of Casse-Tête: A Festival of Experimental Music, conceived as a festival of challenging music from a wide range of traditions and practices with a local core supplemented by visiting artists. Over two days at The Exploration Place Museum and Science Centre in Fort George Park, around 100 people heard incredible music that had never been given a remotely comparable platform in the region before. The festival was an artistic, financial, and social success, prompting the decision to continue.

How we kept it going

2016's festival was the biggest and best yet, with performances by distinguished artists from as far afield as Italy. 2014 was a much larger affair than 2013’s in turn, beginning with the spectacular Piano Drop from the roof of the museum, continuing into a panel discussion, followed by two more days of music at TEP, now utilizing both the Kordyban Learning Centre and the beautiful atrium. Each year, amazing visiting artists have exposed local musicians to unique playing opportunities and local audiences to unbelievable listening opportunities. Including the Piano Drop, attendance at the festival topped 300 people, and fundraising efforts were rewarded by a vastly larger production, which was also more fairly remunerative to the participants.

 

Help us make a great city even better--with life-changing artistic explorations.

story:
When you help me in Japanese, please look at the MotionGallery website.
日本語でのご支援をご希望の方は、以下のリンクから応援をお願い致します。
MotionGallery web site ： https://motion-gallery.net/projects/Yuka_Chrono...


The Project

In September, 2015, Yuka & Chronoship made their UK debut with their 3rd album, “The 3rd Planetary Chronicles”. Since then, there have been so many requests for the album’s music video from the fans and the media overseas. The band now decided to make the music video to extend their popularity.

Yuka & Chronoship is a Japanese progressive rock band that made a UK debut with their 3rd album, “The 3rd Planetary Chronicles”, from Cherry Red Records in September, 2015. 

Yuka & Chronoship is the first Japanese artist to release its album from a semi-major label in the birthplace of progressive rock. Since its release, the album has received enthusiastic responses. Especially in UK and other European countries, the album has been rated with four and five stars from the media. In no more than two weeks after the release, 1,000 copies of the album have been sold and picked up by more than 70 radio stations and internet media.


As there have been mounting requests for the album’s music video especially from the overseas media, the band now decided to make its music video to expand its popularity overseas.

With your support, we want to create an attractive music video that enchants the whole world, and mark the beginning of a new chronicle that puts Yuka & Chronoship on the center stage of the world’s progressive rock scene.

About Progressive Rock

Progressive rock, or “prog rock”, is a rock music subgenre originated in the UK in the late 1960s. Progressive rock is characterized by its complex sound of rock fused with diverse elements, such as classical, jazz, and/or contemporary music.  Major bands of progressive rock include Yes, Pink Floyd, King Crimson, Genesis, and Emerson, Lake & Palmer.

Progressive rock is not a popular genre in Japan. But, in Europe and the US, the music is regarded as an established genre, and supported by a wide range of generations, as well as youth.


Biography

Formed in 2009, Yuka & Chronoship is led by Yuka Funakoshi, a rare female artist in the genre, and consists of three other leading studio musicians in Japan: Shun Taguchi, Miyazawa Takashi, and Ikko Tanaka.

< Photo from the left >

■  Shun Taguchi (Bass / Keyboard / Producer)
Shun made a debut in 1980. As a member of bands such as Lorelei and Sense of Wonder, he released seven albums. From 1982, he started to provide lyrics to many Japanese artists, and later on work as a producer. He has been working as a producer of Yuka Funakoshi since her debut, and had also worked as a producer of Princess Princess, a five-piece Japanese pop/rock girl band.

■  Takashi Miyazawa (Guitar / Mix)
Takashi had worked as a studio musician for some projects led by Masataka Matsutoya, a Japanese arranger, composer, music producer. He is also working as a composer/arranger of TV commercial and game music. Takashi did the mixing of 2nd and 3rd albums of Yuka & Chronoship.

■  Yuka Funakoshi (Keyboard/Vocal/Composition)
As a singer-songwriter, Yuka had released three J-pop albums from Pioneer LDC and Sony. She also had worked as a radio personality, and composed incidental music for the theatrical and reading dramas.

■  Ikko Tanaka (Drum)
Ikko started to work as a support musician when he was in high school. He engaged in various forms of collaboration with many leading Japanese artists, such as B’z (as a recording and tour support member), Yoshihiro Kai, Kyosuke Himuro, and Namie Amuro.

Discography

Yuka & Chronoship’s 1st album, “Water Reincarnation”, was released in June 2011, and their 2nd album, “Dino Rocket Oxygen”, in April 2013 from the French progressive label, Musea. In September, 2015, the band released their 3rd album, “The 3rd Planetary Chronicles” from Cherry Red Records in the U.K.

Water Reincarnation

As a country consisting of four main islands surrounded by the sea, Japan has long benefited, but at times greatly suffered from water from the ancient times. This album depicts such an ever-recurring water cycle. From an almost cosmic perspective and with technical and musical richness, this grandiose concept-album portrays the reincarnation of water. The rain is turned into a river; a river pours into the sea; the sea then forms clouds; and clouds are turned back into the rain.


DINO ROCKET OXYGEN

The album is made of three suites: “Dinosaur Suite”, “R is for Rocket Suite”, and “Oxygen Suite”. Compared to the 1st, this album’s arrangement gives it more of a touch of band sound. The band & title logo are designed by Roger Dean, an iconic progressive rock artist who has created many covers of legendary progressive rock bands.


About Roger Dean

Roger Dean is an English painter, illustrator, and art designer. He became widely known for his album cover work for Yes’s 4th album, “Fragile”, with the touch of fantasy that perfectly matches the theme of the album. In addition to many other album covers of Yes, he created a variety of album artworks of Uriah Heep, Gentle Giant, and other progressive rock bands. He also designed Virgin Records (original) logo and label.   http://www.rogerdean.com/


The 3rd Planetary Chronicles


The band’s 3rd album, “The 3rd Planetary Chronicles”, is a grandiose concept album themed with scientific/technological revolutions in the history of the Earth (the third planet from the Sun). The album’s booklet is designed by Hideji Oda, a reputed manga artist/illustrator of “Diffusion Disease”, “Coo’s World”, and “Miyori no Mori”.

To further enhance the quality of this memorable UK debut album, the band used MotionGallery crowdfunding. With the album made possible with many crowdfunding contributors, Yuka & Chronoship could take such a big step to land on the birthplace of progressive rock!


Activities

June, 2011  Yuka & Chronoship’s 1st album, “Water Reincarnation”, was released.
April, 2013  Their 2nd album, “DINO ROCKET OXYGEN”, was released.
May, 2013  The band appeared at Prog’Sud 2013, a French prog rock festival.
August, 2014  The band appeared at Festival Crescendo 2014 in France.
September, 2015  Yuka & Chronoship made their UK debut with their 3rd album released from Cherry Red Records.


Live Performances

Since 2009 when the band was formed, Yuka & Chronoship has been periodically playing mainly at live music clubs in Tokyo. In May 2013, the band appeared at Prog’Sud 2013, an annual progressive rock festival held in Marseille, France. In August 2014, the band was featured at Festival Crescendo 2014 in St.Palais-sur-Mer, France. In September 2015, Yuka & Chronoship will play at 2Days Prog+1 2015/Veruno Prog Fes in Italy.



About the Music Video

Today, music videos are used in many music genres, and in a wide variety of forms integrated with latest technologies, for examples, of animation and CG. And many artists are now using YouTube to extend their popularity.

On YouTube, there are a number of introductory clips of Yuka & Chronoship’s albums/songs and the band’s live performance videos shot and uploaded by the fans. However, as the band has not so far provided their official music and live performance video, there has been mounting requests for Yuka & Chronoship’s official music and live performance videos.

The music video that we want to make through this funding opportunity is intended to go beyond the category of “music video” primarily comprised of scenes of performance. It should be a visual work of art that delivers the worldview of the music.

Music featured in the video is “Galileo II – Copernican Theory”. The tune is the starting point of the whole album, and is well received in and outside Japan.

The video’s production director is Masako Gomado, a reputed VFX artist that had worked in a variety of visual media including Japan’s national TV network’s long running, one year long drama series and the movie, “20th Century Boy”. The art work is provided by Oda Hideji, the manga artist and illustrator that created the excellent artwork for the band’s 3rd album. The music video should be a highly creative attempt to present the worldview of “Galileo II – Copernican Theory” through the collaboration of music, artwork, and VFX!

Masako Gomado   http://www.masakogomado.com/     
Hideji Oda   http://www.odahideji.com/work.html *This site is only available in Japanese.

Reward

Contributors of the funding will receive regular project updates and thank you mails from Yuka & Chronoship members. In addition, contributors will receive the music video DVD, and their names will be shown in the DVD’s credits roll, depending on the amount of contribution.

Risks & Challenges

To make this music video is a brand new challenge for Yuka & Chronoship to embark on a new form of collaboration. It requires an elaborate concept making, scenario planning, and visual sequencing to materialize the tune’s worldview into a creative work of art. Later on, endless hours of post production will make it into a perfection. With the funding support from you, we will make it a piece of sophisticated and high quality work of art.

If the funding exceeds the target, we want to fund future related projects, such as making a UK tour and producing Yuka & Chronoship’s live performance DVD.


A Message from Yuka & Chronoship

We had already received many requests for the video before the release of the latest album, and we ourselves highly recognized the importance of music video as a promotional tool. Actually, we could always cook up “a video with music”. However, as the kind of music that we create attempts to portray the vast landscape of human being, universe, and nature, we thought it was quite hard to visualize the worldview. It is never possible to do that with the “shoot with a home camera and edit the footage on PC” method. All four band members thought nothing is better than some easy thing.

The 3rd album released in the U.K. last September has been well received by a wider audience, sold better than the previous two albums, and its popularity has now been extended to the U.S. As a result, we have received an increasing number of requests for the video from the overseas media, as well as the fans of the band in and outside Japan. Now, the band has decided to “make a music video that is not an easy thing, but should satisfy the audience all over the world”.

We really appreciate your support to get it started to create the music video that enchants the whole world, and mark the beginning of a new chronicle of Yuka & Chronoship!
story_txt:
When you help me in Japanese, please look at the MotionGallery website.日本語でのご支援をご希望の方は、以下のリンクから応援をお願い致します。MotionGallery web site ： https://motion-gallery.net/projects/Yuka_Chrono...The Project
In September, 2015, Yuka
& Chronoship made their UK debut with their 3rd album, “The 3rd Planetary Chronicles”. Since then, there have been so many requests for the
album’s music video from the fans and the media overseas. The band now decided
to make the music video to extend their popularity.

Yuka & Chronoship is
a Japanese progressive rock band that made a UK debut with their 3rd album, “The 3rd Planetary Chronicles”, from Cherry Red Records in
September, 2015. Yuka & Chronoship is
the first Japanese artist to release its album from a semi-major label in the birthplace
of progressive rock. Since its release, the album has received enthusiastic
responses. Especially in UK and other European countries, the album has been
rated with four and five stars from the media. In no more than two weeks after
the release, 1,000 copies of the album have been sold and picked up by more
than 70 radio stations and internet media.

As there have been
mounting requests for the album’s music video especially from the overseas
media, the band now decided to make its music video to expand its popularity
overseas.
With your support, we
want to create an attractive music video that enchants the whole world, and
mark the beginning of a new chronicle that puts Yuka & Chronoship on the
center stage of the world’s progressive rock scene.


About
Progressive Rock
Progressive rock, or
“prog rock”, is a rock music subgenre originated in the UK in the late 1960s.
Progressive rock is characterized by its complex sound of rock fused with
diverse elements, such as classical, jazz, and/or contemporary music.  Major bands of
progressive rock include Yes, Pink Floyd, King Crimson, Genesis, and Emerson,
Lake & Palmer.
Progressive rock is not a
popular genre in Japan. But, in Europe and the US, the music is regarded as an
established genre, and supported by a wide range of generations, as well as
youth.




Biography
Formed in 2009, Yuka
& Chronoship is led by Yuka Funakoshi, a rare female artist in the genre,
and consists of three other leading studio musicians in Japan: Shun Taguchi,
Miyazawa Takashi, and Ikko Tanaka.< Photo from
the left >
■  Shun Taguchi (Bass / Keyboard /
Producer)Shun made a debut in 1980. As a member of bands such as Lorelei and Sense of
Wonder, he released seven albums. From 1982, he started to provide lyrics to
many Japanese artists, and later on work as a producer. He has been working as
a producer of Yuka Funakoshi since her debut, and had also worked as a producer
of Princess Princess, a five-piece Japanese pop/rock girl band.
■  Takashi Miyazawa (Guitar / Mix)
Takashi had worked as a studio musician for some projects led by Masataka
Matsutoya, a Japanese arranger, composer, music producer. He is also working as
a composer/arranger of TV commercial and game music. Takashi did the mixing of
2nd and 3rd albums of Yuka & Chronoship.


■  Yuka Funakoshi (Keyboard/Vocal/Composition)
As a singer-songwriter, Yuka had released three J-pop albums from Pioneer LDC
and Sony. She also had worked as a radio personality, and composed incidental
music for the theatrical and reading dramas.


■  Ikko Tanaka (Drum)
Ikko started to work as a support musician when he was in high school. He
engaged in various forms of collaboration with many leading Japanese artists,
such as B’z (as a recording and tour support member), Yoshihiro Kai, Kyosuke
Himuro, and Namie Amuro.
Discography

Yuka & Chronoship’s
1st album, “Water Reincarnation”, was released in June 2011, and their 2nd
album, “Dino Rocket Oxygen”, in April 2013 from the French progressive label,
Musea. In September, 2015, the band released their 3rd album, “The 3rd Planetary Chronicles” from Cherry Red Records in the U.K.
Water Reincarnation
As a country consisting
of four main islands surrounded by the sea, Japan has long benefited, but at
times greatly suffered from water from the ancient times. This album depicts
such an ever-recurring water cycle. From an almost cosmic perspective and with
technical and musical richness, this grandiose concept-album portrays the
reincarnation of water. The rain is turned into a river; a river pours into the
sea; the sea then forms clouds; and clouds are turned back into the rain.DINO ROCKET OXYGEN
The album is made of
three suites: “Dinosaur Suite”, “R is for Rocket Suite”, and “Oxygen Suite”.
Compared to the 1st, this album’s arrangement gives it more of a touch of band
sound. The band & title logo are designed by Roger Dean, an iconic
progressive rock artist who has created many covers of legendary progressive
rock bands.About Roger Dean
Roger Dean is an English
painter, illustrator, and art designer. He became widely known for his album
cover work for Yes’s 4th album, “Fragile”, with the touch of fantasy that
perfectly matches the theme of the album. In addition to many other album
covers of Yes, he created a variety of album artworks of Uriah Heep, Gentle
Giant, and other progressive rock bands. He also designed Virgin Records
(original) logo and label.   http://www.rogerdean.com/


The 3rd Planetary Chronicles

The band’s 3rd album,
“The 3rd Planetary Chronicles”, is a grandiose concept album themed with
scientific/technological revolutions in the history of the Earth (the third
planet from the Sun). The album’s booklet is designed by Hideji Oda, a reputed
manga artist/illustrator of “Diffusion Disease”, “Coo’s World”, and “Miyori no
Mori”.
To further enhance the
quality of this memorable UK debut album, the band used MotionGallery
crowdfunding. With the album made possible with many crowdfunding contributors,
Yuka & Chronoship could take such a big step to land on the birthplace of
progressive rock!

ActivitiesJune, 2011  Yuka & Chronoship’s 1st album, “Water Reincarnation”, was released. April, 2013  Their 2nd album, “DINO ROCKET OXYGEN”, was released.May, 2013  The band appeared at Prog’Sud 2013, a French prog rock festival.August, 2014  The band appeared at Festival Crescendo 2014
in France.September, 2015  Yuka & Chronoship
made their UK debut with their 3rd album released from Cherry Red Records.

  • I am Zach Gaviria. Actor, Model, Musician, and Comedy Rapper from New Jersey.
  • I would love to keep creating and telling stories through music.
  • My granny just went viral...

Every contributor will receive PERKS !

things I will be needing through the contributions:

story:
magyar változat 

THE BAND

MACHINAE SUPREMACY – where machines rule!

In the dawn of online distribution a small Swedish group appeared on the digital horizon and raised an army of retro gamers and metal warriors. Their music combines classic power metal and other nordic influences with the chiptune melody and soundscape of the ‘80s. Ladies and gentlemen, I present you Machinae Supremacy.

INCEPTION

The year is 20xx when a team in Luleå wants to create something outstanding. This is before the era of YouTube and online music sharing is still in its infancy. It was a bold move to make their first works available for free. And they succeeded! At the time of their first album, produced by a major publisher (Spinefarm) the downloads exceeded millions and their fame skyrocketed in geek circles. Some can’t even fathom that all of this happened before the age of online streaming and yet managed to reach a wide audience. Machinae Supremacy is the living proof of the creative community bonding powers of the internet. They are the heralds of amateur content creation gone professional. This, of course, couldn’t have happened without the world wide web. The recipe is simple. At the home of “In Flames” every computer network hosts a fair amount of melodic and fierce metal music. The boys cranked this up to 11 by introducing a SIDStation, a synthesiser utilising the sound chip of the legendary C64. Today it is expected to hear serious symphonic interludes and sophisticated chiptune segments alike.

MODERN QUALITY METAL

Following their initial success, they had their fair share of tours. They are recurring guests at Scandinavian demoparties, eSports leagues and the “Play! A Video Game Symphony” concerts. They also had the opportunity to share the stage with the Royal Stockholm Philharmonic Orchestra. In the meantime, they made music for the indie shmup “Jets ‘n’ Guns”, worked on the music for the reimagined Bionic Commando by Capcom, a new “Giana Sisters” title and they celebrated Zelda’s 30th birthday with a cover of “Gerudo Valley”. A good indication of their outstanding creativity and dedication to quality is the fact that Plogue (the creators of the famed VST synth plugin Chipsounds) is among their prestigious sponsors - such as Jackson Guitars and Asus’ Republic of Gamers brand. The Swedish pixel warriors are no strangers to Hungary. If we get the support we need they will grace us with their presence yet again.

MEET THE LEGACY

To this very day, one can download a tremendous amount of material from the band’s website, for free of course. Their colourful collection - titled Echoes - absolutely left a mark on the metal-chiptune crossover genre and inspired a great line of artists. If you are looking for an even more substantial experience I recommend following it up with the free album called “Deux Ex Machinae”.  This being their first quasi-professional album it stands as a homage to such gaming classics as the intro to Final Fantasy VI closed by the track Flagcarrier. If this still wasn’t enough head to ITunes, Google Play Music or to your preferred platform and blast the triumvirate of “Redeemer”-”Overworld”-”A view from” all day long!

 

article written by: mcmacko 
translated by: Houruck
 

THE ORGANISER

Improving gaming communities with fun

The main goal of Insert Coin Association for Video Game Culture (founded in 2013) is to improve the local gaming community. http://insert-coin.hu/ (non-profit organisation)

PixelCon is our video game cultural party brand.

PixelCon is not a commercial event selling the latest gamer stuff, nor a gaming history exhibition. PixelCon presents the real values of gaming culture, the fun experience. Not only by showcasing these video games but with fostering any creative manifestation that has roots in it: like video game music.

This is why the live music acts are among the most important parts of PixelCon parties. Loud video game music blows your mind!

The most expensive part

Previously 75% of the PixelCon parties' budget has been used for the concerts.

Some said this is unfair against those who don't want to stay until the concert and don't want to pay the full price PixelCon ticket.

On the other hand, if the budget is bigger the financial risk is higher.

For the next PixelCon we've invited the famous Swedish band MACHINAE SUPREMACY. Following the will of the Insert Coin Association members, we have to handle the financial risks by raising the money for this show via crowdfunding.

If it succeeds, this show will blow your mind. But if it fails, we won't charge the backers and we have to give up on the MaSu concert.

THE EVENT

Concert

Location: In the heart of Budapest, at Blaha Lujza Tér, Corvin Club, https://www.facebook.com/corvinclub

facebook evenet: https://www.facebook.com/events/1026502297439056/

Opening hour for guest with Concert Ticket: 18:00

Opening act: 19:00, SIDrip Alliance (HUN) the best Hungarian SID rock band
Main act: 21:00, MACHINAE SUPREMACY (SWE)

Afterparty in the retro game room of PixelCon

PixelCon

At the same day at the same place

Opening Hour: 10:00 am

You can play with a bunch of retro video games.

There will be:

  • Public talks by veteran game developers
  • Cosplay competition
  • Fun competitions featuring Hungarian gamer celebrities
  • Indie GRAND PIX award, for local indie game developers
  • JAM the RADAR, lowresjam competition (for game demos in 64x64 pixel)
  • Local gamer communities
    • Fighting Gamers
    • Arcade Machine fans
    • Retro gamers, collectors
    • Starship Artemis
    • HackerSpace Budapest
    • Nintendo fan community
  • Local artists influenced by video games
  • Retro gaming room with tons of old computers, consoles, and arcade machines
  • Retro game fair

Ticket price: 3 EUR

Even if this crowdfunding campaign fails (please don't let it happen!) we won't give up on PixelCon. But that means we cannot afford to invite MaSu.

story:
Cendrillon is a simple but savvy Mexican señorita, her papá has ambitions above his social station and a secret past (!), and her clueless hermanas take her for granted.

May 4 & 6 at Warehouse XI in Union Square, Somerville. Visit www.cambridgechamberensemble.org for more information and Brown Paper Tickets for tickets

We need your support, both personal and financial, to bring this amazing opera to life in its Boston-area premiere.
Our Goals:

  • To introduce audiences to operatic gems - lesser known pieces of musical magic that deserve to be widely heard
  • To facilitate community involvement through bringing in Cambridge high school students as assistant stage manager, costume intern, and stage hands
  • To bring children to opera by offering two-for-one child tickets, 3rd child free!
  • To support a mix of  emerging and seasoned performers who form a collaborative artistic community
  • To share our work with the Boston area: performing in small, intimate venues, senior residences,  and schools; to spread the joy of music. We aim to lift the spirits of those in closed settings while exposing younger audiences to up-close and personal theater.

Who We Are

Our first season offered the charm and intimacy of a salon performance. We are moving to a bigger and wonderful space for Cendrillon – the slightly Bohemian Warehouse XI in up-and-coming Union Square Somerville. The new space lets us reach a larger audience, especially children and young people.  

As we grow, we plan to alternate salon performances with their immediate and intimate connection between audience and cast, with performances in slightly larger venues. The intimate human connection - our ability to reach people directly through music – remains the guiding principle we foster in The Cambridge Chamber Ensemble.

What we need: This season’s Cendrillon requires a larger financial base than last year as we are moving to a theater and have a larger cast. Our campaign target of $10,000 will go toward our major expenses: rental of Warehouse XI, fees for 13 singers, music and stage directors, and professional lighting. Ticket sales and some portion of donations will cover costumes, props, and video recording expenses.

Many young companies do not pay their musicians. We feel that all performing artists deserve to be compensated as part of a fully professional experience. Our singers are among the most promising and finest performers in the Boston area, and they deserve the very best from our company. Similarly, we provide our student interns with a small compensation so that they know we consider them professionals-in-training.

Other Ways you can Help: We would love your help, in both financial and non-financial ways. Pass along our Indiegogo campaign to your friends, and spread the word about our wonderful and exciting new opera company! No contribution is too small. If you cannot donate a dollar amount, tell your friends to buy  tickets (only $20, $15 for seniors and students, $5 for children!) and come and enjoy Cendrillon. May 4, 7:30 pm and May 6, 2 pm and 6:30 pm at Warehouse XI, 11 Sanborn Court, Union Square, Somerville, MA.
story_txt:
Cendrillon is a simple but savvy Mexican señorita, her papá has ambitions above his social station and a secret past (!), and her clueless hermanas take her for granted.May 4 & 6 at Warehouse XI in Union Square, Somerville. Visit www.cambridgechamberensemble.org for more information and Brown Paper Tickets for ticketsWe need your support, both personal and financial, to bring this amazing opera to life in its Boston-area premiere.Our Goals:
To introduce audiences to operatic gems - lesser known pieces of musical magic that deserve to be widely heard
To facilitate community involvement through bringing in Cambridge high school students as assistant stage manager, costume intern, and stage hands
To bring children to opera by offering two-for-one child tickets, 3rd child free!
To support a mix of  emerging and seasoned performers who form a collaborative artistic community
To share our work with the Boston area: performing in small, intimate venues, senior residences,  and schools; to spread the joy of music. We aim to lift the spirits of those in closed settings while exposing younger audiences to up-close and personal theater.
Who We AreOur first season offered the charm and intimacy of a salon performance. We are moving to a bigger and wonderful space for Cendrillon – the slightly Bohemian Warehouse XI in up-and-coming Union Square Somerville. The new space lets us reach a larger audience, especially children and young people.  As we grow, we plan to alternate salon performances with their immediate and intimate connection between audience and cast, with performances in slightly larger venues. The intimate human connection - our ability to reach people directly through music – remains the guiding principle we foster in The Cambridge Chamber Ensemble.What we need: This season’s Cendrillon requires a larger financial base than last year as we are moving to a theater and have a larger cast. Our campaign target of $10,000 will go toward our major expenses: rental of Warehouse XI, fees for 13 singers, music and stage directors, and professional lighting. Ticket sales and some portion of donations will cover costumes, props, and video recording expenses.Many young companies do not pay their musicians. We feel that all performing artists deserve to be compensated as part of a fully professional experience. Our singers are among the most promising and finest performers in the Boston area, and they deserve the very best from our company. Similarly, we provide our student interns with a small compensation so that they know we consider them professionals-in-training.Other Ways you can Help: We would love your help, in both financial and non-financial ways. Pass along our Indiegogo campaign to your friends, and spread the word about our wonderful and exciting new opera company! No contribution is too small. If you cannot donate a dollar amount, tell your friends to buy  tickets (only $20, $15 for seniors and students, $5 for children!) and come and enjoy Cendrillon. May 4, 7:30 pm and May 6, 2 pm and 6:30 pm at Warehouse XI, 11 Sanborn Court, Union Square, Somerville, MA.

story:
Short Summary

Ann Arbor/ Ypsilanti | Atlanta | Boston | Chicago | Colorado | DC Metro | Los Angeles | Milwaukee | New Orleans | NYC | North Texas | Philadelphia | Portland | San Francisco | Seattle | The Twin Cities | Your Town

Born in the backroom of the famous Freddys Bar in Brooklyn, Opera on Tap has grown from a few opera-singing friends who needed more opportunities to do what they love into a national movement.  With 16 chapters across the country, programming ranging from barroom concerts to in-school performances to new works creation, development and production, AND a network of over 500 classical performers and creators, Opera on Tap has arrived on the American cultural scene as one of the most far-reaching proponents of opera-advocacy in the nation.  

We sing opera for everybody- big or small, rich or poor and we do it for the price of a drink.  In 2014 OOT saw the launch of 3 new Chapters and the triumph of our first full production of an opera we commissioned and produced at the NY International Fringe Festival.  2015 will mark our 10th anniversary as a company.  To celebrate this milestone, we want to come out singing even louder than we already do. We want to tour our original opera to our Chapters, provide scholarship for our performers nationwide and strengthen our national network by adding more administrative support for our fearless Chapter managing divas and divos across the country.  

What We Need & What You Get

We have laid the foundation for this national network quite literally on a dime.  While our reach is big, our national budget is very small.  If we reach our $15,000 goal for general operating support, we will increase our national budget by 17%.  JUST IMAGINE WHAT WE CAN DO WITH A BUDGET INCREASE LIKE THAT!  

Ok.. we’ll imagine for you:

If we reach our goal we will be able to:

  • ACTUALLY CREATE SEED FUNDING FOR A NATIONAL TOUR PROGRAM!- to tour productions to our chapters across the country via our Roadworks Series where we cast performers locally.

  • ACTUALLY HAVE A FULL-FLEDGED SCHOLARSHIP FUND- long have we dreamt of being able to give scholarships to our young emerging performers to help them with career-related expenses, which between voice lessons/ coachings/ photos/ websites/ plane tickets/ graduate school training, can be extremely high.

  • ACTUALLY HAVE A MARKETING BUDGET!-  We’ve done everything up until now on a dime, on the web and on the backs of our volunteer staff.  With money raised we will have a national marketing fund that ALL of our chapters will be able to access to pay for marketing expenses related to their own productions and performances.

Why support Opera on Tap?  We love to sing for our communities and DO.  We dream bigger than our pockets and MAKE OPERA HAPPEN all over the country.  We empower performers to take the lead on creating performance opportunities for themselves.  AND YOU BENEFIT.  On any given night, in 16 cities across the country, we move people like you and we make you laugh.  At the end of your busy workday, we provide you with sublime musical moments.  Come on down to your local watering hole and see us sometime. You will not be disappointed.  

Why else?  Because we have a proven track record of staying in the game as an organization in an increasingly harsh climate for the classical arts.  We’ve done it for 10 years on next to no money.  We aren’t going anywhere and your contribution, no matter how big or small, will directly impact our organization in a very positive way.
And why else??  Check out our awesome perks!  

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if you don't have the cheese right now to help us out, but there are so many other ways you can help us with this campaign!  Spread the word using Indiegogo's fantastic sharing tools.  Give us a shoutout to your Friends and Followers!  Send an email about the campaign to your contacts.  Having fundraised using this platform before, we know that your sharing the campaign is what will make it ultimately successful.  

Please consider participating in our Virtual Cheers. Submit a short video clip of you saying “cheers” while having a drink to: operaontap@operaontap.com.We’ll be making a compilation video to share on OOT social media sites for all to enjoy.

THANK YOU FROM THE BOTTOM OF OUR OPERATIC HEARTS!

story:
SCHWING Into Fall at the 6th Annual BOSTON HASSLE MUSIC FESTIVAL. We are Boston's Underground Music Fest!

BRAIN Arts Organization is proud to present the 6th Annual Boston Hassle Fest! This year's festival will be held on November 7 and 8 at Cuisine en Locale in Somerville, MA and is bigger and better than ever with 40+ bands over two days (scroll to bottom for full lineup and event details) and featured headliners:
  • Body/Head (Kim Gordon (of Sonic Youth) and Bill Nace)
  • Chris Corsano and Bill Orcutt duo
  • No Joy
  • Jason Lescalleet and Kevin Drumm duo
  • Nautical Almanac
  • Bill Orcutt (solo)
  • Blues Control

    BOSTON HASSLE is one of the three main components of the 501(c)(3) non-profit BRAIN Arts Organization. Our mission is:

    Foster an innovative, compelling, and interconnected music, art, and film community in the greater Boston area through grassroots and inclusive participatory culture.

    Boston Hassle is a COMPLETELY VOLUNTEER-RUN project that constantly interacts with, participates in, writes about, and generally shines a light on Boston and New England's art, music, and film communities! 

    We cannot throw this festival without your support! We are a group of individuals united by a love of art and infused with a DIY spirit that guides us in making this and all of our other events and projects happen. We serve the artistic community of Boston and New England and we aim to show through this campaign that our community believes in what we do.

    By supporting Boston Hassle and our biggest event of the year, Hassle Fest 6, you can ensure that our organization and all of its artistic, community-minded initiatives get the most exposure that they will receive all year. You'll also be helping to guarantee that a seriously amazing and eye-opening music festival has the support that it needs to be as wonderful and exciting as it possibly can be!

    What We Are Asking For

    We are trying to raise $6,500 via this campaign. After fees this will leave Boston Hassle with roughly $6,000 if successful. This amount is roughly 1/3 of the overall cost of throwing Hassle Fest 6. Funding for the rest of the fest and its many costs* will come from ticket sales and various fest sponsorships. This Indiegogo campaign must succeed for the fest to go on as planned!

    *Most of the costs for Hassle Fest are performer related, but there are other costs as well including: Venue fees, printing, and art. Hassle Fest will cost about $17,500 to put on. No individual in our organization receives any compensation for their effort in producing this festival.

    Why Support This Campaign (and Boston Hassle)?

    This is our 6th annual Boston Hassle Fest. This year also marks our 4th crowd-sourced fundraising effort on behalf of Hassle Fest. In each previous year we have achieved our goal and each and every year the fest, and with it our organization, has grown substantially.

    By contributing to this campaign and sharing it with others YOU show your commitment to our core principle of offering affordable, all-ages shows featuring engaging musical artists that are fairly compensated.

    Together with your support, we will not only succeed in throwing an incredible festival but more importantly we will demonstrate to Boston and the wider public that there is a viable alternative, non-profit model for supporting music and the arts, one that avoids the pitfalls of alcohol-driven profits and "safe," industry-sponsored musical acts. As our message travels farther and reaches more ears we will hopefully have more opportunities to initiate and support even more art-focused and community-minded projects.

    Lend a Hand!

    Please share our campaign and our campaign video! We are into embeds and shares but we are also into word of mouth! People used to do that before the internet! Remember that?!

    The Boston Hassle webzine and the Boston Compass newspaper exist as platforms for artists, writers, video makers, and designers (from New England and beyond) to showcase their art. Use us as a platform, enrich what we do, and get your work seen or heard by our huge worldwide readership and viewership.

    WE ALSO NEED AWESOME PEOPLE (like you!) TO VOLUNTEER WITH BOSTON HASSLE. Please get in touch about show listings, writing for the paper or website, taking photos, site/calendar maintenance, videography, organizational help, social networking, Compass distribution, or ANY OTHER NEW IDEAS you may have for what this organization could be. We are open to new ideas, in fact, WE LOVE THEM. If what you’re into is not represented in our pages or on our site but you think it should be, TAKE INITIATIVE AND BECOME A PART OF WHAT WE'RE DOING! Get in touch at bostonhassle@gmail.com or take a look at one of these sites:

    www.bostonhassle.com
    www.bostonhassle.com/boston-compass
    www.bostonhassle.com/hassleshows
    www.bostonhasslefest.com

    Stretch Goals

    Reach for the sky! If you help us get beyond our goal of $6,500 you can support Boston Hassle in the following ways:

    • $7,500: We will purchase a new subwoofer so that we can bring in the best electronic music performers from around the world for your enjoyment.
    • $9,000: We will purchase a new PA system so that we can put on EVEN MORE than the 100+ shows we already do per year. And with a new PA each and every one of those shows will sound better and LOUDER than they already do.
    • $12,000: Boston Hassle will give back to you with a FREE SHOW HEADLINED BY LIGHTNING BOLT. Seriously.
    Thanks again for stopping by our crowdfunding page! We hope you'll support us, either with a donation or with your time. A special thanks goes to Marina Argyriou, Stephen Hill, Sydney Kinchen, Matt Lundin, James Moore, and Véra Vidal for the excellent campaign video above! Party on dudes, and we'll see you in November!
    ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

    HASSLE FEST 6 LINEUP AS OF 10/3/14
    Both days hosted by LUXARDO
    • Ben Hersey (W. Mass.): http://benjaminhersey.tumblr.com/
    • Bill Orcutt (solo) (CA): http://palilalia.com/
    • Blues Control (PA): https://soundcloud.com/bluescontrol
    • Body/Head (W. Mass.): Kim Gordon (of Sonic Youth) and Bill Nace): http://www.bodyheadmusic.com
    • Brandon Seabrook (NY): http://www.seabrookpowerplant.com/
    • Bugs And Rats (Boston): http://bugsandrats.bandcamp.com/
    • Burnt Skull (Austin): http://burntskull.bandcamp.com/
    • CE Schneider Topical (NY): https://soundcloud.com/ceschneidertopical
    • Chris Corsano and Bill Orcutt duo (W. Mass./CA)
    • Colin L Orchestra (NY): http://freemusicarchive.org/music/colin_l_orchestra/

    • Guerilla Toss (Boston): http://guerillatoss.bandcamp.com/
    • Horse Lords (Baltimore): http://horselords.bandcamp.com/
    • Hunnie Bunnies (Philadelphia): https://soundcloud.com/juicy-watermelon/03-hunnie-bunnies-live-at
    • Hyrrokkin (OH): http://hyrrokkin.bandcamp.com/
    • IAN (Boston): http://eyyunn.bandcamp.com/
    • Inhalants (NYC; Jahiliyya Fields & Patricia duo): https://soundcloud.com/patriciaaa/inhalants-w-jahiliyya-fields
    • Jason Lescalleet and Kevin Drumm duo (ME/Chicago)
    • Jerry Paper (NYC): http://jerrypaper.bandcamp.com/
    • Junkyard (NYC): Adam from The Dreebs solo
    • Khaki Blazer (OH; mems. Of Mothcock)
    • KTB (Boston; mems. Bugs & Rats, Guerilla Toss): https://soundcloud.com/ketaminethebenevolent
    • Le Trash Can (Montreal): http://godathletics.bandcamp.com/album/2
    • Nancy (NYC): http://nancymommy.bandcamp.com
    • Nautical Almanac (Baltimore): http://freemusicarchive.org/music/Nautical_Almanac/
    • No Joy (Montreal): http://nojoymusic.com
    • Old Wave (Boston): Pancho The Kidd & band
    • Palberta (NY): http://palbertapalberta.bandcamp.com/
    • Particulars (Boston): http://www.bostonhassle.com/2014/07/17/particulars-particulars-ep/
    • Pigeons (NYC/W. Mass.) : http://pigeonsband.com/
    • Pile (Boston): http://pile.bandcamp.com/
    • Prostitutes (Cleveland): https://soundcloud.com/stabudown
    • Quicksails (Chicago): https://soundcloud.com/quicksails
    • Rosie and the Rosies (Boston): https://soundcloud.com/rosie-and-the-rosies
    • Ryan Power (VT): http://ryanpower.org/
    • Tellevision (Boston/ Berlin): http://tellavision.bandcamp.com/
    • Tomboy (Boston): http://tomboy.bandcamp.com/
    • Tredicci Bacci (Boston): http://tredicibacci.bandcamp.com/
    STAY TUNED FOR ADDITIONS AND UPDATES... THEY'RE COMING!

    EVENT DETAILS

    Friday, November 7, 6pm - 12:30am
    Saturday, November 8, 3pm - 12:30am
    @     Cuisine en Locale--156 Highland Ave., Somerville, MA
    ALL AGES

    With FEST EXTENSION afterparties featuring even more amazing bands each night until 2am (because we don't want this to end @ 12:30!!!!).
    @ Secret Location in Central Square
    ALL AGES

    PERFORMANCE SCHEDULES (as of 10/10/14)

    FRIDAY (7th)

    HASSLE FEST 6 @ Cuisine en Locale

    (performance times subject to change)

    FREE for attendees of main body of FEST. $5 otherwise.

    for more info on bands & links please visit:

    https://www.facebook.com/events/833981466626385/

story:
Welcome to the Revolution

First let me thank each and every one of you who have taken the time to visit this campaign, share with friends, and join our cause. Fans of the arts are the only reason the music industry exists in the first place, so without you we would be nothing. I'd also like to thank J for her passion and willingness to accomplish her dreams, regardless of what "Labels" told her because without that we would have never met to take this idea to the next level. 

Thank you for the introduction J. As she said in the Video, I'm Chad, an entrepreneur and long time problem solver (or at least that's what I'm told). I've consulted with numerous start ups and business owners, and when I decided to take my skills online I met J. I'll always remember the first Skype we had because as I do with all of my clients, I asked the question: "Why are you doing this?" She responded by saying, "because I want to touch peoples hearts and make them happy." By this time I had already watched a few of her videos, and even though I couldn't understand what she was saying through much of the songs (English is my only fluent language), I couldn't stop listening because that's exactly what her music did; these feelings are exactly what led me to my second set of questions: "Why can't you do this for a living? Haven't you contacted labels, tried producing records, etc.?" and her response is what has inspired this journey I'm on with her. 

When J told me she had performed at numerous shows, contacted multiple record labels, spoke with producers, and collaborated with other industry artists and still had to work a day job because she didn't fit the "image" necessary to be a part of "their industry" I was more than upset. As a passionate lover of music, I've never believed that a person had to fit a specific "image" to perform well. Music is about creating beauty out of sound and passion, not magazine covers and photo shoots. So the beauty I found in her inspired me to solve this problem. This campaign is not only the launchpad for J's career, but also the launch to a business system I have specially designed that makes the only things necessary to be a professional performing artist are passion and fans. 

By backing this campaign you are helping launch a talented young artist's first album, while also helping take an industry back and give it to the fans and artists who created it. When other up and coming or ostracized artists see the success created here, they will know that they can mimic this system to make a living performing full time without being under the thumb of a label.


What We Need 

First and foremost, we need your attention. We need you to share this campaign as often as possible with as many people as possible. Without awareness, there can be no change, and your willingness to share is what will create the awareness we need to succeed. 

Second, we need you to give whatever you can spare for the cause. Even a dollar gets us closer to showing industry labels that the revolution has begun. The following is a cost chart for producing the album and other perks we've added for this remarkable occasion.

    Songwriting and Composition
    		$3,750.00
    Music Programming    $8,500.00
    Digital Production    $8,335.00
    T-Shirts @ 3.95/t-shirt   $395.00
    Guitars @ $200/guitar   $1,000.00
    True Fans Website   $1,200.00
    Graphic Designer (for T-shirt and Guitar)   $500.00

    		 
    Processing Fees @ 3%
    		$828.00
    Indiegogo Fee @ 4%
    		$1,104.00
    Promotional Fees 7% $1,932.00

    Total Funding Necessary   $27,600.00

Risks & Challenges

The only challenge we face is time. Album production and building a custom membership website takes time. We are estimating 3-6 months for everything to be finalized once funded, but when dealing with the arts you never know what can happen and what inspirations will guide you to the next song so it could very well be less time. 

But, to face this challenge, you have J and I's promise that we will give everything we have to accomplishing this goal quickly and at the highest level of quality.

If the full goal is not hit, our first task will be to build the true fans website, so we can continue receiving funds towards our goal of completing the album, and any remaining funds will be put towards the completion of the album. 

What You Get

All backers will be invited to join our secret facebook group exclusive to backers. 

truefans.jeyabargavi.com memberships will begin upon completion of the website and all music and other material will be accessible upon publishing. (visit http://jeyabargavi.com/true-fans/ to get a description of membership packages).

All perks with an asterisk (*) next to them need to be shipped. I have arranged for shipping within the United Arab Emirates, but if you live outside of the UAE please contact me prior to donating to arrange shipping of your merchandise. 

now go share this with your friends and family so they too can join the revolution.

story:
by G-d's help and kindness...

Short Summary

  • Hi!  My name is Rachael Rosenbaum.  Thanks so much for reading.  I sing and play the lever harp (and other unique instruments), and make music in hopes of uplifting and deepening the lives of fellow women.  The harp, rather than the guitar or piano, is the instrument which, for some reason, my hands and voice feel most comfortable with!  (See www.harprachael.com for more information.)  
  • While composing new music for my second album, I'm being hampered by the fact that my current harp, a beautiful but aging, third-hand instrument, is having a variety of technical problems.  It is also quite large and cumbersome, and a more portable instrument would greatly enhance and expand my music-sharing opportunities.    
  • WIth your kind and generous help, a new harp will allow me to continue performing to support my first album, and give me what I need to continue composing for my second and beyond, G-d willing!  I seek a new, high-quality instrument that will last many years of inspired song-making.  I am happy to say that when people come to my concerts, it makes a real positive difference in their lives.  I think this music of harp and voice gives people a rare, precious moment to connect to the soul within. 
  •  Please help me continue to give the gift of inspirational Music to many more people!


What We Need & What You Get

  • A high quality, long-lasting new harp is not so cheap!  34 strings are a lot more than the six on a standard guitar.  I'm hoping to purchase a new, high-quality, portable, 34-string harp from a reputable harp maker, and I've done a lot of research on what that constitutes.  (I'm looking mostly at Dusty Strings and Thormahlen, as well as Blevins).
  • If I don't reach the entire goal, I will use whatever money is made towards a harp anyhow, and I may have to purchase a less costly model or a used model.  Whatever you contribute is significant to me and will help-thank you so much!!

The Impact

  • This music business is not what one would call financially lucrative!  But for years I have sweated, learning how to use my head, heart, voice, and hands to coax the music from my harp and soul.   Raising my beautiful family and making time for music has been a solid challenge, but I must press on because I feel fundamentally that this is what G-d wants from me.  And little in this whole world makes me feel more alive than when someone says, "This music is so deep."  That means it touched them, and in today's world I can think of little that is more truly valuable.      
  • Here are some quotes from listeners:
  • "Wow what a beautiful instrument. You clearly are connected with the harp....when you play it...it comes across with such flow...Hatzlacha [success] with your music....,may you continue to share it and bring light and Torah to people's hearts with its melodies and songs!"- Rivka Leah Cylich

  • "This is absolutely beautiful. Can't sleep due to jetlag...and found this [song], thank you!!!!  Shoshannah Brombacher

    "Wow. you sing with such heart and soul...and seriously who plays the harp?? thats so unique! love it!!"  LJ

    "Voice of an angel!!"  Shaindel Antelis


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please, PLEASE share this by e-mail and Facebook!  A few clicks can go a long way, with G-d's help!  
  • Indiegogo has share tools you can use easily, too!

THANK YOU AND G-D BLESS YOU!  I hope to share a wonderful success story very soon!

story:
A special THANK YOU to Edward A. Williams for producing/filming my indiegogo video and taking some great photos for this project.

Contact Edward on facebook: https://www.facebook.com/edward.a.williams?fref...

Check out an unplugged version of my song "Ties that Bind".  Click on the link below and download for FREE for the first week of the campaign.

http://soundcloud.com/brittany-mason-7/01-ties-...


What is indiegogo?

Indiegogo is a crowdfunding platform where people can raise money for various projects. This is not an investment or charity. It is an exchange of funds from friends and fans who, in turn, receive perks/rewards for their contributions to the project.


About Me

I am a Nashville-based singer/songwriter.  I have hosted various writer's nights in Music City and knew I wanted to be a musician/writer from a very young age. I've had the pleasure of writing with some established writers who have had their songs recorded by various artists including: Alice Cooper, Hank Williams Jr., Randy Travis, George Jones, and Billy Currington.  They have taught me this business takes a lot of hard work, dedication, thick skin, and most of all-how to write some great songs!  However, in the words of The Beatles, "I get by with a little help from my friends."  This is a very competitive industry that demands high-quality recording standards.  The funding of this project from your donations will allow me to represent my material in the way I want it to be viewed as a singer-songwriter.  Professional.   Thank you for your help.  Each donation is a step closer to making this project a reality. 

My Goal

My goal is to raise a MINIMUM of $5,000, and I only have 45 days to do it! Please give now!  Every dollar counts and is needed for studio time, musicians, engineering, and CD duplication. 

Be sure to check out the "perks" section on the right sidebar for what you'll receive as a thank you for contributing to this project.


Other Ways You Can Help

 Please help me get the word out about this campaign. Share it on facebook, twitter, instagram, email blast, etc.  Use the Indiegogo share tools.

story:
What the project is about

My name is Graham Iddon and I go by the stage name of Raving Wild. I've been writing and recording music for around 10 years now. I am looking to begin my first independent project titled 'Arcana', an LP based on folklore, myth, legends, esotericism and the occult.

My aim is to modernise old texts and accounts in the form of music. As a result I've spent a considerable amount of time researching the aforementioned topics and I am at present in the process of creating new material.

I'd love nothing more than to create this to the best of my abilities however I very much require your help! 

How you can help

In order to generate a high quality LP it will be necessary for me to work with a skilled producer in a full studio. Upon finishing I will need assistance with artwork and design for both digital and hard copies. Once these stages are complete I will be working with a distributor to ensure this project is available to everyone.

If you're kind enough to donate or even share this page among your friends it will help me to fund this project and give me the best possible chance of making more music in future. There are several options regarding donations, any help you can offer is greatly appreciated and there are various perks for your support. 

Thanks for taking the time to read this.

story:
Short Summary:

Hello, I'm Dennis Scoyne. I'm a high school student who also happens to be an electronic music producer. My dream is to get my album out to people so they can hear me and my expression through music. There's just one problem: I ain't gots no money. This is where you guys come in. With your help, you can make this dream a reality.

Some of you might be wondering, "What does the money actually go towards?" Well, cd production is no cheap task (especially when you want to get them done right). At the end of this fund raiser, I will be sending my music and cover art to Easy Disc, based out of California, and have them produce as much cd's as I can afford (probably in the standard jewel case, you know, the ones with the "cd hinges", as one of my friends call it).

I'll be selling the albums really cheap (2-3 dollars), and if you give 20 or more dollars, you'll get a free one (with my autograph on it, if that matters for anything). I've recently decided everyone who gives 10 or more dollars gets a Skype (or Oovoo) call of personal appreciation, and 50 or more dollars gets their name on the album cover art (and it won't be in small font either). Thanks to whoever donated, I wish I could thanks each and every person. :D
