story:
What's going on!?

  • Hello! We are Speakers of Infamy, a female fronted Los Angeles based post-hardcore band.
  • Our campaign is to raise funds to work with one of the most creative and successful producers in hardcore music, Omar Espinosa (Escape the Fate)
  • With your donations Speakers of Infamy will begin recording their very first EP


What We Need & What You Get

Break down!

  • We need at least $800 to begin recording our EP.
  • This price point covers the entire recording, mixing, and mastering proccess for one song
  • If we do not meet our fundraising goals, the money will still be used to jump start the recording proccess and create some new merch for you! 
  • Help us become the next band you can't delete off your playlist and we will give you guys some amazing perks/SWAG!

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word!

  • If you cannot donate monetarily, donate your time!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools and connect with our social media pages

  • twitter: @SOI_official
  • instagram: speakersofinfamyofficial

Thanks for all your hardwork and support!

story:
Help Musicians Support produce their 1st Annual Benefit Concert for Music Education.

Help by:

  • Donating to this campaign now.
  • Buy tickets to the show. http://nohojamspecial.bpt.me
  • Help promote the show.  Use the share tools. Tell your friends/family.
  • Become a volunteer for the show. Email: info@musicianssupport.org
  • Make a donation at MusiciansSupport.Org

Musicians Support is a nonprofit charity that raises funds for school and community music programs in the city of Los Angeles.

We are a network of musicians and music lovers working together with like minded people in our community to raise funds for much needed resources in school and community music programs.

Our Mission: To support music education in school and community music programs while helping amateur musicians with valuable resources on their journey to becoming professional artists. We help provide the much needed resources that keeps music alive in our community.


Why this campaign is important:

This campaign is very important to us because we know the impact of music and the benefits it has to our community. All involved have donated their time, effort and poured their hearts into this project. The success of this campaign can ensure a quality benefit concert for our supporters and the city of North Hollywood California.


How the community benefits:

All profits go to benefit school and community music programs in Los Angeles. This event is family friendly and will bring music lovers of all ages together. Benefit concerts are wonderful platforms for strengthening the community by bringing people together to support a cause.


Your donations will help fund:
  • Production
  • Administration
  • Performing Acts
  • Event host MC
  • Posters and Flyers
  • Marketing
  • Event Staff
  • Audio Equipment
  • Rentals

Total cost of show $2500


Help us reach our goal! Make a contribution today.


PERKS:

$15 Donation level, "Music Duet"

Receive the two following digital download PDF training courses.



We believe your passion and support for music will ensure success. Should we fall short of our target, all funds raised will still play a vital part in supporting our cause. Thank you for your consideration.

Get involved. You can benefit the community by spreading the word on your favorite social sites! Use the Indiegogo.com social share tools. Please help get the word out.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Musicians Support presents:

The Summer Kickoff NOHO Jam Special

Saturday June 14th

Located at the Federal Bar in North Hollywood, CA.
Headlining this jam is the legendary, L.A.'s own..
The UNTOUCHABLES!



Dance the night away to their fun and funky beats. You can't miss it!


This show is ALL AGES and family friendly!

Get your tickets here

http://nohojamspecial.bpt.me/


See you there!

This benefit concert is brought to you by
Musicians Support.
visit us at http://www.MusiciansSupport.Org


Musicians Support is a nonprofit charity for music education. Our organization raises funds for school and community music programs in the city of Los Angeles. We help provide the much needed resources that keeps music alive in our community.


Founders Marc Bernal and Devin Baird, are musicians who grew up in L.A. and have worked in music and entertainment for over a decade. The concept for Musicians Support came from a desire to provide a network platform for musicians, students and industry professionals to benefit the community by supporting school and community music programs.


Design and custom graphics for crowdfunding campaign provided by
Web Graphic Guy

story:
Hey everybody!

So it's been more than a year since Pilot came out and I've been hard at work creating new songs and practicing with a new band. I've got a new batch of songs that I'm extremely proud of but I'm not ready to create a full-length album. With that said, these songs are crying to see the light of day. I think you'll all really enjoy them and so I want your help.

THIS PRESALE IS THE ONLY PLACE WHERE YOU CAN PURCHASE A PHYSICAL COPY OF THE EP.

So, what's the scoop on this EP?

Michael Dermot - Drink Some Water
1. If We Had Never Met
2. This Moment
3. I Am a Map
4. Wade
5. Heaven Help Me (Water Song)


What I'll be using this money towards:
Myself and my band are going to be recording this EP at one of Minneapolis' finest studios with one of its finest producers, Mr. Ed Ackerson. Why am I doing this? Because I love these songs and I think they deserve to sound as great as possible.

We're going to put out this EP in September of 2014.

story:
Kirtan on the Playa

Help bring the Kirtaniyas and their amazing Kirtan music (from the devotional Bhakti yoga or the yoga of love) to the Playa at Burning Man 2014. The Kirtaniyas blend traditional Kirtan music from India, sung in traditional sanskrit, with an international sound drawn from musicians in Germany, United Kingdom, Hawaii, and South America. 

The Kirtaniyas will be playing at Red Lightning, Center Camp, Sacred Spaces, and the Temple. Support this campaign if you love the Kirtaniyas and want to help us bring them to the Playa. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need $2500 to pay for the Kirtaniyas admission to the event and food and lodging while they are there. We are excited to offer unique perks for Kirtan lovers who support bringing the Kirtaniyas to the Playa. Here is what we're offering:

  • Kirtaniyas music download
  • Kirtaniyas CD
  • Kirtaniyas Tshirt
  • Tickets for a live concert
  • Private concert at venue of your choice

The Impact

Supporting the Kirtaniyas means you are bringing the yoga of love directly to Burning Man 2014. Help the Kirtaniyas shine their light and impact the lives of others.

story:
New album My Man

Inspired by The Velvet Underground, Vanessa Philippe's new album, "My Man", is comprised of 11 tracks written by Vanessa in French and English and composed by Naïm Amor, with producer Marianne Dissard.


Nouvel album My Man

Sans chercher à refaire du Velvet Underground mais fortement inspirée par leur liberté de faire et par leur son, pour ce nouvel album, je me suis entourée d'artistes franco-américains dont Marianne Dissard à la réalisation et le multi-instrumentiste Naïm Amor à la composition.


L'album contient 11 titres dont une reprise des Velvets Underground "After Hours". Auteure des textes, j'ai aussi co-composé 4 titres, dont "My Man". 

Il vient d'être enregistré à Paris, au studio Haxo, avec Yan Péchin à la guitare (guitariste d'Alain Bashung, Brigitte Fontaine, Miossec..), à la batterie Arthur Vint et à la basse Scott Colberg, venus tout droit de New York.


© Murielle Sauzot


La sortie de l'album est prévue pour le printemps 2015. Mais pour le finaliser je dois encore prévoir pas mal de choses dont le mixage à Minneapolis, au fabuleux studio Hideaway fondé par Joe Mabbott, et le master avec Loud mastering. Il restera également les droits SDRM et le pressage de l'album à financer.

Ce troisième album est très important pour moi, parce que j'ai pris les choses en main dès le début pour la première fois, dans le choix et la structure des textes à mettre en musique, des mélodies et des compositions, afin de faire des chansons qui me correspondent vraiment. C'est tout cela que j'aimerai partager avec vous...

Parution dans le Journal La Marseillaise

19-06-2014


L'enregistrement au studio Haxo à Paris


A quoi servira le financement ?

L'enregistrement est fait, le shooting et la pochette de l'album aussi. Pour finir et sortir cet album comme prévu, il manque encore quelques étapes : le mixage, le mastering, le règlement des droits SDRM de la Sacem, et le pressage des albums. Si je n'atteins pas la somme espérée, la priorité sera le mixage à Minneapolis.

Le mixage à Minneapolis

Mixer l'album à Minneapolis est vraiment dans la continuité du projet, pour la couleur franco-américaine de l'album...

The Hideaway Studio of Minneapolis, founded by Joseph Mabbot, MN, is a premier music recording facility serving the Minneapolis, MN market and such artists as Snoop Dogg, Justin Bieber, Atmosphere, Brother Ali, Cloud Cult, The Matches, Marianne Dissard, and Doomtree...

La petite histoire...

Alors que je travaillais depuis quelques mois à l'écriture de mes nouvelles chansons, j'ai rencontré Marianne Dissard - qui réalise l'album - pendant une formation de Yoga que j'enseigne.

"My Man" est la toute ma première chanson que j'ai composé. J'écrivais en anglais, Marianne est franco-américaine, nous avions toutes les deux sortie notre premier album en 2008 sans le savoir. Cette collaboration s'est imposée tout naturellement, et le choix du compositeur Naïm Amor s'est fait dans la continuité.

Dès la première chanson ça marchait et on a fait 11 titres ! 

Le choix du guitariste Yan Péchin sonnait aussi comme une évidence parce qu'il est dans la rupture, les contrastes, la dissonance, ce qui collait parfaitement avec la couleur recherchée pour l'album.


Toute l'équipe !

Marianne Dissard
Elle est franco-américaine, parolière et réalisatrice. Auteure-interprète de 3 albums, elle a collaboré avec Naïm Amor, Calexico, Howe Gelb, Sergio Mendoza, Fredda… Elle a réalisé elle-même ses 2 derniers albums, et celui de Orso Jesenska.

Naïm Amor
Il est franco-américain. Auteur compositeur et multi-instrumentiste, il a écrit et composé plusieurs albums (Dansons, La sanguine…) et collaboré à divers projets également, dont le premier album de Marianne Dissard.

Yan Péchin
Il est français, guitariste et compositeur. Il a collaboré en studio et sur scène avec plusieurs artistes comme Alain Bashung, Brigitte Fontaine, Chloé Mons, Miossec...

Vanessa Philippe
Elle est française, auteure-interprète de 2 premiers album sortis en 2008 (La dérive) et en 2011 (La fille sans qualités). Elle commence à composer pour ce troisième album. Elle est aussi danseuse contemporaine et chorégraphe pour la pièce "Tenez votre droite".


Last words

L'album n'attend plus que d'être mixé et masterisé pour sortir enfin. C'est l'affaire de quelques semaines, avant de pouvoir l'écouter chez vous :)

Le clip du premier single sortira dès la rentrée 2014 !


And don't forget...

N'hésitez pas à passer le mot, partagez cette page autour de vous, sur vos blogs ou réseaux communautaire.

Vous pouvez aussi juste laisser un message de soutient ou mettre un like sur la page Facebook officielle de l'album.

Toute action, tout partage, est bienvenue.

Et surtout un grand merci à tous d'avoir pris le temps de découvrir le projet !!

Thank you so much

See you

story:
Thank you for taking the time to explore our album fundraising campaign! The Western Shore is comprised of married singer-songwriter duo, Kalee + Charlie Smyth. We (Kalee + Charlie) met three years ago in Seattle where we were both working on separate music projects. A little over one year later, married and living in the Seattle neighborhood of Capitol Hill, we decided to start playing music together and played our first show as a duo on July 4th, 2012 at The Comet Tavern where, coincidentally, we had met one year earlier. We continued to play shows in Seattle for the next year and a half but had our sights set on eventually moving to Nashville. We had the pleasure of playing with wonderful Seattle musicians including Dan Infecto, Danny Beutler, Nicholas Auckland, and Patrick Seick. Last summer we recorded a three song demo in Seattle engineered by Dan Infecto. One year later, we're ready to head back into the studio and record a full length album! 


Our time in Nashville has been rewarding and we have had the opportunity to play with some of the best musicians in town including Andy Mabe, Greg Garing, Andy Gibson, Mark Sloan, Brett Resnick, Brian Dowd, Steve Daly, Ben Guidry, Tyson Rogers, and others! Many of these talented musicians will be playing on this record!


We already have some of the funds to start the recording process and we'll be heading into record with Andy Gibson in East Nashville at the end of July. The funds we raise through this campaign will go towards remaining recording costs (paying the engineer, producer, and musicians), the mixing and mastering of the album, and the record pressing and printing costs. 


We understand if you're not able to contribute financially at this time, but it would mean a lot to us if you forwarded our campaign to people in your network who might be interested in helping us reach our goal!


Thank you for reading our story, for your financial assistance, and most importantly, your support as fans, friends, and family! 


all of our gratitude,
Kalee + Charlie Smyth
The Western Shore

story:
Time's Running Out!

We mixed the album yesterday. It sounds GORGEOUS - even if I do say so myself. 
I'm really, really pleased with it. Ali has done an amazing job!
But only ONE DAY LEFT! Watch the NEW video I've made as taster.
Then help me complete my album by pre-ordering it here. Simply buy it now - for ten pounds - rather than after it's finished. Next up, the cover, and making the actual CD.


Guests

The album includes Karen Moses singing some gorgeous backing vocals, ace blues-harp player Al Collins, playing a mean harp and Ruth Stevens, playing some fabulous fiddle.


Last Time...

In 2013 I recorded my first acoustic album, I Don't Wish to Alarm You But, to good reviews. 

“...and this happy, witty and unpretentious, yet thought provoking acoustic album is the result. I thoroughly enjoyed it.”Jim Marshall - The Folk Diary

“Roger's songs are contemporary, relevant and laced with a dash of humour..." Dai Jeffries R2 

That album was very much a home-made effort. I'm making my new album in a studio and I'm looking for funding. The money raised will pay for mixing, mastering, art-work and making the actual CDs. 

Who Am I?

I began playing in bands when I was 13. Then in the 1980s I co-founded The Killer Rabbits, a comedy rock band which made a name for itself across the South East and London (and with the Walt Disney Corporation who allegedly stole the identity of our lead singer, Roger Rabbit).

On moving to Nottingham I became Jon Lord in a Deep Purple tribute band and on returning south I joined Damn Right, with Floella Benjamin and author Ken Follett.

When folk veteran Robb Johnson invited me to play at Hove Folk Club it rekindled my love of folk and I recorded my first acoustic album on Robb's label, Irregular Records. Currently I take my own songs and my guitar to folk clubs and acoustic venues as well as playing keyboards in Robb's band, The Irregulars. 


Help Me, Obi-Wan Kenobi...

If I can find 100 people to agree to buy the album, at £10 a copy, now, then that would enable me to finish the project. If I eventually find 250 people to buy the album then I will be happy, knowing that I have a small but jolly band of followers enjoying my music.

 The Impact

I was very pleased with my last album, I Don't Wish to Alarm You But. 

For The Position of Jupiter, with a studio at my disposal, production values are higher and I'm getting much closer to the sound I would have liked on that album. 

I have been performing most of the new tracks regularly over the last year or so and so I'm confident that they'll work well on the album. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, and would rather wait for the album official release, then please, please, please help by spreading the word. Tell your friends and share on social media.
Thank you!

In 2013 I recorded my first acoustic album, I Don't Wish to Alarm You But, to good reviews. 
“...and this happy, witty and unpretentious, yet thought provoking acoustic album is the result. I thoroughly enjoyed it.”Jim Marshall - The Folk Diary
“Roger's songs are contemporary, relevant and laced with a dash of humour..." Dai Jeffries R2 
That album was very much a home-made effort. I'm making my new album in a studio and I'm looking for funding. The money raised will pay for mixing, mastering, art-work and making the actual CDs. 

Who Am I?
I began playing in bands when I was 13. Then in the 1980s I co-founded The Killer Rabbits, a comedy rock band
which made a name for itself across the South East and London (and with the Walt Disney Corporation who allegedly stole the identity of our lead singer, Roger
Rabbit).
On moving to Nottingham I became Jon Lord in a Deep Purple tribute band and on returning south I joined Damn Right, with Floella Benjamin and author Ken Follett.When folk veteran Robb Johnson invited me to play at
Hove Folk Club it rekindled my love of folk and I recorded my first acoustic album on Robb's label, Irregular Records. Currently I take my own songs and my guitar to folk clubs and acoustic venues as well as playing keyboards in Robb's band, The Irregulars. Help Me, Obi-Wan Kenobi...
If I can find 100 people to agree to buy the album, at £10 a copy, now, then that would enable me to finish the project. If I eventually find 250 people to buy the album then I will be happy, knowing that I have a small but jolly band of followers enjoying my music.
 The Impact
 I was very pleased with my last album, I Don't Wish to Alarm You But. 
For The Position of Jupiter, with a studio at my disposal, production values are higher and I'm getting much closer to the sound I would have liked on that album. 
I have been performing most of the new tracks regularly over the last year or so and so I'm confident that they'll work well on the album. 
Other Ways You Can Help
 If you can't contribute, and would rather wait for the album official release, then please, please, please help by spreading the word. Tell your friends and share on social media.Thank you!

story:
All funds raised will be used to help with the fuel costs to get to and from Austin, TX. This is an exciting opportunity to help get us to play 3 days at SXSW, while simultaneiusly helping feed and hydrate the needy.

Along the way to TX, we will have shows in AZ, NV and NM, and we want to help as many as we can. ALL DONATIONS AND CONTRIBUTIONS WILL BE A HUGE HELP! We are trying to line up sponsors as well to help this become a reality. Help us by donating so we in turn can help give some love to those in need.

Chose a perk, donate some money and keep an eye on our facebook page at www.facebook.com/robinhillmusic for photo and video updates of what we are doing.

story:
Short Summary

Hi everyone! 

My name is Ashley and I am a 21-year-old songwriter from New York City. I've started this Indiegogo campaign to raise money for my first EP titled "Stability". This EP is a collection of 4 songs that I've been working on for the past few years and I am finally ready to share them with the world! 

Songwriting has been a huge part of my life since I was 13 years old. Opening up about my feelings has never been easy for me so songwriting has always been so cathartic for me when life just doesn't make sense anymore. As a young woman in my twenties, these feelings of being lost and not knowing what I'm doing or what I'm supposed to be doing with my life come quite frequently but there is one thing I know for sure and that is that my writing can help people. 

I am not looking for fame, or to make millions off of  tours and little Ashley Barbie dolls - I just want to be able to properly record my songs so that I can share them with the rest of the world.Hopefully with the money I get from this campaign, I can do exactly that. 

What I Need & What You Get

I understand that $2,500 is a lot of money, but there are a lot of things that go into producing an EP. The money that is donated to this project will go to covering rehearsal space, studio recording time, paying the band and the producer, transportation costs, post-production and marketing. As with any creative project, there is a lot more that can come up, all the more reason for me to need your help. 

If I don't reach my goal, the recording process probably will not happen for another year or so until I can come up with the money myself. I have already waited long enough to get this project going, please don't let those songs sit in my journal another year!

Other Ways You Can Help

 Please share this campaign with everyone you know! (And check out the perks on the side, there are some pretty cool ones!) 

PS: Here are some videos of me performing live!

story:
"Community activist and hip hop pathfinder Gabriel Teodros stands poised to turn the clock backwards to reach the future. His sophomore solo effort, ‘Colored People’s Time Machine’, is an examination of the history, dreams and future of native people everywhere. Not content to analyze the past, Teodros prepares listeners for a future free of the constraints of genre." - Dume 41

16 tracks, 10 different producers, 12 featured vocalists later... in many ways 'Colored People's Time Machine' has been the biggest and most involved album I've done to date.  It took a few years, some of the most personal songs I've ever written, and I want as many people to be able to hear it now as possible.  Getting the funds to put this album out the way we want to hasn't been easy, and it seems what makes the most sense now is to put the power in your hands.  By ordering the album now, by getting any of the packages offered, or even just by spreading the word, you help this music live.  Can't wait to share the album with you.
- gabriel teodros

Where is the money going you ask?
Publicity (print, web, radio), CD duplication, Printing, Shipping, Design Services, Mixing, Mastering...

And if we don't make our goal?
The album still comes out and packages still get filled... we just have to come up with the rest. Some people may not get paid, and the album might get slept on. All hell will break loose in Seattle's streets. This can not be an option... pre-order the album today!


Cover artwork by Julay Nieto (Montreal, QC)
Interview shot & video edited by Malinda Francis (Toronto, ON)
Performance footage shot by Will Delphia (PeaceWorks Conference 2011 - Olympia, WA)


To view the entire Gabriel Teodros performance from the PeaceWorks 2011 Celebration (including full songs from 'Colored People's Time Machine') check http://vimeo.com/24904145 (via The Rachel Corrie Foundation)

For music videos, more interviews and performance footage check http://www.youtube.com/gabrielteodros#p/c/EFE59...


Thank you all for the continued support!

story:
Short Summary

Hello folks - so happy to have you here!

I'm a singer/songwriter from Newfoundland, Canada.  I've spent the last few years in Seoul, South Korea and I've managed to record my second album there.

This time, I've had the pleasure of visiting a real studio with an amazingly talented producer/engineer.

What I Need & What You Get

All of the tracks have been recorded and I've already paid that process.

All that's left is to have the album edited, mixed and mastered.  

I'm not looking to make any money from this. I just want to be able to release it!

Essentially this campaign is a pre-ordering of the album.  

You pre-buy the album at a discounted price, I then have enough to have it finished, and ultimately you get the digital download of the album when it's ready!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't want to pre-buy the album, any amount helps!

Also, helping spread the word goes a long way. :)

story:
Overview

My name is Liane Scholz and I am a German composer/songwriter, living in rural Canada. I've already created my first Album and a Series of Singles and now it's time to take the next step. You can hear all my recorded songs here at my website  - and learn more about me too:

lianeshomestudio.wix.com/lianescholz

By teaming up with my old friend Chris Jodoin, a Toronto based filmmaker, we hope to create a series of music videos to compliment and help promote my album and my music. Chris has most of the equipment we need to shoot this, but we'll need a little help getting him and his equipment to me, and then getting the final video out for all the world to see.

 

Budget or:

Yes You CAN Make a Professional Music Video for $1200;
If You’re Willing to Scrounge, Borrow, Beg and Work for Free.

Music: -------------- $0.00
(Already created, recorded and fully owned by yours truly)

Production equipment we already have: -------------- $0.00
(we already have it, why would we want to spend more money on it?)

Production equipment that we don't have, and can't beg/borrow: --------------$250.00
(We’d pay that too if we hadn’t already spend it many times over to pay for the equipment which we do have)

Transportation for equipment: -------------- $300.00
(There's a fair bit of gear to transport, and it's not light)

Transportation for director: -------------- $0.00
(The current budget calls for Chris to be shipped with the equipment to save costs and we already have a box! But if we make more than our goal, we'll buy him an oxygen tank and a warm blanket)

Post production facilities: -------------- $0.00
(Graciously commandeered by director)

Post-production and mastering fees: -------------- $250.00
(There’s a few costs you just can’t get around!)

Director’s Fee: -------------- $1.00
(Half a beer)

Editor’s Fee: -------------- $0.90
(The other half of a beer, minus the bottle refund)

Accomodations in Kirkland Lake: -------------- $0.00
(I do have a spare bed but Chris may have to fight my potbelly pig for it – c’est la vie)

Miscellaneous:  --------------  $400.00
(Props, Costumes, Coffee, Sandwiches, Duct Tape etc)

Local Transportation: -------------- $0.00
(Michael has a car! He’s willing to drive us and fill the tank.)

 

Rewards for Everyone!

I think in its own right my Project is a Win – Win situation for Everyone. Its pretty hard to buy something with 5 Dollars that makes as good a conversation as “So I know this Indie Singer/Songwriter who’s making her first Music Video right now… I’m helping her out a little!”

Got more to spare? We make it worth your while just have a look at our donation PERKS listed in the right hand column of this page -------------->

 

Please Share This Site!

Whether you were able to make a small donation to our project or not, please tell you family and friends all about it. It just takes a click to send my project forward and keep the ball rolling for me.

If we cannot reach our goal in its entirety Chris will still come up and shoot footage, but we won’t be able to afford the post production, so it may be years until I scratch the money together to share the final product.

Also, it has been brought to my attention that my home website: www.lianeshomestudio.wix.com/lianescholz won't play songs on a small percentage of browsers. If you cannot hear my songs please go to this site: http://www.musicclout.com/contents/userprofile.aspx?u=1dcab54c-1b08-40da-b758-70d4b54bd4cd. 

 

And As Always:

Thank You for Listening!

I appreciate every share, and I really REALLY appreciate every donation. As a Singer/Songwriter the bottom line is getting my music out into the world for people to hear, so every single time someone hit play it gives me a sense of validation... so: Thank You, for your time and your attention.

story:
Short Summary

Creating a full length CD is no mean feat, but thats what we're doing!
 
The Night Street was fun and exposed for the first time to the world the songwriting ability of Australia's least known musician, me, and the vocal stylings of someone well beyond her years, Annalivia
 
For you who dont know, Liv stepped in to save our collective recording project butts last October and since then we have gone on to amass a huge following on social media.
 
Never mind my pasty face in the video; we need your funds and we need them soon!
 
Pledge for our Vinyls or CD's; our T-shirts or just because u love the music!
 
Be a part of something huger than you or I; an idea; a belief that we can ROCK harder than anyone else!
 
Dave King
Producer/Writer
The Contagious

story:
We wake up early.

First and foremostly, thanks for stopping by and checking us out.  We are The 8:30 Band*, a 5-piece band from Glen Burnie, MD.  We're either a Rock band that plays Worship music, or a Worship band that plays our music in ways that could be classified as "Rock". We're not sure how to classify it except to say that we love Jesus a ridiculous amount and we tell Him that in energetically loud ways.  Sometimes quieter ways...but mostly loud-ish to loud ways.  We've been together for almost 10 years (October 1st is our Band-iversary, if sincerity and precision is your thing) leading worship at Faith Baptist Church.

(*We lead the 8;30 worship at Faith.  That's how we got such a creative name.  There's nothing more to it than that.  We told you we wake up early.)

After almost 10 years together (again, October 1st...but you understand), we decided it was time to record an album like real bands do.  We kicked around a lot of different ideas, looked at where most of our attention has been regarding writing and arranging worship music - and we discovered where so much of our attention has been spent over the years.

We wake up early...for Christmas.

We love Christmas.  We love music.  We REALLY love Christmas music.

We realized that, as the self-proclaimed "Most Christmasy Band Ever", we've put so much time and creative energy into putting together our own Christmas songs and versions of popular Christmas carols for our "Christmas with The 8:30 Band" Christmas shows, it only makes sense that our first album EVER should be of the festive variety.  Our problem then became, "How do we pick which songs to include?"  With all of the Christmas shows and worship concerts we've done, we had so many tunes to pull from and we love them all.  Do we include one of our 15-minute medleys? Is the world asking for a country/funk/blues/gospel/operatic version of "Jingle Bells"? Should we include "Dominck the Donkey" and pay massive royalties for that ridiculous song

No.  No to all of that.  

Then we asked ourselves, "The 8:30 Band...what are you really about?" The answer gave us our direction.

We wake up early...for the true meaning of Christmas.

We're here to point to Jesus Christ. If this is the only album we ever put together (we hope not...but at this rate...let's be honest) the one thing we want to communicate is the joy we have because of Jesus Christ.  Without realizing it, the songs that we have written and arranged over the years have had the theme of "Joy" running through all of them. 

Joy because of hope made possible.

Joy because of rescue made a reality.

Joy because the Creator of the universe, in love and mercy, stepped down from His throne in Heaven to enter into our mess and provide a way out for us.  There is nothing greater, nothing more deserving of praise, than this. This calls for a really loud-ish to loud celebration.

Dominick the Donkey will just have to wait.

Exceeding Great Joy.

Our album is all about communicating this joy, celebrating Jesus Christ coming into our world and giving everything we have to Him in worship.  In Matthew 2:10, we're told that when the wise men saw the star, they "rejoiced with exceeding great joy".  On this side of the manger - on this side of the cross - that realization is even greater for us.  So, we choose to look at the word "exceeding" not as an adjective, but a verb.  There's joy.  There's GREAT joy.  But because of Jesus, we're going beyond that.  We're EXCEEDING great joy (see what we did there? Our next album will be called, "Play on Words").

So, here we are.  We've been hard at work in the studio with Greg Parker of Amped Recording, and we are SO excited about what's being put together.  We're working on a 10 song album called "Exceeding Great Joy".  We're about halfway finished and have the end in sight!

But...

We need your help to finish the album.  

We've put out all of our resources and have come to the point where we need you to come alongside us and be a part of this project so that we can complete the album the way we are hoping. In order to finish the full project, we need to raise another $5,000.

This will allow us to complete the recording process, as well as have the full album mixed and mastered.  This will also allow us to put together a full, professionally designed CD package for your festive enjoyment (you may also enjoy the album during non-festive times.  We certainly would never discourage that.)

We are asking you to prayerfully consider being a part of this process by helping us raise the funds to put this whole thing together.  Even if we don't raise all of the money, we will put together and package whatever we can based on what God provides.

We want you to wake up early, too.

When we say things like, "We want you to come alongside us", or, "We want you to be a part of this"...this is totally true, not just some hip-sounding verbage to try and ask for money without you realizing it.  We really do want you to be a part of this.  Like, be a part of the whole thing.

This is not our day job.  We aren't relying on this campaign/this album to help feed our families.  We just love Jesus, we love this music and we want to put together the best album we can.  The band members won't take one red cent (or any other color cents, for that matter) from your donations and any money made from album sales goes right into a fund for a future album.  This means...all we need is to fund the album, and that's given us the freedom to offer some creative "perks" to make you feel like you're a part of this whole experience.

At every level of donation, you'll get some kind of merchandise (none of these "virtual high-fives". Though, we will give those out for free if you really, really want that. (There.  Just did it.) With each donation, you will also receive all the perks that are offered at the other levels before it.

AND because of our partnership with Faith Baptist Church, your donations are TAX-DEDUCTIBLE (check each perk on the right to see how much is deductible)!

Everyone who contributes $8 (they wouldn't let us do $8.30.  We really wanted to.  We thought it was so clever) will get a digital download of the full album as soon as it's available.  We're also offering the full album, a signed drumstick, an 8:30 guitar pick and an 8:30 sticker all at various levels of donation.

We're really excited about the perks offered at the $60 donation level.  At this level, you and your family will be invited to be a part of the first 8:30 Band Christmas Extravaganza (that's a fancy word for "party"/"get-together"), complete with tacky sweaters, Christmas carol singing with The 8:30 Band and so much more.  Also, at this level of donation, you'll get an extremely rare, CHRISTMAS edition of the original fan-design "I Wake Up Early" t-shirt.  These shirts will also be individually numbered to prove to the world that your shirt is remarkably special (and people will say, "8:30 Who?").

BUT what we're REALLY fired up about is the chance for you to LITERALLY be a part of this album. At the $100 level, you will be invited to come sing group vocals on one of the songs on the album, as well as have your name printed in the liner notes (as well as receiving ALL of the other perks offered at the previous levels).

The experiences don't end there.  At $500, you will become a vital part of The 8:30 Band's Christmas show experience.  You'll get the VIP treatment as well as come ON STAGE with us to perform "Little Drummer Boy".  We will teach and rehearse the song with you and you will be a part of 8:30 history. 

At the $1,000, get yourself some business cards printed up because you, my friend, will be a PRODUCER of the album, and will receive credit as such in the liner notes.  We will also come to your house (in the Baltimore-metro area) or whatever space has an outlet, and we will perform an acoustic Christmas/Worship set for you and anyone else you'd like to include!

For $1,830 (see, we'd work that '8:30' in some way!) you will get all of the merchandise and experiences, PLUS an autographed guitar used to record the album, as well as a very special "Thank you" in the liner notes of our album. (And it will be verbose and well-written!)

Finally, if you fund the whole project, you will get everything previously offered...and only one other thing.  You get to cut Jeff's mohawk off onstage at one of the Christmas shows.  Jeff feels confident that his 'hawk is safe, but many are holding out hope that it doesn't make it to New Years.  Primarily, Jeff's wife...HELP HER OUT!

We wake up early...to thank you.

So many of you have supported us over the years, and it is impossible to express how grateful we are for each of you.  We want to put something together that will enhance your Christmas celebration and bring honor to Jesus. We are so appreciative to all of you for helping to make this possible.

Even if you can't help financially - and we TOTALLY understand that - please consider praying for us and help us get the word out!

Thanks again - and Merry Christmas!
story_txt:
We wake up early.
First and foremostly, thanks for stopping by and checking us out.  We are The 8:30 Band*, a 5-piece band from Glen Burnie, MD.  We're either a Rock band that plays Worship music, or a Worship band that plays our music in ways that could be classified as "Rock". We're not sure how to classify it except to say that we love Jesus a ridiculous amount and we tell Him that in energetically loud ways.  Sometimes quieter ways...but mostly loud-ish to loud ways.  We've been together for almost 10 years (October 1st is our Band-iversary, if sincerity and precision is your thing) leading worship at Faith Baptist Church.
(*We lead the 8;30 worship at Faith.  That's how we got such a creative name.  There's nothing more to it than that.  We told you we wake up early.)
After almost 10 years together (again, October 1st...but you understand), we decided it was time to record an album like real bands do.  We kicked around a lot of different ideas, looked at where most of our attention has been regarding writing and arranging worship music - and we discovered where so much of our attention has been spent over the years.
We wake up early...for Christmas.
We love Christmas.  We love music.  We REALLY love Christmas music.
We realized that, as the self-proclaimed "Most Christmasy Band Ever", we've put so much time and creative energy into putting together our own Christmas songs and versions of popular Christmas carols for our "Christmas with The 8:30 Band" Christmas shows, it only makes sense that our first album EVER should be of the festive variety.  Our problem then became, "How do we pick which songs to include?"  With all of the Christmas shows and worship concerts we've done, we had so many tunes to pull from and we love them all.  Do we include one of our 15-minute medleys? Is the world asking for a country/funk/blues/gospel/operatic version of "Jingle Bells"? Should we include "Dominck the Donkey" and pay massive royalties for that ridiculous song
No.  No to all of that.  
Then we asked ourselves, "The 8:30 Band...what are you really about?" The answer gave us our direction.
We wake up early...for the true meaning of Christmas.
We're here to point to Jesus Christ. If this is the only album we ever put together (we hope not...but at this rate...let's be honest) the one thing we want to communicate is the joy we have because of Jesus Christ.  Without realizing it, the songs that we have written and arranged over the years have had the theme of "Joy" running through all of them. 
Joy because of hope made possible.
Joy because of rescue made a reality.
Joy because the Creator of the universe, in love and mercy, stepped down from His throne in Heaven to enter into our mess and provide a way out for us.  There is nothing greater, nothing more deserving of praise, than this. This calls for a really loud-ish to loud celebration.
Dominick the Donkey will just have to wait.
Exceeding Great Joy.
Our album is all about communicating this joy, celebrating Jesus Christ coming into our world and giving everything we have to Him in worship.  In Matthew 2:10, we're told that when the wise men saw the star, they "rejoiced with exceeding great joy".  On this side of the manger - on this side of the cross - that realization is even greater for us.  So, we choose to look at the word "exceeding" not as an adjective, but a verb.  There's joy.  There's GREAT joy.  But because of Jesus, we're going beyond that.  We're EXCEEDING great joy (see what we did there? Our next album will be called, "Play on Words").
So, here we are.  We've been hard at work in the studio with Greg Parker of Amped Recording, and we are SO excited about what's being put together.  We're working on a 10 song album called "Exceeding Great Joy".  We're about halfway finished and have the end in sight!
But...
We need your help to finish the album.  
We've put out all of our resources and have come to the point where we need you to come alongside us and be a part of this project so that we can complete the album the way we are hoping. In order to finish the full project, we need to raise another $5,000.
This will allow us to complete the recording process, as well as have the full album mixed and mastered.  This will also allow us to put together a full, professionally designed CD package for your festive enjoyment (you may also enjoy the album during non-festive times.  We certainly would never discourage that.)
We are asking you to prayerfully consider being a part of this process by helping us raise the funds to put this whole thing together.  Even if we don't raise all of the money, we will put together and package whatever we can based on what God provides.
We want you to wake up early, too.
When we say things like, "We want you to come alongside us", or, "We want you to be a part of this"...this is totally true, not just some hip-sounding verbage to try and ask for money without you realizing it.  We really do want you to be a part of this.  Like, be a part of the whole thing.
This is not our day job.  We aren't relying on this campaign/this album to help feed our families.  We just love Jesus, we love this music and we want to put together the best album we can.  The band members won't take one red cent (or any other color cents, for that matter) from your donations and any money made from album sales goes right into a fund for a future album.  This means...all we need is to fund the album, and that's given us the freedom to offer some creative "perks" to make you feel like you're a part of this whole experience.
At every level of donation, you'll get some kind of merchandise (none of these "virtual high-fives". Though, we will give those out for free if you really, really want that. (There.  Just did it.) With each donation, you will also receive all the perks that are offered at the other levels before it.
AND because of our partnership with Faith Baptist Church, your donations are TAX-DEDUCTIBLE (check each perk on the right to see how much is deductible)!
Everyone who contributes $8 (they wouldn't let us do $8.30.  We really wanted to.  We thought it was so clever) will get a digital download of the full album as soon as it's available.  We're also offering the full album, a signed drumstick, an 8:30 guitar pick and an 8:30 sticker all at various levels of donation.
We're really excited about the perks offered at the $60 donation level.  At this level, you and your family will be invited to be a part of the first 8:30 Band Christmas Extravaganza (that's a fancy word for "party"/"get-together"), complete with tacky sweaters, Christmas carol singing with The 8:30 Band and so much more.  Also, at this level of donation, you'll get an extremely rare, CHRISTMAS edition of the original fan-design "I Wake Up Early" t-shirt.  These shirts will also be individually numbered to prove to the world that your shirt is remarkably special (and people will say, "8:30 Who?").
BUT what we're REALLY fired up about is the chance for you to LITERALLY be a part of this album. At the $100 level, you will be invited to come sing group vocals on one of the songs on the album, as well as have your name printed in the liner notes (as well as receiving ALL of the other perks offered at the previous levels).
The experiences don't end there.  At $500, you will become a vital part of The 8:30 Band's Christmas show experience.  You'll get the VIP treatment as well as come ON STAGE with us to perform "Little Drummer Boy".  We will teach and rehearse the song with you and you will be a part of 8:30 history. 
At the $1,000, get yourself some business cards printed up because you, my friend, will be a PRODUCER of the album, and will receive credit as such in the liner notes.  We will also come to your house (in the Baltimore-metro area) or whatever space has an outlet, and we will perform an acoustic Christmas/Worship set for you and anyone else you'd like to include!
For $1,830 (see, we'd work that '8:30' in some way!) you will get all of the merchandise and experiences, PLUS an autographed guitar used to record the album, as well as a very special "Thank you" in the liner notes of our album. (And it will be verbose and well-written!)
Finally, if you fund the whole project, you will get everything previously offered...and only one other thing.  You get to cut Jeff's mohawk off onstage at one of the Christmas shows.  Jeff feels confident that his 'hawk is safe, but many are holding out hope that it doesn't make it to New Years.  Primarily, Jeff's wife...HELP HER OUT!


We wake up early...to thank you.
So many of you have supported us over the years, and it is impossible to express how grateful we are for each of you.  We want to put something together that will enhance your Christmas celebration and bring honor to Jesus. We are so appreciative to all of you for helping to make this possible.
Even if you can't help financially - and we TOTALLY understand that - please consider praying for us and help us get the word out!
Thanks again - and Merry Christmas!

story: A Progressive Metalcore band from Union City, NJ needs your help funding their brand new EP.  Alive In The Dark plans to head over to SCP studios (Emery, Sent By Ravens, To Speak Of Wolves) located in Danville, Illinois this June.  This project will roughly cost about 3,500 dollars. But we aren't here to ask our fans to completely fund our project. Its unrealistic. So if you guys can help us with 1,000 dollars it will lift such a huge burden off our shoulders.  That being said  anybody who donates $10 will have automatically pre-ordered the EP and will have one sent to them via e-mail.  Please guys this project is something we really want to start working on as soon as possible so we can release it to all of you beautiful people!! So please help us out!!!

story:
Sacred Pregnancy started as a book, then a quarterly magazine, which then led to one retreat last November in Ojai.  But now has become so much more; from there we literally went viral! We now have over 20 retreats this year alone planned and more than 10 new sister programs also growing all around the world. We have new sister + brother programs that include Sacred Postpartum, Sacred Fertility, Sacred medicine Woman, Sacred Whisper Newsletters, Sacred Daddy, Sacred Motherhood, Sacred Doula, Sacred Yoga, Sacred Milk, Sacred Little Girl Summer Camp, Sacred Relationships, and more coming...all of these programs are growing and thriving and starting trainings in all parts of the world.

In our Sacred Pregnancy retreats, women are coming home changed forever, deeply empowered and ready to take on their own lives with new commitment to the greater good and their highest selves. Talk about changing the birth conversation!

Anni Daulter is the author of the Sacred Pregnancy book, the creative director and editor of the Sacred Pregnancy magazine and the creator of the Sacred Pregnancy Class Series + “LOVE labor” Method.  Anni is a conscious family living lifestyle expert, a professional cook, national speaker on natural living and recently launched the Sacred Pregnancy Movement, which provides sisterhood, resources, and cutting edge pregnancy, birthing and parenting information for both new and experienced moms and has created a whole new vision for birth workers.

Nina Lee is a loving mother to three children Isaiah, Sonoma and Sage. Creator of Rainbow Music, a music program for all ages which brings the gift of sacred sound and song circles into the lives of families. Advocate for the Songs for Kids Foundation, bringing music and interactive concerts into children’s hospitals throughout the United States. Co-founder of Escuela Azul, a Spanish immersion and cultural education program for families. Singer/songwriter, performing independently and leading song circles at specialty events, workshops, and retreats. Passionate about helping others uncover and discover their unlimited potential.  Mother, daughter, sister, singer, teacher, woman I am.

Anni asked Nina to create a song for the Sacred Pregnancy book trailer and it was so popular that Nina began singing at Sacred Pregnancy retreats and created enough songs for a cd. The Sacred Pregnancy instructors and supporters wanted to play Nina's songs in their classes and at the retreats, so we needed a way to make it happen and this Indiegogo campaign came to fruition.  Pregnant mamas who took Sacred Pregnancy classes are also asking for the songs to be a part of their birthing soundtrack.  We really appreciate your help in turning this dream into a reality.   

We need to raise $18,000 to fund the Sacred Pregnancy debut cd by Nina Lee. This will cover production, distribution and promotional costs. It will also help bring Nina to Sacred Pregnancy retreats to be able to perform those songs for future instructors.

Some of the great perks for investing in this campaign include: copies of the cds by Nina Lee, signed books by Anni Daulter, Sacred Pregnancy goodies, Sacred Pregnancy swag bags, a spot at a Sacred Pregnancy Instructor retreat, Anni Daulter will act as your private chef at a dinner party, and Nina Lee will perform a house concert.    

If we aren't able to reach our goal in 45 days, the money raised will go towards production costs of the cd.  Every dollar we make helps get this beautiful music out into the world.

If you can’t contribute, we can use your help promoting the Indiegogo campaign. Please share this with friends, family and co-workers by email, social media and through Indiegogo's share tools. We really appreciate your support!

story:
My name is Joshua Washington; I am a recent graduate of the University of the Pacific with a bachelor’s degree in Music Composition. My associate Alex is also a graduate with a bachelor’s in Music Management. We both have had our own established bands that have served Pacific on numerous occasions. My band, Sugar Water Purple, performed at last year’s TEDx event, and Alex’s band, Tipping Point has also played for countless Pacific events such as profile day, preview day, and ASUOP events. I am the assistant director at a family owned nonprofit music school run by my parents called the Zion Academy of Music here in Stockton.

            On Friday, April the 12th at Weber Point, I am, with the support of the Zion Academy of Music, putting on a concert for the city of Stockton called the Reclaim Concert – Something Beautiful for the City. Reclaim will include a band along with an orchestra and guest singers. The band will consist of keyboards, organ, bass, guitars, drums, brass, and a 30 piece orchestra, which will consist of strings, woodwinds, and other brass. All this will be happening at the Reclaim Concert and it will all be free for the public. No admission charge at all.

            The purpose of the concert is to counteract the doubt and hopelessness and show the beauty that is in Stockton. This is our mission statement:

 

“The Reclaim Concert is an artistic effort to serve as a catalyst to the ongoing positive message that there is still hope in Stockton, and to regain ownership of our city. We reject any and all forms of apathy toward Stockton, and we strive to bring out the beauty that already exists within her.”

 

            We seek to use our artistic gifts and talents to partner with the positive movements that already exist in Stockton; great movements like Serve Our Stockton, the Summer Success Leadership Academy, and the Beyond Our Gates Initiative. Reclaim will be a beautiful evening of live original music, poetry, and more; all of it dedicated to the city. The concert itself will be professional both musically and aesthetically with expert sound engineers and lighting, and it will all be free for the public.

            One of our short-term goals is to draw in Stockton natives, and spectators and to make a positive spectacle of downtown. Our long-term goal is to make this concert a regular occurring event that the city becomes known for. We wish to assist the city in making itself more attractive to business owners looking for cities to plant their businesses. Furthermore, through this concert, we seek to change the mindset of those who would otherwise have a very apathetic view of Stockton. We believe and maintain that music is a very powerful inspirational tool that can change hearts and attitudes; and once the mindset is changed, actions will follow. Lastly, we seek to make this something that can be easily replicated so that we may be able to travel to other cities like Stockton with the same purpose and vision, working with the officials, community leaders, and orchestra within those cities.

 

            In order to make Reclaim a success, we need one key and crucial thing, and that is financial Support. Of course, anything of this caliber needs money. We have all of our musicians, singers, and engineers in place, a lot of which have agreed to donate their talents for free. That cuts down a lot of the cost, but nevertheless, there are still a lot of expenses that we need money for such as sound equipment, lighting, the renting of the space, electricity, and the payment of guests singers; one of whom is Joanna Borromeo, a very well known Canadian RnB singer, songwriter, and keyboardist. According to our budget, we need to raise $15,000.

 

            Would you consider partnering with us and donating money to this cause? We have garnered support from amazing people such as President Pamela Eibeck of the University of the Pacific, who has said that she “will match up to $5,000 gifts, including in-kind, from the city, private businesses and donors.” So if there is anything that you can contribute to this lofty endeavor, it would mean a lot for this project and this city.

story:
Alyssa's "Feel Free Tour" 2015

My name is Alyssa Hailey on stage I'm known as 'Alyssa' TG Pop Recording Artist. My debut album 'Alter Ego' was released January 2014.  I am currently promoting this album. I've performed at various Pride events & clubs in the state of FL. I am currently working on a new record. I plan to release it August 2015. I am also wanting to raise money for my "Feel Free Tour" I want to be able to go to different cities and promote my music and give people a taste of who I am as a recording artist. I will be goin on tour with my Artist mate 'Aristo'. We are planning to rock this tour. We need help with tour expencenes such as ... Venue, Sound Equipment, Backup Dancers, Costumes, Travel. Merchandise such as .. CD's, T-shirts, etc ... I've been featured on various publications such as Watermark Magazine, The News Gayper, The Miami Herald etc....  I also hot a few Music videos I plan to release. This tour for me with be the icing on the cake. As a recording artist i dream of going on tour and entertaining my audiance. I hope you would contibute to my cause and make this dream a reality #TeamAlyssa

story:
Dear Everyone, 

It's time to make my next album... so let's do something different, shall we?!

In the past two years my expression of life, music and songwriting has evolved into a much more fluid notion.  It seemed, only natural then to also make this next album in this new way of Being.  

Here some sound bytes to listen to: 

https://soundcloud.com/1skyewilson/02-fill-you-up-mp3

https://soundcloud.com/1skyewilson/08-nothing-could-be-better

https://soundcloud.com/1skyewilson/one-my-love

I have asked 2 special artists,  people I really admire, who inspire me & have great enthusiasm for life (they are The Magnificent), to bring their creative elements to this Liquid Love Journey.  

My path within and to places both near and far, has painted a swirling idea into being and together with The Magnificent we get to create a wonderful product that will encapsulate all the love and passion we all have for our individual art and craft.  I treasure having found like-minded souls in a place where only soul & art exists.

You are a huge part of this creative process as every single contribution you make here will create a more relaxed and inspired space for this Creation to come into being.  Art is nothing if not shared, whatever your opinion - All remains valid.

Amazing poet, Luzaan Ackermann and songwriter, photographer supreme Andy Lund make up The Magnificent team.  "Liquid Love" will have exquisite quality of songs and music, with the most exciting part being - the passionate, creative additions added to the album by these inspirational souls. For this I need your assistance and contributions to make the art count in beautiful colour - be it film, photos, graphics, music, studio performances and poetry.

What the funds raised will be used for & what you can receive for your gracious involvement.

Making an album is a wonderful intricate process and involves devoted time and energy to tell a story in sound!  The funds raised during this campaign will go towards recording/mixing/mastering/producing as well as fees for musicians & the distribution and marketing of the album (which include photos, video & promotion).

We have some awesome perks available to choose from (including advance copies of the new album, attending a recording session and many more!)

The first 50 people that contribute to the campaign will receive a (download) copy of Skye's first album "Transformme" over and above the normal perks.

We all do it together

I am overwhelmed and so appreciative of the incredible support and love I receive at my gigs.  It is an inspiring and phenomenal space to create and experience with you all.

We get to create this album in a similar way, where you contribute in advance and the Magnificent and I do the work and put the package together! Awesome!

Challenges

Having always worked on a tight budget with original recordings, trimming down our  working environment and being more prepared when heading into the studio are things well known to me.  The challenge is to aim high and believe!

I include here for those who wish to make a direct deposit into my bank account the details: S. Wilson / First National Bank (FNB) / Branch code: 250655 / Account no:  62395219259  / FNB Swift code:  FIRNZAJJ

Please include your email address as the reference so we may contact and thank you.

Do you share this vision with me? Some more ways in which you can help!

Your help in sharing the word about my campaign will be invaluable.  Thank you in advance for letting your friends & like-hearted community know about it.

Please use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word by email, Twitter, Facebook and more!  Thank you for your loving support!

In the past two years my expression of life, music and
songwriting has evolved into a much more fluid notion.  It seemed, only
natural then to also make this next album in this new way of Being.  Here some sound bytes to listen to: https://soundcloud.com/1skyewilson/02-fill-you-up-mp3https://soundcloud.com/1skyewilson/08-nothing-could-be-betterhttps://soundcloud.com/1skyewilson/one-my-love
I have asked 2 special artists,  people I really
admire, who inspire me & have great enthusiasm for life (they are The
Magnificent), to bring their creative elements to this Liquid Love Journey.
 
My path within and to places both near and far, has painted
a swirling idea into being and together with The Magnificent we get to
create a wonderful product that will encapsulate all the love and passion we
all have for our individual art and craft.  I treasure having found
like-minded souls in a place where only soul & art exists.
You are a huge part of this creative process as every single
contribution you make here will create a more relaxed and inspired space for
this Creation to come into being.  Art is nothing if not shared, whatever
your opinion - All remains valid.
Amazing poet, Luzaan Ackermann and songwriter, photographer
supreme Andy Lund make up The Magnificent team.  "Liquid Love"
will have exquisite quality of songs and music, with the most exciting part
being - the passionate, creative additions added to the album by these
inspirational souls. For this I need your assistance and contributions to make
the art count in beautiful colour - be it film, photos, graphics, music, studio
performances and poetry.
What the funds raised will be used for & what you can
receive for your gracious involvement.
Making an album is a wonderful intricate process and
involves devoted time and energy to tell a story in sound!  The funds
raised during this campaign will go towards
recording/mixing/mastering/producing as well as fees for musicians & the
distribution and marketing of the album (which include photos, video &
promotion).
We have some awesome perks available to choose from
(including advance copies of the new album, attending a recording session and
many more!)
The first 50 people that contribute to the campaign will
receive a (download) copy of Skye's first album "Transformme" over
and above the normal perks.
We all do it together
I am overwhelmed and so appreciative of the incredible
support and love I receive at my gigs.  It is an inspiring and phenomenal
space to create and experience with you all.
We get to create this album in a similar way, where you
contribute in advance and the Magnificent and I do the work and put the package
together! Awesome!
Challenges
Having always worked on a tight budget with original
recordings, trimming down our  working environment and being more prepared
when heading into the studio are things well known to me.  The challenge
is to aim high and believe!
I include here for those who wish to make a direct deposit
into my bank account the details: S. Wilson / First National Bank (FNB) / Branch code: 250655 / Account no:  62395219259  / FNB Swift code:  FIRNZAJJPlease include your email address as the reference so we may
contact and thank you.
Do you share this vision
with me? Some more ways in which you can help!
Your help in sharing the word about my campaign will be
invaluable.  Thank you in advance for letting your friends &
like-hearted community know about it.
Please use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word by
email, Twitter, Facebook and more!  Thank you for your loving support!

story:
Our Story

Hi, I'm Blake.

The Passing Clouds are basically myself and a loose collective of friends I get the pleasure to jam, gig, & otherwise collaborate with.

here's a link to our facebook: www.facebook.com/omg.passingclouds ..also our myspace: www.myspace.com/omg.passingclouds ..they both have demo recordings of songs that will be on the album.

This will be my first professionally produced recording. There's been a lot of special energy gone into the making of this record.

The vibe was first captured in a log cabin in the woods where most of the initial writing and recording process was done. It was a very pivotal, transformational, & cathartic process that developed my craft as a songwriter. The songs speak of my inspiration, inner reflection, struggles, & hardships through a time of upheaval, transition, transformation, personal & artistic experimentation & development.   

Some of the amazing folks I jammed with in the making of this record include: Tea & Pickles (pictured), Dan-o, Slippers, Radical Suggestions, Katie, Aaron, Greg, Micheal Waters, & Migiz.  

It's produced by Doug "Slippers" Fury @ Fortissimo Sound in Vancouver who has worked with other such artists as Bif Naked, Pride Tiger, Scatterheart & the Smears.

This record was made with myself on guitars, harmonica, drums, & vocals, Tea on bass, & Slippers doing producing.

The Impact

The "Long Road to Mend" EP is a soul, funk, rock, record for anyone searching to find their voice. The songs reflect a intimate journey through a healing path & i feel it could serve others. It may apeal to those who like a message in the melody & for those who want to dance and have fun.


What We Need & What You Get

i can't wait to share this music, but in order to, I need to finish paying for the recording studio time in which it was recorded in. By helping, no matter how small, it would be greatly appreciated & I have a bunch of great stuff to give away! :) 


Other Ways You Can Help

Hey.. Passing Clouds! pass it on.

story:
Minister Toby Carson was born the only girl of six children, to Bishop Hilton and First Lady Amanda Rawls. Her whole life has been spent serving God in His house. As a young adult, she realized the profound love she had for worship and praising God through song. So, in her father’s ministry, (Saint Paul’s U.F.B. Church, Newark, N.J.) she was very active and took on leadership roles in its music department.

Education is another passion of Minister Toby. She currently holds a Bachelor’s degree in English /Education from Georgian Court University, as well as a Master’s degree in Public Communications from Fordham University. She is also the proud owner, with her husband, of the “Kingdom Kids Early Childhood Development Center”, where they educate and nurture our most precious resource (little children).

Today, Minister Toby is an associate minister at the Christian Love Baptist Church in Irvington, N.J, where Reverend Dr. Ronald B. Christian is the Pastor. There, she is the lead Praise and Worship Leader. She believes that worship is more than singing, it is a way of life!

Lastly, she enjoys meditating on the Word of God. Her favorite and most inspiring scripture is Psalm 91. It reminds her that God is her refuge and fortress. Therefore, she will always be found at the feet of Jesus.

 

FUNDING ( Where your funds go )

  • Your funding will be used to help us conquer our goal, to help spread the message that God Loves us! We are one with God's unconditional love. Your funding will assist in our team's traveling, set-up, production and equipment. In addition to all our recording production, the production and distrubition of our CD's, T-shirts and other iWorship collateral material.

  • iWoship will take part in community based initiatives as well as community service voluteers for our entire team to take part and give back, as creator has done for us. 

IMPACT

I know that I was born to worship! At an early age growing up in and around church, I fell on love with the lyrics of worship and praise songs. They always seemed to touch the deepest part of me. These songs inspired me to know the God we sang about.

It took sometime though, for me to realize that this was the purpose He had set for me. God showed me that through my quest to know him that I would show others how to get to know Him! 

So, in essence, God created a thirst in me that is only quenched when I am in his beautiful presence. Worship is more than going to church or singing a worship song. Although they are tools we use to navigate our hearts toward Him? They are just the surface of an awesome experience.

Worship is a deliberate lifestyle devoted to loving God and putting Him first. That is why I use every opportunity to inspire everyone I meet through the gift that God has planted inside of me. It is my responsibility to spread God's beauty and love everywhere I go. So, like King David, "I will sing to The Lord all my life; as long as I live I will sing praises to my God."

Let's salute, honor and celebrate our creator, JESUS CHRIST together through praise and worship! Once attending any venue, gala, event, show, concert or religious event where "Min. Toby Carson" has rendered, You will be enlighten and forever changed!

story:
Hello! Welcome to Katelyn & Brynn's campaign to raise funds for the Made from Scratch Tour 2013! We'll be travelling 2,800 miles in 3 1/2 weeks to play shows in a city near you this August! 

Our Story

Brynn and Katelyn have been studying and performing music for all of their lives. They met nearly 6 years ago as students at Columbia College Chicago and began collaborating. Brynn, a talented songwriter, has recorded three EPs of her original songs which are currently available online: "Parting", "The Words Left Unsaid", & "Made From Scratch". Brynn has played as a featured performer at Schuba's NY Songwriter's Circle, The Bluebird Cafe, & Uncommon Ground. Katelyn is an accomplished cellist and singer-songwriter who has played at the Chicago Blues Festival, the Double Door, and Elbo Room among other legendary Chicago venues. In March she released her new album Weirds and Beards, available for streaming here.

Here's why we need your help:

1. Travel is expensive. Gas. The occasional hotel. New guitar strings. Everything about going on tour costs money. And it is very difficult to make any of it back.

2. We strive to make our music accessible. We want to share our music with others regardless of how much money they have. This is why we have sought out gigs that have no or low cover charges, no drink minimums, and no tickets. We price our CDs at pay-what-you-can levels. We believe that our music is for everyone, and your donation will help us keep it as low cost as possible. 

Costs:

$500 estimated gas costs (plus parking fees and tolls)

$300 vehicle check up & saftey assesment 

$400 accomodations ($50 per night in cities w/o host)

$150 graphic design for posters to send to venues

$480 estimated food costs ($20 per day)

$180 printing full color promotional posters, making CDs, shipping costs to send posters

$130: Katelyn's one-way flight back to Chicago 

 

Tentative Tour Route:

Here is our plan and the gigs we've booked so far. 

August 10. Chicago, IL-- Uncommon Ground-Clark 10:00pm

August 11. Chicago, IL-- TBD

August 12. Grand Rapids, MI-- Jam'Nbean (boardwalk stage) 6:30-9:30pm

August 13. Kalamazoo, MI-- Old Dog Tavern (open stage), 8:00pm

August 14. Ann Arbor, MI-- Brewed Awakenings 6:30-8:30pm 

August 15. Port Huron, MI-- Roche Bar

August 16. Port Huron, MI-- Private House Concert

August 17. Toronto, ON-- The Mad Bean, 2:00-4:00pm

August 18. Ottawa, ON -- Stella Luna, 7:30

August 19. Ottawa, ON-- The Daily Grind, 9:30

August 20. Montreal, QC-- Burritoville, 7:00-11:00pm

August 21. Burlington, VT-- Manhattan Pizza (open stage), 9pm

August 22. Morrisville, VT-- The Bee's Knees, 7:30-10:00pm

August 23. Portland, ME -- Andy's Old Port Pub, 4:30-7:30pm

August 24. Boston, MA -- TBD

August 25. New York, NY-- TBD

August 26. Brooklyn, NY-- Goodbye Blue Monday, 9:00pm

August 27. Baltimore, MD-- TBD

August 28. Baltimore, MD-- TBD

August 29. Baltimore, MD-- TBD

August 30. Cincinnati, OH-- TBD

August 31. Cincinnati, OH-- Sitwells, 9:00-11:00pm

September 1. Nashville, TN-- Belcourt Taps & Tapas, 7:00pm

September 2. Nashville, TN-- World Famous Bluebird Cafe, 6:00pm

story:
Who We Are:

To Help Every Man (T.H.E.M.) is rock band from New Jersey. Our mission is to positively reach out and connect with people and let them know that they are something. They have meaning. They have worth. 

We are currently writing our new record and need help funding this project to record at SCP Studios in Danville, IL. Why Danville? SCP Studios is a professional studio who has worked with many amazing musicians, and in short, they are awesome. We were able to record our self titled EP there with Devin Shelton (EMERY) and as stated above, we love the guys at SCP.

What We Need:

To make this record come to life, we need to cover the costs of the entire project. $2500 is the total cost for our recording time. Anything we raise after that will go towards travel expenses as well as awesome things to give back to you, our supporters! 

The Impact:

With this record, we will continue our mission in sharing a positive message with anyone and everyone we meet. By funding this project, you are sharing our message and being a light to someone who is in the dark. We want to use these new songs to bring purpose and meaning to those who have none. This record will expand our reach to new ears and maintain old ones. We cannot thank you all enough for the support in our journey so far. Lets make 2013 a huge year for To Help Every Man!

Other Ways You Can Help:

You can support us by liking our Facebook page, and sharing it with your friends.

You can purchase our self titled EP on iTunes and Amazon and can stream it on Spotify.
