story:
Thanks for being here, folks!

Sarah Burton is recording her 2nd full-length album, Fire Breathers!

A little background....

Have you looked in the mirror lately? Well, you look really great. Anyway, so have you heard about crowdfunding? To sum it up quickly, Crowdfunding is a fairly new grassroots platform to raise money for projects - businesses, art projects, inventions, charities - you name it. It's a pretty exciting new business model, because it puts the power in the peoples' hands -- before something even exists, you have the power to be part of it right from the ground up.

Now to me -- some of you have known me since I started playing music. You were there when I played my first show ever at the Freetimes cafe, when I played teen angst anthems, "Dirty Man" and "Skinny's Out" and maybe you put $5 in the jug. Hard to believe that was almost 8 years ago now...and you haven't aged a day! What's your secret? Or maybe you were at my show in Red Deer in 2006 (on my first tour), when I awkwardly signed my first autograph on my DIY release, "Up to Here." Or maybe you just stumbled upon this page or a friend sent you here -- in that case, it's very nice to meet you, and thanks for taking the time to get to know me.

Hey, thanks guys...

To those of you who have been there with me from the ground up, and those of you I've come across along the way, THANK YOU. Everytime you put money in the jug, the hat, the guitar case, everytime you bought a CD, T-shirt, Touque, Everytime you paid cover, requested a song on the radio, or watched a youtube video, you have helped me, and I really have come a long way.

As you're probably aware, there is no longer a "make it or break it" world for musicians, outside of the X-Factor, Idols, and TV talent shows. What there is are good people like yourselves; supporting in projects and people that you believe in. I come from a community of hard-working musicians who want to create great music and bring it to as many people as possible, in hopes that they find some joy in listening to it.

So, in essence, you, my good looking smart and lovely friends, are the new record label.

For the last few years I have been travelling across Canada and parts of the U.S. doing what I love to do - play music. For the last 4 tours however, I was still toting Mayflower as my latest album. Many of you have been asking when the new album is going to happen -- the time is now!

The new album...

Fire Breathers consists of 13 songs spun together by a spaghetti-western love story that follows three imperfect characters -- the outlaw, the lady, and the man who was too good -- through the torments and the pleasures of the heart.

Featuring Luke Stackhouse on bass, Jay Swinnerton on guitar and Pat Phillips on drums, Fire Breathers picks up where Mayflower left off -- picking up the pace and the decibal level to make a roots-rock record that I know you will be proud of.

Your help making this record will mean I'm out on the road again sooner, with more songs to bring to you. It means that I can move forward with my career at a steady and healthy pace, taking it one step at a time, to the next level. Maybe even level 11 (any Spinal Tap fans out there?)

I'm more than ready to release a new album -- I have the momentum, the drive, the team and the community -- all I need is a new record to keep me on track.

What We Need & What You Get

Thanks to some savings and some personal donations already received, recording is already underway, and it sounds amazing! I'm so excited to get this project off the ground!

If we can raise $6000 this means we can record everything we want to hear, at top quality, with great equipment and great people. The money goes to studio time, engineering, mixing, mastering and manufacturing. 

Some recording is being done at River 16 Studio in Oakville - they have a big beautiful live room, as well as some wonderful equipment, and talented engineers.

The rest of the recording is being done at Reguladora Studio in Toronto. This is the studio of Steve DaSilva -- a very talented young engineer with a passion for making fantastic sounds. Reguladora's mission is to replicate the gear and sounds found at Abbey Road studios in London. We certainly aren't the only ones to see that Steve DaSilva is a rising talent in the music engineering world -- upon completion of Fire Breathers, Steve will be heading to France to study the art of mixing with Eddie Kramer (who has worked with the likes of the Beatles, the Rolling Stones, Curtis Mayfield, the Red Hot Chilli Peppers and many more).

If we don't reach this goal, there will still be a record. We'll see where we can get with the help of our friends and do the best we can with what we've got. It just might take a little longer.

If we surpass our goal, then bells will ring and rainbows will appear, and we will be able to reach further into the vision of this record and push ourselves to new heights -- think horn sections and chamber chorus!

There are perks for getting involved from the ground up! Check out the different prizes and incentives (on the column to your right) you could get by helping us out. From merchandise to artwork, baked goods and quality time, we have just the prize for you!

The Impact

Every little bit helps -- and what you're doing is helping to keep the indie music scene alive! I'm really excited about this album, and even more excited to think how many people will have been involved with it before it even goes to print.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to help but just can't swing the bucks, I understand. If you can help me get the word out by passing this around to your social networks, your efforts are a huge value to me and I appreciate it!

I come from a community of hard-working musicians who want to create great music and bring it to as many people as possible, in hopes that they find some joy in listening to it.
So, in essence, you, my good looking smart and lovely friends, are the new record label.
For the last few years I have been travelling across Canada and parts of the U.S. doing what I love to do - play music. For the last 4 tours however, I was still toting Mayflower as my latest album. Many of you have been asking when the new album is going to happen -- the time is now!
The new album...
Fire Breathers consists of 13 songs spun together by a spaghetti-western love story that follows three imperfect characters -- the outlaw, the lady, and the man who was too good -- through the torments and the pleasures of the heart.
Featuring Luke Stackhouse on bass, Jay Swinnerton on guitar and Pat Phillips on drums, Fire Breathers picks up where Mayflower left off -- picking up the pace and the decibal level to make a roots-rock record that I know you will be proud of.
Your help making this record will mean I'm out on the road again sooner, with more songs to bring to you. It means that I can move forward with my career at a steady and healthy pace, taking it one step at a time, to the next level. Maybe even level 11 (any Spinal Tap fans out there?)
I'm more than ready to release a new album -- I have the momentum, the drive, the team and the community -- all I need is a new record to keep me on track.


What We Need & What You Get
Thanks to some savings and some personal donations already received, recording is already underway, and it sounds amazing! I'm so excited to get this project off the ground!
If we can raise $6000 this means we can record everything we want to hear, at top quality, with great equipment and great people. The money goes to studio time, engineering, mixing, mastering and manufacturing. 
Some recording is being done at River 16 Studio in Oakville - they have a big beautiful live room, as well as some wonderful equipment, and talented engineers.
The rest of the recording is being done at Reguladora Studio in Toronto. This is the studio of Steve DaSilva -- a very talented young engineer with a passion for making fantastic sounds. Reguladora's mission is to replicate the gear and sounds found at Abbey Road studios in London. We certainly aren't the only ones to see that Steve DaSilva is a rising talent in the music engineering world -- upon completion of Fire Breathers, Steve will be heading to France to study the art of mixing with Eddie Kramer (who has worked with the likes of the Beatles, the Rolling Stones, Curtis Mayfield, the Red Hot Chilli Peppers and many more).
If we don't reach this goal, there will still be a record. We'll see where we can get with the help of our friends and do the best we can with what we've got. It just might take a little longer.
If we surpass our goal, then bells will ring and rainbows will appear, and we will be able to reach further into the vision of this record and push ourselves to new heights -- think horn sections and chamber chorus!
There are perks for getting involved from the ground up! Check out the different prizes and incentives (on the column to your right) you could get by helping us out. From merchandise to artwork, baked goods and quality time, we have just the prize for you!


The Impact
Every little bit helps -- and what you're doing is helping to keep the indie music scene alive! I'm really excited about this album, and even more excited to think how many people will have been involved with it before it even goes to print.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you want to help but just can't swing the bucks, I understand. If you can help me get the word out by passing this around to your social networks, your efforts are a huge value to me and I appreciate it!

story:
Well, here we go....

I ran an indiegogo campaign last year for my most recent album which was recorded in a hunting lodge, I was amazed and surprised about strangers and friends generosity. With that last campaign we ( a huge team of us) managed to pull off an impossible task and got the album out to radio within six weeks of finishing at the lodge. That album has spun the globe and has hit numerous charts in the roots and blues area and has even received some Country music plays. It has hit big on the Bluesville Siriusxm Radio Network remaining in the top ten for weeks, Hit #1 a few times on the Roots Music Report, #2 across Canada on Roots Charts and many more listings, rankings, reviews etc.

We have set up a campaign as we are excited to be working on another CD this coming summer. Past recordings have earned numerous awards.......

Accolades include:

· IMA Best Blues Song of the Year Voters Choice

· Blues411 Best International Blues Release

· Blues Female Vocalist of the Year at SevernFM (uk)

· Runner up for Best Acoustic Blues Album of the Year (GR)

· Nominee for Solo Album of the Year in Northern Ontario

reviews and more are on my website www.sundaywilde.com

This time around, instead of recording in a remote hunting lodge where we recorded live with limited overdubs, we are now heading to North Dakota to record 10 brand new songs and some favorite cover songs in a fully equipped state of the art studio.

We will be working with Untouchable Productions and Studios, in their brand new recording facilities. Though we intend to stay with the live performance during the recording process, the studio setting will allow more options with more complex overdubs allowing us to import horns, strings, backup vocals and percussion.

Untouchable Productions have a reputation in the blues scene in the US and have worked with Blues Music Awards nominee Nora Jean, Native American Music Award winning band BlueDog, and many others. Little Bobby, guitarist, engineer and producer, who operates Untouchable Productions will be working on the project with us.

We have set up a variety of perks so our supporters/fans can donate and help invest in the new project. When you contribute towards the project, you can help us out by pre-purchasing the new release amoungst many other perks listed at the side. The money we raise towards this new recording will be used for a variety of expenses associated with including: travel, musician fees, mastering, mixing, photography, pressing and promotion.

The estimated costs for a recording and the promotion of an album can run into thousands....

· $2,000 Travel

· $3,000 Musican fees

· $5,000 Engineer, Producer, Mixing Fees, mastering

· $2,000 Artwork, photography, pressing costs, online fees for digital distribution

· $5,000 - $8,000 for promotion and advertising

· TOTAL expenses will range between $16,000 - $20,000

But we are hoping to raise less than half of our expenses with this indiegogo campaign. 7,000

Here are a few quotes from reviews from my last album....

"We get to take a peek ‘down the alley’ and into the world of obsession and the total commitment that it takes to live and appreciate it. Shadows of Billie Holiday and the many other Blues Ladies stir to greet Ms. Wilde as she sings of having not eaten, or taken care of herself since she found this love. She is on a ‘Love Bender’. The similarity to serious drug addiction is not lost on Ms. Wilde as she rides the waves of ecstatic emotions – yet wonders why it fades so fast, and at what final cost. ‘Love Bender’ is, simply put, an amazing song." BLUES411 - 5 STAR RATED

There was a time by sunday-wilde (Soundcloud link to listen to "There was a time" one of the songs in the top five on Bluesville

"He Gave Me A BlueNightgown is worthy of attention. Indeed, it is worthy of the chart position it has attained thusfar. Don’t be surprised if Sunday Wildebreaks out bigger than she has thus far with her latest work. He GaveMe A Blue Nightgown shouldn’t surprise anyone with a Juno, or perhaps evena GRAMMY nomination. Sunday Wilde is the Queen of the Blues." W. Haskell - 4.5 STAR RATED http://wildysworld.blogspot.ca/2013/04/sunday-wilde-he-gave-me-blue-nightgown.html

Join us in helping this new release get out to the world. Planned for summer and released in the fall of 2013 with a tour planned in 2014. Got questions? Ideas? Suggestions? Comments? Find us on facebook or email us

https://soundcloud.com/sunday-wilde/there-was-a...

story:
The Divan Consort Requests Your Collaboration!!!


The Divan Consort is recording their first CD this August!  We’re incredibly excited to share this news with you.  Come, join the fun and be a partner in the creation of our debut CD.  We’re looking for a few good executive producers.  Could that be you?

 

The Divan Consort is a Los Angeles based chamber ensemble, which has been performing innovative works as well as the landmarks of the 20th century ever since our founding by the Turkish pianist Füreya Ünal in 2009.  Our musical directors are Ms. Ünal and the exciting Portuguese clarinetist Virginia Figueiredo. 

 

The debut CD will highlight music representing the diversity of our ensemble’s members.  This recording will feature five pieces, including music by Portuguese composer Nuno Malo, Turkish composer Özkan Manav, American composer Ken Walicki, world famous Chinese composer Chen Yi, and the renowned Armenian composer Aram Khachaturian. The recordings of Mr. Malo’s, Mr. Manav, and Dr. Walicki’s pieces will be World Premiere recordings. Mr. Malo’s, and Dr. Walicki’s pieces were commissioned by and composed specifically for the Divan Consort.  We are proud to be recording such world-class quality music for our debut CD.

 

Contemporary music does not have to be scary!!!  We want to share the music of our time with our listeners.  We play music that is innovative, groundbreaking, with an edge, and is, of course, highly artistic.  Something that is important to us, and we believe to our audience, is that music be a joy to experience and should be neither scary nor daunting. 

 

Besides Ms. Ünal and Ms. Figueiredo, the recording will feature Pamela Vliek-Martchev on flute, Mira Khomik Anderson on violin, and the cellist Felix Fan.  Our producer is the multi-Grammy Award winning Matt Snyder. We would like to ask the adventurous music enjoyer to help us bring this exciting project to life.

 

Please donate to our project so that this recording can become a reality.  Become a part of music history and be one of our executive producers!

 

In order to create this production and raise sufficient funds for our debut CD we need to raise $6500. This fund will cover the costs for:

- Recording engineer - Photos - Musicians

- CD production - Publicity

 

In exchange for your heartfelt collaboration, we are offering a number of exclusive & awesome perks, which include everything from autographed CD's, to free downloads, and dedications in your name, or private concerts.

story:
dear friends,

THANK YOU!!!

 

I'm incredibly honored and totally blown away by your generosity. We've surpassed my goal in just three incredible days, and I'm ecstatic to get to call this instrument my own. I am so grateful to all of you and excited to share lots of new music with you!!

 

At this point I've already gotten enough contributions to buy my violin, so I'll be using the surplus to outfit it with all the gear that will help me sound my best with my new Adam Ezra Group bandmates. These additional components are so important to have on the road, and until now I thought I wouldn't be able to afford them for a long time to come!

 

You are AMAZING!!!

 

I have all that I need now- thank you!!! 

 

For those of you who still want to contribute, I want to let you know that once I've purchased the gear that I need, I'll be paying forward your incredible generosity by donating the extra to a few organizations dedicated to providing music education to the "voiceless." 

I promise to post info on the specifics as soon as I get off the road, but for tonight, it's late and I'll sign off-- with the utmost gratitude, joy, and thanks to each of you.

 

Love,

Corinna

 

-----------

Hi! Corinna here. I'm a fiddler/violinist and a music teacher, and I'm incredibly lucky to get to do what I love for a living (well, almost a living anyway!) I've been playing violin for 20 years, and I hope to play for another 80!!

Last month while on tour with the Adam Ezra Group (www.adamezra.com) in Bloomington, Indiana, my beloved fiddle was stolen from backstage during a concert. That instrument had been with me since I was 14, through adventures and auditions, weddings and funerals, parties, performances, and practice sessions, and had been my voice ever since I knew I even had a voice. It was the only material possession I had really cared about, and suddenly it was gone. I was heartbroken.

 

I filed a police report, called over 100 pawn shops and instrument dealers, kept a vigilant eye on eBay and craigslist, and blasted facebook with the information (which my friends shared more than 500 times!), and spent an embarrassing amount of time crying and worrying about the safety and well-being of my four-stringed friend. Fortunately, I had the help of some really generous folks, who spread the word, helped make calls, and even loaned me a violin to perform with while I searched. But unfortunately my own instrument has not been recovered.

 

So, I began the quest for a new violin which would give me back my voice and my career...

 

I’m thrilled to tell you now that I’ve found something I really love! This instrument, a 1933 John Aschower violin made in California, was tucked into a corner of my local violin shop and as soon as I started playing it, I felt like it had potential. The good people at Shar were kind enough to loan it to me, and every day that I’ve been playing it, I’ve loved it even more.

 

It feels GREAT to get my voice back!

 

Thanks to my parents’ good judgment getting my violin insured years ago, as well as the generosity of the good folks at Shar who are giving me a great deal, I’m not starting from scratch trying to fundraise for this instrument. But I do still have a ways to go—a little over 4 thousand dollars—which from the perspective of a traveling musician, is a LOT of money.

 

So, I'm launching this campaign to try to raise the rest- no more, no less. I hope there'll be some rewards you enjoy, and that together, we can turn my small tragedy into a happy occasion for everyone! I’m so thankful for the kindness and generosity I’ve been shown, and I want to show you how much I appreciate it. Please check out the rewards in the column—and if you think of something you’d like which isn’t listed, let me know!

 

Thanks for reading, thanks for supporting me, thanks for being a part of my life and this craziness called being a musician! I couldn’t do it without you.

 

TRULY- thank you.

 

-Corinna

story:
The Howard Roberts Project

              "THE ORIGINALS"

                             A Tribute to a Legend

          Preserving the Howard Roberts Legacy,

    One of the most Influential Musicians and Educators

 

                              of the 20th Century                        

  

 Check out the latest Updates

What's The Howard Roberts Project all about?

This is a flexible funding campaign, which means that 100% of the contributions go towards the project, and the Tribute will happen regardless of budget. Full Funding will ensure a high production quality.

Jay Roberts presents this remarkably anticipated Recording and Video project that captures the spirit of The BIG NOW, a tribute to his father, the late Howard Roberts (HR), A true Jazz Guitar legend of the 20th century, HR was also a revolutionary educator who literally changed the lives of thousands of players.

This immense labor of love will capture his remarkable wit, images, words of wisdom and the astonishing tales that so many are eager to share

The Project will feature the historically great session artists HR worked with in the television, motion picture and recording studios of Hollywood, as well as many other colleagues from his brilliant career.

This CD/DVD venture will include a full studio CD as well as a DVD documenting the “making of” The Howard Roberts Project. A live concert featuring artists from this project will also be captured on DVD, along with a historical narrative and video interviews with some of the musicians influenced by HR. Recording all ORIGINAL HR MUSIC, the Grooves will span  from straight ahead Jazz to Funk, and Latin to Soul will give these tremendous players eclectic room to stretch out, all while sharing their feelings and memories about, and missing, HR for more than 20 years.

This Project features "THE ORIGINAL ARTISTS" and " ORIGINAL HR TUNES"

 

Who is Howard Roberts?

(1929-1992)

“One of the most heard guitar players in the world.” Throughout the 1950s, ’60s and ’70s, HR was one of the busiest guitarists in Los Angeles, appearing on hundreds of album, movie and TV dates, and his own LPs established him as one of the premier jazz guitar stylists of his generation. He applied a lifelong passion for learning theory to writing books and columns as well as conducting legendary seminars. His efforts raised the standards for guitar education and culminated in the establishment of Guitar Institute of Technology, the world’s first full-time contemporary guitar program. (now Musicians Institute)

HR’s accomplishments are far too vast to detail in this forum, but a recent article in Vintage Guitar Magazine, by Jim Carlton, gives a good historical perspective:

http://www.vintageguitar.com/9525/howard-roberts-2/

There is also a truly monumental Howard Roberts website, managed by Mike Evans:

http://www.utstat.utoronto.ca/mikevans/hroberts.html

 

This Wikipedia page also has good detailed info

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Howard_Roberts

 

Who is Jay Roberts?

As the son of two professional Jazz Musicians, Jay was inspired to listen to, learn and play music at an early age. He began teaching guitar and drums at age 14, and went on to open ROBERTS MUSIC INSTITUTE in 2004.(the leading guitar school in the Northwest)

Howard and Jay were very close and collaborated on numerous educational projects and publications. They worked together daily until HR’s tragic passing in 1992. As he did for so many, HR instilled in Jay his set of ‘lifemanship’ qualities that have proven indelible: Kindness, Honesty & Chops

Today, following in his Fathers footsteps as a uniquely talented Improviser, Jay is excited  to honor what Howard frequently referred to as The BIG NOW… Collaborating with HR’s friends and colleagues creates an inspiring and significant opportunity, and one in which YOU play a pivotal role-

 

HR Project - The Players

The list of musicians eager to pay tribute grows daily- currently we are contacting those who played with HR during his career… This is the list of players that Recorded on the Project.


Bob Bain – Guitar w/Doc Severinsen

Ralph Humphrey - Drums 

Dave Grusin - Piano

Chuck Berghofer - Bass

Mitch Holder - Guitar

Howard Alden - Guitar

Don Mock – Guitar – Co founder of MI 

Dan Dean – Bass w/Dave Grusin

Russell Ferrante - Piano  

Michael Anthony – Guitar

Tim May – Guitar

Ernie Watts - Sax

Tom Scott - Sax

Alex Acuna - Percussion

Tom Collier - Vibes

Allen Vizzutti - Tumpet and Flugal Horn

Mark Arrington - Drums

 

What has been accomplished so far?

Jay has finished the album, and is now doing the graphics and cd layout. The video interviews have been shot, as well as the in studio footage for the "Making of" story. There is over 25hrs of footage that now needs to be edited and compiled.

What’s the budget to complete the Howard Roberts Project DVD and CD?  $4o,ooo.

We have received $18,625., in private funding to date, (not through indiegogo) along with dozens of emails eagerly offering support.The Indiegogo campaign raised $12086, so our current total is $30711.

The $9289 balance we are currently seeking will:

  • cover the completion of the studio CD
  • Further develop the production of the DVD ( “making of" the HR Project, interviews, historical HR narratives and live concert footage).
  • pay for compensation and travel for musicians, studio time, mixing and mastering, video shooting, editing, artwork, layout, mechanical royalties, and duplication costs.

Extra funding?

Important Crowdfunding projects sometimes acquire more funding than requested. Please note that this is only a beginning. Give early. Give often. Not only is the budget for this recording project somewhat modest, but there is much more to be done. There are dozens of unmarked reel to reel tapes to be transferred, stacks of handwritten charts, notes and drawings to be catalogued, and so much more. Images of these amazing archives will be brought to you weekly on this very site. Our intent is to make true Howard Roberts fans very, very happy…

What is the timeline?

 

 

HR Project 2013-14

 

Jan 24th Tribute Concert at Namm

 

Jan 25th-30th Interviews for Documentary

 

April 28, Benefit Concert at Bakes place in Bellevue

 

May 6th and 7th,  Studio X Recording at  in Seattle.

 

May 29th-30th, Interviews for Documentary

 

May 31st-June1st, Capitol Records Recording Session, in LA


Bring in other player to contribute throughout the year


Jan 2014 Namm All Star Guitar concert, Bluesette performance


Feb- Finish mixing and mastering Album


March-  capture final footage


April-July - Finish Video Editing


August- Build HR Project Website


SEPTEMBER 2014 RELEASE

 


 

 

 

If you have any questions regarding this project, please don’t hesitate to contact Jay@robertsmusicinstitute.com 

And Finally,

PLEASE HELP SPREAD THE WORD!

FORWARD THIS LINK Howard Roberts Project TO FRIENDS AND FAMILY on Facebook and Email. Good old-fashioned word of mouth also does wonders! Help educate the next generation on a true legend

Thank you very much for your support!

 

Good Pickins,

Jay Roberts

 

 

 

                                      


                                               

It’s been 20 yrs since HR’s passing,

 So much history, So much influence, So much Love

Here’s to The BIG NOW

 It's time!

His Story Deserves To Be Told

.
story_txt:
The Howard Roberts Project

              "THE ORIGINALS"

                             A Tribute to a Legend
          Preserving the Howard Roberts Legacy,
    One of the most Influential Musicians and Educators
 
                              of the 20th Century                        
  
 Check out the latest Updates
What's The Howard Roberts Project all about?
This is a flexible funding campaign, which means that 100% of the contributions go towards the project, and the Tribute will happen regardless of budget. Full Funding will ensure a high production quality.
Jay Roberts presents this remarkably anticipated Recording and Video project that captures the spirit of The BIG NOW, a tribute to his father, the late Howard Roberts (HR), A true Jazz Guitar legend of the 20th century, HR was also a revolutionary educator who literally changed the lives of thousands of players.
This immense labor of love will capture his remarkable wit, images, words of wisdom and the astonishing tales that so many are eager to share
The Project will feature the historically great session artists HR worked with in the television, motion picture and recording studios of Hollywood, as well as many other colleagues from his brilliant career.
This CD/DVD venture will include a full studio CD as well as a DVD documenting the “making of” The Howard Roberts Project. A live concert featuring artists from this project will also be captured on DVD, along with a historical narrative and video interviews with some of the musicians influenced by HR. Recording all ORIGINAL HR MUSIC, the Grooves will span  from straight ahead Jazz to Funk, and Latin to Soul will give these tremendous players eclectic room to stretch out, all while sharing their feelings and memories about, and missing, HR for more than 20 years.
This Project features "THE ORIGINAL ARTISTS" and " ORIGINAL HR TUNES"
 
Who is Howard Roberts?
(1929-1992)
“One of the most heard guitar players in the world.” Throughout the 1950s, ’60s and ’70s, HR was one of the busiest guitarists in Los Angeles, appearing on hundreds of album, movie and TV dates, and his own LPs established him as one of the premier jazz guitar stylists of his generation. He applied a lifelong passion for learning theory to writing books and columns as well as conducting legendary seminars. His efforts raised the standards for guitar education and culminated in the establishment of Guitar Institute of Technology, the world’s first full-time contemporary guitar program. (now Musicians Institute)
HR’s accomplishments are far too vast to detail in this forum, but a recent article in Vintage Guitar Magazine, by Jim Carlton, gives a good historical perspective:
http://www.vintageguitar.com/9525/howard-roberts-2/
There is also a truly monumental Howard Roberts website, managed by Mike Evans:
http://www.utstat.utoronto.ca/mikevans/hroberts.html
 
This Wikipedia page also has good detailed info
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Howard_Roberts
 
Who is Jay Roberts?
As the son of two professional Jazz Musicians, Jay was inspired to listen to, learn and play music at an early age. He began teaching guitar and drums at age 14, and went on to open ROBERTS MUSIC INSTITUTE in 2004.(the leading guitar school in the Northwest)
Howard and Jay were very close and collaborated on numerous educational projects and publications. They worked together daily until HR’s tragic passing in 1992. As he did for so many, HR instilled in Jay his set of ‘lifemanship’ qualities that have proven indelible: Kindness, Honesty & Chops
Today, following in his Fathers footsteps as a uniquely talented Improviser, Jay is excited  to honor what Howard frequently referred to as The BIG NOW… Collaborating with HR’s friends and colleagues creates an inspiring and significant opportunity, and one in which YOU play a pivotal role-
 
HR Project - The Players
The list of musicians eager to pay tribute grows daily- currently we are contacting those who played with HR during his career… This is the list of players that Recorded on the Project.

Bob Bain – Guitar w/Doc Severinsen
Ralph Humphrey - Drums 
Dave Grusin - Piano
Chuck Berghofer - Bass
Mitch Holder - Guitar
Howard Alden - Guitar
Don Mock – Guitar – Co founder of MI 
Dan Dean – Bass w/Dave Grusin
Russell Ferrante - Piano  
Michael Anthony – Guitar
Tim May – GuitarErnie Watts - SaxTom Scott - Sax
Alex Acuna - PercussionTom Collier - VibesAllen Vizzutti - Tumpet and Flugal Horn
Mark Arrington - Drums
 
What has been accomplished so far?
Jay has finished the album, and is now doing the graphics and cd layout. The video interviews have been shot, as well as the in studio footage for the "Making of" story. There is over 25hrs of footage that now needs to be edited and compiled.
What’s the budget to complete the Howard Roberts Project DVD and CD?  $4o,ooo.
We have received $18,625., in private funding to date, (not through indiegogo) along with dozens of emails eagerly offering support.The Indiegogo campaign raised $12086, so our current total is $30711.
The $9289 balance we are currently seeking will:

cover the completion of the studio CD
Further develop the production of the DVD ( “making of" the HR Project, interviews, historical HR narratives and live concert footage).
pay for compensation and travel for musicians, studio time, mixing and mastering, video shooting, editing, artwork, layout, mechanical royalties, and duplication costs.
Extra funding?
Important Crowdfunding projects sometimes acquire more funding than requested. Please note that this is only a beginning. Give early. Give often. Not only is the budget for this recording project somewhat modest, but there is much more to be done. There are dozens of unmarked reel to reel tapes to be transferred, stacks of handwritten charts, notes and drawings to be catalogued, and so much more. Images of these amazing archives will be brought to you weekly on this very site. Our intent is to make true Howard Roberts fans very, very happy…
What is the timeline?
 
 
HR Project 2013-14
 
Jan 24th Tribute Concert at Namm
 
Jan 25th-30th Interviews for Documentary
 
April 28, Benefit Concert at Bakes place in Bellevue
 
May 6th and 7th,  Studio X Recording at  in Seattle.
 
May 29th-30th, Interviews for Documentary
 
May 31st-June1st, Capitol Records Recording Session, in LABring in other player to contribute throughout the yearJan 2014 Namm All Star Guitar concert, Bluesette performanceFeb- Finish mixing and mastering AlbumMarch-  capture final footageApril-July - Finish Video EditingAugust- Build HR Project WebsiteSEPTEMBER 2014 RELEASE
 

 
 
 
If you have any questions regarding this project, please don’t hesitate to contact Jay@robertsmusicinstitute.com 
And Finally,
PLEASE HELP SPREAD THE WORD!
FORWARD THIS LINK Howard Roberts Project TO FRIENDS AND FAMILY on Facebook and Email. Good old-fashioned word of mouth also does wonders! Help educate the next generation on a true legend
Thank you very much for your support!
 
Good Pickins,
Jay Roberts
 
 
 
                                      
                                               
It’s been 20 yrs since HR’s passing,
 So much history, So much influence, So much Love
Here’s to The BIG NOW
 It's time!
His Story Deserves To Be Told
.

story:
For those of you that don't know me, I'm Victoria.  For those of you that do, hey! I'm so pumped to kick off 2013 doing a project that's been a dream of mine since I can remember dreaming.  I've played and written music for many years and now have the opportunity to work with some of the best musicians, producers and engineers to record a 3 part project.  Everything is lined up and ready to go...everything that is except for the money!  That's why I'm here on Indiegogo...and that's why you're here too!  I need your help to make this dream a reality.  I know $32k seems like a lot of money...that's because it is. :)  When it comes to recording though, it's not.  We've gone over the budget with a magnifying glass and cut it back to this...this being a world-class recording. 

We've decided to run this campaign for 40 days for obvious reasons...I'm from Seattle...it rained for 40 days and forty nights when Noah, his fam and a bunch of livestock boarded the Ark.  Need I say more?  I didn't think so. 

I sincerely appreciate you taking the time to watch and read about this project and hope to partner with you on it!  Once all the money is raised, we will begin recording immediately...I can't wait to let you hear it!

Stay tuned to updates here and by following me on Twitter @vichuffman.

story:
Who. What. Why?

Hey, my name is Tenasie, and I just finished recording my latest song and I want to do something really special with this one because it is about something near and dear to my heart … bullying. 

I am going to create a music video and send it out around the world to continue to bring awareness to bullying.  And I need your help to make this happen.    

The song is called Made to Be Me – and it has a  POSITIVE & POWERFUL message … Believe in yourself, follow your dreams, and be a leader.   

 What We Need & What You Get

I’ve been in the studio and I have recorded the song  --  it is awesome by the way!  --   and now we need to make the video.  We have an amazing team of talented people who are donating their time, however, I still have some costs, and that is why I need your help.

Studio time to record / produce the song = $1,200  ( I paid this out of my pocket … well, actually my parents did).  This will not be reimbursed through this project, I just wanted you to know what it cost to get started.

Professional video crew (2–day shoot) = $2,700

Editing & Production = $1,600

Promotion & Distribution = $700 

(* if we exceed our goal , any extra funds will be used for further promotion of the video)

What is in it for You?

In addition to my eternal thanks, I want to offer some really cool perks to anyone who joins me.  Besides the “stuff” I think you’d like to have, I want to offer a real solution to bullying, so I’m working with some fantastic people who teach bullying prevention to kids all across the country.  They have a great bullying prevention program called Agent G, and this DVD should be seen by every child and every parent.   You can get one by supporting this project.  

You can also get a “Made to Be Me” t-shirt  (I have different colors and designs) … you can choose the perfect one and let everyone know that you BELIEVE IN YOURSELF! 

I just recorded my first CD with 14 original songs – You can get one of those and let me know if you enjoy my music.

Are you a songwriter?  Want a song written for you?  You can get a songwriting session with me.  How about a powerful Bullying Prevention seminar for your group with expert instructors; and/or a private concert by me??  Check it all out in the perks.

The Impact

We all know about bullying, and the devastating effect it can have on people – especially kids.  The song and video don’t just talk about the problem of bullying, but rather the SOLUTION!   I want people to know how to deal with bullying, and even more importantly … how to prevent it.

I’m so excited because a handful of organizations, and a HUGE bullying awareness website have agreed to feature the video once it is done, so I know that the video will be seen by a kazillion people and make a real impact.

I really appreciate you watching this and I’m so grateful for any help you can give me.  If this video touches the life of just one person … its all worth it.  So tell all your friends and join the MADE TO BE ME movement!

Other Ways You Can Help

I know some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help.  Ask all your people to get the word out and make some noise about Made to Be Me, and remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!  Bless you!

story:
"I've been through many times in which I thought I might lose it. The only thing that's saved me has always been music." - Beastie Boys

The short version for busy people:

Be Luv Music is a non-profit online radio station launched by Amy Anne, Shawn Sanford, and Becca Costello to fulfill Amy's vision of free music therapy for the world. Our goal is to provide free online streaming of multi-genre, positive music and happy global news reports. (Don't worry. It's not a freaky religious thing. It's just a place for music and news to make you smile.) We've got the playlists, the computers, the business plan, and the drive. All we need to get started is a little financial help from our friends to cover the initial hosting and royalty fees.

The background on Be Luv:

Amy Anne has been a musician all her life, and whenever that life hits a rocky patch, she creates playlists of positive music to see her through. (Back in the day, these were on cassettes and CDs. Now it's all iTunes.) She often thought the world would be a better place if everyone could tune into a positive radio station where the music and news would inspire hope and changes for the better.

Too often, we tune into commercial media for entertainment or insight into current affairs, and we wind up feeling hopeless about the state of the world and our personal lives, or battered by an onslaught of advertising. It's time to accentuate the positive, celebrate the best music in all genres, and take notice of the good things happening every day around the globe. It's time to Be Luv. 

What Be Luv needs from you:

We're so excited to share the music that inspires us! We're adding independent and national artists from all genres to our playlists every day, as we prepare for launch. Part of "being love" is making sure we compensate all our artists for the music we play, and that's why we started this fund raising campaign. It costs $2,000 to host an online radio station and pay artist royalties for one year - which is exactly the sum we're raising now. With your help, we can start playing Be Luv Music just in time for the summer!

Once the music is flowing, we'll get right to work on other ways to spread the Be Luv message and make our station self-sustaining. Upcoming Be Luv projects include daily positive news reports, concerts for charity, karma contests where listeners win prizes in exchange for community service, and a Be Luv blog featuring visual art and creative writing by regional and international artists. We're dreaming big, and it all starts with the music. Help us get on the air and we promise to be your summer soundtrack!

Other ways you can help

1) Please tell your friends about this campaign. Post a link on your Facebook page, e-mail your friends, and call your mom. (She wants to hear from you anyway. :)


2) Friend "Be Luv Music" on Facebook so you don't miss out on our summertime launch festivities.


3) If you are a musician, photographer, visual artist, poet, or creative genius with a positive message, please get in touch with us at info@beluvmusic.org. We're always looking for new positive songs for the radio, new artists for the Be Luv blog, and awesome CDs, books, and art for the Be Luv prize vault.


4) If you own a business with a positive, earth-friendly, charitable product and you are interested in sponsorship or donating prizes for our karma contests, please contact amyanne@beluvmusic.orgl. We'd love to hear from you!

story:
UPDATE: 

I'm beyond Grateful for y'alls support and honored by your presence in my life!!!

I initially underestimated PayPal's cut and as the majority of us are choosing to donate through PayPal, I recognize that I need more than $6000 to complete the EP.

Any surplus past that that will go towards a bonus track on the record, possibly two?

If we continue to go big, the additional resources will be used to support the Record's Release,

Promotion and Publicity.  Just wanted to keep y'all posted and stay clear with my intentions.

Love Y'all So Much, p



My Story

Originally from Austin Texas, I moved out to LA 2 years ago and into the most intense period of emotional and spiritual development I've experienced this lifetime.

Somewhere in the middle of all this growth I began living on a modest sailboat and meditating, writing, and expressing all that I'd felt in my previous relationship.

In this process, with the help of some amazing friends, I recognized that there's nothing to forgive others of only things to forgive within myself and that all the pain and frustration that I'd felt so deeply all stemmed from ancient wounds that had very little to do with my last partner.

These songs emerged as gifts to aid me in embodying these realizations and

now that they've delivered me into a new life I wish to share them with the world.



About the EP "Leave on the Lights"

There are 5 songs on this record


Leave on the Lights

Time to Let go

April Full Moon

The Projectionist

The Forgiver


The songs were cut essentially live late last year in a single day with Mona Tavakoli and Becky Gebhardt of Raining Jane. I can't imagine what these songs would be like without their magic and nuance in these recordings.


So What needs to be Done?

Bringing this EP to completion will take at least $6000 and here's how that breaks down:


$2800  Ten days with engineer/producer/wonderman Robin Livingston

$500    Two days in a nice studio for additional tracking
$600    Three session players for overdubs

$750    Mastering

$1350  CD Replication



Reciprocity?

I'm big into reciprocity for y'all whom contribute...

$0       one hug (hugs are always free)

$13     digital download of record before it's released 

$34     digital download, 1 signed cd

$144   digital download, 2 signed cds, limited edition shirt 

$377   digital download, 2 signed cds, limited edition shirt , 2 tickets to cd release
didgeridoo sound healing day of cd release show

$987   digital download, 2 signed cds, limited edition shirt, 2 ticket to cd release
didgeridoo sound healing day of cd release show
           write you a lil thank you song about anything you want and sing it to you at the show


$1597 digital download, 2 signed cds, 2 limited edition shirts, 2 ticket to cd release
   didgeridoo sound healing day of cd release show
           write you a lil thank you song about anything you want and sing it to you while i fly you
           at a house concert within the next year 
           (transportation and lodging not included if out of Southern California)

$2584 digital download, 2 signed cds, 2 limited edition shirts, 2 ticket to cd release
   didgeridoo sound healing day of cd release show
           write you a lil thank you song about anything you want and sing it to you while i fly you
           at a house concert within the next year 
           (transportation and lodging not included if out of Southern California)
           you +1 on the guest list for any show i play for the next 3 years



Pass it On!!!

If you choose not to donate the best way you can help is to pass this on.

By posting the video on any social networks you're a part of and/or emailing your friends a link to this campaign you are increasing the potential of this project exponentially and that is the kind of action that will create success.


Again, I'm all kinds of grateful for you're time and presence.


Love Y'all,

p

Love Y'all,

story:
Summary

Hi my name is H.E. and I am a musician and artist putting together an album of catchy songs and video art, based on my 1st Single Everytime You're Gone. Most of the songs are actually written but being a sucker for complex arrangements and tight production, it's going to take time. Which is basically the reason you're here, reading this: You can have a direct effect on just how long it's going to take.

Who's H.E.?

For those who don't know me: I've started out in the UK music industry in the early 2000's as a teen, at the infamous Motor Museum Studios in Liverpool, through which an incredible array of artists went through (Oasis, Travis, Arctic Monkeys, The dead 60's, Atomic Kitten, OMD; Kraftwerk, the LA's, just to name a few).

Initially I was a singer/guitarist but after switching to producing, success came quickly and I felt quite comfortable working outside the spotlight, especially since I got to learn how to make hit records from some of the most incredible talents. At some point however, I realized that there was more to me than supplying other artists with ideas and material and I set out to do my own thing. 

What I didn't have though at that point was much life experience. After all, I had spent my entire youth in dark smoky rooms (called recording studios), hanging out with freaks. If I've had known that it'd take years to find my own voice as an artist, I'd have probably just stuck with what I had back than, but being stubborn, I just went for it anyways.

Today I am pretty clear about my path and with the support of my amazing family and inspiring community here in Mokpo, South Korea, I am busy working on the 1st album of my own songs. Thanx to my past I am even in the luxurious position of being able to write and produce myself (which is generally not  recommended but in my case seems too work well).

Anyways, when I started this project in 2011, I had not quite figured out how to go about making videos but now that I have, it's become apparent that the equipment I had budgeted for, turns out embarrassingly inadequate. To give you an idea: to make the drawings for the 1st video took about 2 weeks - to put them together in the computer took 4 month (mainly starring a progress bars)! Which is...

...Where you come in


  • When, thanks to your brilliant support, we'll have hit the target of 2000€ ($2700) we'll be able to replace some seriously outdated PC Hardware to help cut down the production time of videos from 3-4 month to approx. 4 weeks (=Album out Winter 2014)
  • If we go beyond the target (e.g.  €3000 / $4000), we'll be able to upgrade some audio equipment also and thus have more songs come your way even faster (= Album summer/fall 2014)
  • Should you go nuts and support the hell out of this, any additional funds will be allocated to Marketing, which otherwise would be subject to a separate campaign
  • In case we miss the target, no worries, new stuff will come, it's just gonna take a whoooooooooooole lot longer...
In Essence, any contribution of yours will accelerate the project. So if you're ready to see how it feels to be a living turbo booster - take a look to the right of the screen and pick one or more items that suit you. There's all kinds of stuff reaching from

Music/Art

  • Advanced Downloads
  • Limited Edition CDs
  • Original Artwork as used in Videos (Prints and Originals)
Stuff that your buddies will talk about in 20 years time, such as:

  • Being in one of H.E.'s next videos
  • Your Name / Portrait featured on Album artwork
Educational

  • Skype lessons on: Guitar, Bass, Vocals, Production, Professional Studio design


Other Ways You Can Help

DON'T PRE-PURCHASE STUFF IF YOU'RE BROKE!

You may like my music or this project but you just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • You may know people who might be interessted in the project also - let them know about this campaign!
  • Remind them to also share it
  • Become a Facebook Fan (like button), subscribe to H.E.'s Youtube Channel and become a regular commentator / share stuff continously (that really helps)
  • Make a Youtube playlist of famous songs or artists that sound similar and put my current and future videos in there
  • Become a member of a forum or blog that you feel, relates to what I do and let them know about the campaign also
  • Review music on Itunes or Amazon
If you have any questions, just drop us an email or leave a comment!

Thanx for your amazing support,

Regards, H.E.

story:
Thank you for taking the time to visit!

My Story

"After countless fan requests, I am headed into the studio again to make a big band album that blends Big Band standards with a twist of Soul - but this time you're invited along for the ride!"

Rory Partin debuted his first big band album "The Very Thought of You" after years of rave reviews and countless live performances at concert venues all across the country. This critically acclaimed album showcased Rory's smooth vocals on well-loved big band standards and classics such as It Had To Be You, Luck Be A Lady, and Mack The Knife.  The new project includes fan favorites such as "Georgia On My Mind," "Don't Get Around Much Anymore," "Jambalaya, " "What A Wonderful World," and many more!

How you can contribute! 

"I wouldn't have a career in music without the support of amazing family, friends, especially YOU! By giving to my campaign, you not only help me to record my new project, but you are taking part in my career, years into the future. Without you, I have no future career in music. THANK YOU for being a part of my life and music. THANK YOU FOR GIVING!" Rory Partin


YOUR CONTRIBUTION & INVOLVEMENT MAKES A DIFFERENCE! Every bit helps. If 200 people give $100, I've reached my goal. Or if 800 people give $25, 1000 people give $20, 2000 people give $10...EVERYONE COUNTS! So get involved and give, tell your friends and family and encourage them to join in, post it on your social media pages, and let's get this thing funded! By helping fund my new project, you have opportunities not only to enjoy my new music but to participate yourself in the making of it! (check out the perks to see how.)

Speaking of PERKS!

**Please check out the pledge levels and perks on the right side of the page and consider donating what you can to join me in the creation of this album. Simply click on the pledge level of your choice, and you will be guided through the process. We have just added some brand new ones! So check them out! We have fun ways to reward your generosity. :) If you're unable to donate, you can still help by spreading the word!

**I've factored U.S. shipping costs into the price of each perk. Please add $10 to your pledge for international shipping.


Where your support is going!

  • Hiring Professional Arrangers
  • Studio Rental
  • Musician Pay (19 piece big band)
  • Overdubs and recording vocals
  • Mixing and Mastering
  • Photos & Artwork
  • Printing and Duplication
  • Song Royalties
  • Marketing...and the list goes on and on. $20,000 doesn't even fund the entire project. We put our money where our mouth is, we are the projects biggest investors! :)

The cast and studio!

  • Tenor Sax: Quitman Dennis
  • Tenor Sax: Doug Moffet
  • Alto Sax/Tenor Sax Solo/Flute solo/Clarinet: Jimmy Bowland
  • Alto Sax/Clarinet: Dennis Solee
  • Bari Sax: Tom McGinley
  • Trumpet: Steve Patrick
  • Trumpet: Ricky Peters
  • Trumpet: Brent Baker
  • Trumpet/Flugelhorn: Jamey Simmons
  • Trombone: Oscar Utterstrom
  • Trombone: Greg Cox
  • Trombone: Roger Bradley
  • Trombone: Eric Tucker
  • Piano/Accordion: Jeff Lisenby
  • Guitar: Paul Hagy
  • Bass: Danny O'Lannerghty
  • Drums/Perc: Scott Weckerly
  • Percussion: Sam Bacco
  • Engineer: Tommy Cooper
  • Asst Engineer: Adam Deane
  • Studio: Soundshop Recording Studio, Nashville, TN
  • Arranger: Tim McMillen
  • Arranger: Walt Stuart
  • Producer: Rory Partin
  • Asst to Rory: Jacquelyn Gebhart
  • Wife to Rory (& amazing help!): Alexa James :)

Make a difference for others!

Your support will also be helping provide clean drinking water to people in the developing world through our partner organization, Charity:Water. Eight hundred million people around the globe still live without clean drinking water. One dollar out of every 10 raised towards the album will be donated to Charity:Water. And 100% of that money will go to provide clean drinking water. It's a win-win! Information on Charity:Water, updates on funding and news from the studio will be posted throughout the campaign. So what are you waiting for? Let's get this thing funded!

Charity:Water Video
Charity:Water Website

Other ways you can participate!

Please visit my website, http://www.rorypartin.com, and join my mailing list to keep up on the latest happenings in my music. You can also listen to, and purchase my first album there. Or visit http://www.cdbaby.com/rorypartin, iTunes, amazon, Spotify, etc., pretty much anywhere you buy your music online. Also go to Pandora.com and start you a Rory Partin radio station! AND call, email, fax, send a telegram, write in the sky...to your local radio station that plays jazz and big band and request my music! :)


FAQs

Is it possible to make a contribution without accepting the perk?

Yes. At checkout you will be given the option of whether or not to accept a perk.

Can I chip in for my own shipping costs?

Yes, please! The cost of shipping is included in your perk contribution. But you're more than welcome to add a few dollars to the contribution amount. Add your desired amount as you check out.

Can I give beyond the level of my desired perk?

Yes, of course! Add whatever amount you wish as you check out. Every dollar helps us reach our goal!

What will you do with money made beyond the goal?

More time in the studio! Hire string players! And there is always more money that can be spent on marketing and promoting the album! Thank you!

story:
Summary

Hey There!

I'm Ryan Kirkland. I'm a Singer/Songwriter from Southern California. Some of you may know, that for about five and a half years I was in a band from Orlando, FL called Between The Trees. We had some great success and a lot of fun during that time, and impacted people along the way. That might even be why you're here now. But when I felt called away from the band, I made one of the scariest steps of faith I had ever made in my entire life. 

I knew that one day I would write/record again, but not in that moment. This step was away from all of that. This step was into the unknown. I had no plan, no sure direction, but I knew it was right. Within the first few hours of that step I immediately felt peace. Unbelievable peace. Unlike anything I had ever felt before. I wrote at least three songs that week!

The emotion and the words couldn't come quick enough! But something was still pulling at me. So I stayed focused on what was pulling me and never quite kept complete focus on the music. And the music kept coming! It was so freeing! I know that some of you don't believe the same things I do. But I know now that God was showing me He had me! And with a little trust, and the letting go of what I wanted, I found me! Again, I know you may be reading this and not believe what I believe, but if you could just imagine yourself in the exact place you know you're supposed to be, doing exactly what you're supposed to be doing, and feeling the most complete you have ever felt... That's what I felt like when I wrote these songs.

I've been writing ever since I left for California 2 years ago, and I haven't stopped. Among the fights and the fears, the joy and sorrow, I keep writing. And I finally feel like it's time to put it all down! I hope to put out as many records as I can this year, but lets just try and start with one for now! :) 

I'm super excited that I will be recording with one of my all time favorite producers, Stuart Brawley! Stu was the same producer Between The Trees worked with on our Spain record! He is an incredible guy and a very talented and seasoned writer and producer. Stu has worked with some of the greatest voices in music (Michael Jackson, Don Henley, Celine Dion, Barbara Streisand, Lenka...  and I feel so blessed to call him a friend and a colleague. I won't go on and on, but you can see a little more into who Stuart Brawley is and who he's worked with here: www.stuartbrawley.com

What I Need & What You Get

I need around $18,000 to pay for recording costs, (producer, gear, time, musicians) and the rest will be for travel, lodging and the manufacturing and completion of all the perks. ABSOLUTELY NONE of the money is going in my pocket!

For this, I've been thinking up some common and not so common perks!

$5 - Thanks!  I know that times are hard but like "My MoOom" always says, "every little bit counts!" I'll include a digital download of one of the songs.

$15 - The Sounds.  You will recieve a hard copy of the record with a handwritten Thank You.

$25 - The Connection.  A signed hard copy of the record and a surprise bonus track inside your copy!

$50 - The Swag. All the above and a limited addition shirt that will only be available during this campaign.

$100 - The Ink.   In addition to the above, instead of just the handwritten note, I will also include your name in the thank you's on the inside of the CD jacket.

$150 - The Insight.  Are you a budding songwriter or artist? Have some songs that you'd like feedback on? Submit 3 songs to Ryan's producer, Stuart Brawley, and he'll write up a critique of your songs. Melody, structure, lyric, arrangement will all be considered. If you don't have recordings and want to come to our studio in LA, you can come play 3 songs for Stuart and he'll give you feedback and suggestions, live and in person.

$150 - The Local.  This is for those local to (or those planning to be local to) Southern California. In addition to all the above, we'll set up a day for you to come up to LA and spend the entire day in the studio with me!

$250 - The Skype Show.  Excluding "The Local" you get all the above, as well as a skype acoustic show for you and whoever you want! I'll show you some songs from the record. Catch up! And maybe even sing some older favorites!

$400 - The House Show.  Excluding the "Local" and the "Skype Show", you get all of the above and Acoustic show in your home. You can invite whoever you want!      *must be within 75 miles Driving Distance of Orange County. We will work out the specific date via Email or Phone

$500 - The Demo.  So you're an indie artist or wish you were.  You've written a couple songs, and really want to record them.  Come to the studio and give the whole music biz thing a try!   Includes 3 hours in the studio with Stuart to record your demo.  Solo performances, not full bands please!

If you're not a singer/songwriter but know one, this would make a great Christmas gift!

$600 - The Blessing.  If you are giving this, then you are blowing my mind right now! I will give you your pick of all the above and would love to just be able to personally call and thank you from the bottom of my heart! And personally invite you to the CD release, whenever/If ever that takes place. 

If for some reason we don't hit our goal, I plan to put all the money toward getting the record done and fullfilling as many of the perks as I can. If I run out before I do, then I will start selling copies and using the proceeds to complete all the perks. I promise to be honest and trustworthy with the blessing you are placing on me.

The Impact

I know you've been waiting right along with me for this day. So please, please help me make this the start of another amazing chapter in the connection between you and me! I can only make this happen with your help! Don't only contribute, but spread the word if you can! Blast the social-sphere with your story if I've ever played a part in that. Tell people why they should help if you think they should! I can't do this without you!!! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you can’t contribute, and that's ok! But that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

Get the word out!

Whether through Social Media, or Word of mouth. Maybe try designing some Album Art that could attract the eye. Whatever you can do would be amazing!

Indiegogo has a lot of share tools! So don't forget to use those!

THANK YOU! THANK YOU! THANK YOU!

Ryan James Kirkland

And personally invite you to the CD release, whenever/If ever that takes place. 
If for some reason we don't hit our goal, I plan to put all the money toward getting the record done and fullfilling as many of the perks as I can. If I run out before I do, then I will start selling copies and using the proceeds to complete all the perks. I promise to be honest and trustworthy with the blessing you are placing on me.



The Impact
I know you've been waiting right along with me for this day. So please, please help me make this the start of another amazing chapter in the connection between you and me! I can only make this happen with your help! Don't only contribute, but spread the word if you can! Blast the social-sphere with your story if I've ever played a part in that. Tell people why they should help if you think they should! I can't do this without you!!! 



Other Ways You Can Help
Some of you can’t contribute, and that's ok! But that doesn’t mean you can’t help:
Get the word out!
Whether through Social Media, or Word of mouth. Maybe try designing some Album Art that could attract the eye. Whatever you can do would be amazing!
Indiegogo has a lot of share tools! So don't forget to use those!

THANK YOU! THANK YOU! THANK YOU!
Ryan James Kirkland

story:
Our story

Last year, we organized 1st edition of whoneedslyrics?! festival (18.-19.9.2014) and it was amazing. People, bands, atmosphere, everything.
The only problem with last year edition are money. We didn't have as much visitors as we expected. That's why we are here again. 
Total whoneedslyrics?! festival budget for the 1st edition was 12 500€. Because we are still D.I.Y. (no financial sponsors), our revenues are only from ticket sales. From ticket sales, we collected 6 000€, in our last indiegogo campaign we collected 1 215€. We found people that helped us a lot, they gave us 1 300€.That is 8 515 in total. So from last edition, we are 3 985€ short to cover all the costs.

By the way, we organised festival this year again, just because we want it and we need it. :) But only one day edition, much smaller than last year. Whoneedslyrics?! festival 2015 was on 29th May in British Rock Stars club in Bratislava (for line up scroll down a bit).

But we want to organise a big edition again in 2016. 2 days edition, with bigger stages, lot of amazing bands etc. Thats why we really need and want you as our ''sponsors''.
So, whoneedslyrics?! festival 2016 will be on 27.-28.5.2016 in Bratislava! 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is set to 3 000€. But be sure, that all raised money will go towards the production of the whoneedslyrics?! festival 2016, not for cover the expenses from 2014 edition. 

And what you get? 2 days full of great bands, new friends from all over the world and great experiences! :)

Of course, VIP tickets, t-shirts etc. are available only here.

And you can be sure that if we will raise more money than we expect, every next edition will have more headliners and great bands and it will be the best festival in the whole world! :)

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help us financially, great help for us is to share this on your FB, website etc. Or just tell your friends. :)

whoneedslyrics?! festival crew

festival is organized by

Michal Goňa (CEO, line-up), Terézia Goňová, Ján Arbet, Veronika Klimonová, Dominika Murková and lot of volunteers, friends and crowdfunders.

if you have any questions or suggestions feel free to write us here: realmgbooking(at)gmail.com

line up for whoneedslyrics?! festival 2015

ARMS AND SLEEPERS /US/, LABIRINTO /BR/, THISQUIETARMY /CA/, LEHNEN /AT/, POLLY /RU/, FLASH THE READIES /CZ/, LINE GATE /SK/, UNTITLED SEA /SK/, ZOO AND AQUARIUM /SK/

2014 line up: This Will Destroy You /US/, Tides From Nebula /PL/, Lymbyc Systym /US/, Zero Absolu /FR/, Lehnen /AT/, Sounds Like the End of the World /PL/, Rosa Parks /HU/, I Will Kill Chita /RU/, Cinématique /AT/, Polly /RU/, Michael Zimmel /AT/, The Ills /SK/, Miro Sounds Like a Movie /PL/, Fresh Out of the Bus /SK/, Line Gate /SK/, Our Stories /SK/, Kornelius W /SK/, Inheritance /SK/, Via Anima /SK/

and whoneedslyrics?! festival 2016 line up?

We promise that line up will be great! :) But for now, we really need your help. 

Let's spread the world!

story:
My name is Tony Jones and I’m a Youth Leader, Christian Hip Hop artist and Youth Coordinator who currently resides in East Prairie, Missouri.   I've been blessed to share the stage with artists such as: NF, Andy Mineo, Newsboys and many others. I've had opportunities to perform in Washington State, Kentucky, Wisconsin, Illinois, South Carolina, Pennsylvania and many other states, encouraging young people to be who God designed them to be.

On Friday, July 10, 2015, I was chosen to participate in one of the largest Christian festivals known as “Creation Festival” where I was awarded  the Music Tournament, and 2015 National winner  after competing against 60 different independent artists from all around the U.S. In 2016, I perform at all of their festivals.

I have independently released two projects. 

My First Independent EP Released in 2013.

My Second Independent Album Released in 2015.

My New Sound:

With the help of my friend Caleb James aka Killa Beatz, I completed a collection of 10 songs that simply are designed to encourage young people to take their life to the next level in all areas. The quality of style and sound on this project goes beyond the other projects I created in the past. This album has a variety of styles such as trap, reggae, soul, and  R&B. The mission and purpose is still the same, which is to challenge people to be who God created them to be. Without your financial contributions this project wont fulfill its purpose.

What I Need

As many of you know I'm attempting  to raise $5,000. I've previewed many of my new songs in public schools and students lives are being impacted by the songs. I know without a doubt this project will impact the world in a major way.

Where will your money go?

$500- Mastering ($50 per song) 10 Song album

$1,500- 500 Printing 4-panel Digipaks + Artwork

$1000-  Music Videos

$1000- 1 Month PR Campaign

$ 1000 - Merchandise Budget

Risks & Challenges

If only $500 is raised the project can still be released, but the album will not be  successful without Music Videos, Marketing, and Merchandising . I am currently expecting a new baby girl in May and without your contributions  finishing this project will be nearly impossible.  Lets work together and make this dream a reality,

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't support financially here are ways to help:

Please share my campaign page on your Facebook, twitter, instagram, asking your personal friends and community to contribute to the campaign. Also keep me in your prayers. 

Thank you so much for considering!  Lets make an album that rocks the world!

Join the Fam

facebook.com/whoistjones

www.tjonesmusic.com

story:
Hi there! 

It would be extremely rad and supportive of you reading this could donate any amount towards my passion!

Watch the video above to get a sense of the time I put into music I love to make!

I need cheddar for mastering and artwork to release a solid EP coming out beginning quarter of next year!

I have a killer perk for $10. 

If you like what you hear please donate!

story:
Short Summary

I have been involved with music and leading worship for 27 years.  I am currently serving as worship director at Grace Church in Hudson, MA.  It has always been a dream of mind to take some of my original music along with worship favorites and put them into an album.  I don’t know if it was lack of confidence or time, but I was never able to get around to making it happen.  

In July of 2017, my dad was diagnosed with stage 4 cancer.  He passed away later that year.  Through the entire journey of his illness, he echoed one request of me. You need to record.  So in January of 2018, I drove out to Old Bear Studios near Buffalo, NY to work producer Chris Hoisginton and record the first track of this new album. This past January I headed back to NY with my wife to spend two days writing and finishing songs to round out the remaining tracks.  Now it’s time to record the rest of the project.  Unfortunately, my dad was never able to hear the first track before he passed, but with your help, I can honor his request and hopefully bless the body of Christ with some great songs to sing in troubled times.  

The album will be called “Faithful.”  If there is one thing my family and I have experienced over the past few years as we have journeyed through the loss of loved ones and significant life changes are that Jesus Christ is the same yesterday, today and forever.  He will never leave us or forsake us.  That if we seek first His Kingdom and His righteousness, all the things we need in this life will be taken care of.  I hope that as you hear these songs, your faith will be strengthened. That you will have a new sense of hope. Not hope in yourself, but hope in a Jesus who is ready and able to save.  

What We Need & What You Get

So what do we need to make this happen?  The cost of finishing this album is $11,000.  It seems like a large sum of money, but if we do this together, anything is possible.  I have made a significant investment already in studio time, travel, and related expenses, but to finish the work, I will need your help.  

If you are able to partner with me, I have a whole list of perks from a simple digital download to a full band worship night.  Would you consider becoming a partner?

The Impact

The goal of this album is to shine a light on God’s faithfulness.  

“For I am convinced that neither death nor life, neither angels nor demons, neither the present nor the future, nor any powers, neither height nor depth, nor anything else in all creation, will be able to separate us from the love of God that is in Christ Jesus our Lord.”(Romans 8:38-39) 

“Know therefore that the LORD your God is God, the faithful God  who keeps covenant and steadfast love with those who love him and keep his commandments, to a thousand generations,”(Deuteronomy 7:9)

“If we are faithless, He remains faithful, for He cannot deny Himself.”(2 Timothy 2:13 )

“Your faithfulness endures to all generations;  you have established the earth, and it stands fast.”( Psalms 119:90  )

“Let us hold fast the confession of our hope without wavering, for he who promised is faithful.”( Hebrews 10:23  )

“The LORD’S loving kindnesses indeed never cease, For His compassions never fail. They are new every morning; Great is Your faithfulness.”( Lamentations 3:22-23 )

“Be strong and courageous. Do not be afraid or terrified because of them, for the LORD your God goes with you; he will never leave you nor forsake you.”( Deuteronomy 31:6 )

My desire is that these songs would become anthems for you in times of anxiety, worry, and doubt, like they were and are for me.  

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk in this project is putting myself out there.  Will anyone even pledge?  What happens if all the money is not raised?  I have prayerfully, along with my family, determined that this is what God wants me to do.  That he used the situation with my dad to push me towards His will.  So with that, you can know that every dollar raised will go toward the recording of this project.  If we do not raise enough, I will use the money we do raise to record as much as I can.  I refuse to cut corners on the project so I will not record something sub par to just finish.  If we raise more money than what is needed, I will record more songs.  I have enough materiel to record a 10 song album, but thought a 6 song EP would be a more attainable goal.  

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that for some of you, pledging money is not an option.  I work in full time church ministry so being tight on funds is a daily struggle.  But there are still ways you can get involved.

First, please pray for me and the team recording.  It is a long process that we want to do well.  Pray that we stay healthy and that travel to and from the studio is safe.  Pray that in every note that is played, the Holy Spirit speaks to the hearts of those who will listen.  Pray that through the project, many will come to know Jesus and follow Him for the rest of their lives.  

Oh…and share the heck out this.  Tell all your friends and family.  If my ministry has affected you in any way, let people know so they can get involved.

story:
Basics...

Kori.eryn is a self-taught guitarist, singer-songwriter from the small coastal tourist town of Westerly, RI. Her songs are those of struggle, of healing, and of finding the rainbow after the rain. Kori.eryn is human, she is broken, she is smiling, and she writes to heal with her heart on her sleeve. With a natural ability to captivate her audiences with the genuine sincerity of her performances, she actively began her performing career and youtube involvement in January of 2010. 


So here it is, my name is kori eryn and I want nothing more than to share my music with those who are locals who can't always make it out ot my live performances, with my youtube fans new and old, and all those who are are far away but close at heart. To do this, I plan on releasing my self-recorded debut album "Reason for rain..." with the input assistance of the multi-talented Kyle Rathbun before the end of 2011 but I need your help to make that a reality. I have started funding for the project at local shows selling my EP Droplets to interested listeners and I thought...why not make it available to everyone?! Here's your chance to be part of my story. :)


Join in!

Help me, help you :) I make the album - you get the album, you listen to the album, you get the perks associated with your level of funding and make me the happiest singer.songwriter alive :) The album will be created regardless of the funding goal being met through this campaign however, it may be more slow-going than preferable :/ Let's make it happen in 2011!


Necessary Details...

My total fundraising effort is for a total of $2000. The ending date for this campaign is my birthday ;) ...meeting our goal would be the BEST BIRTHDAY PRESENT EVER. 

As for the $ - This goes to the state of the art mastering of my home recordings so that my songs will reach you all in the best quality possible. This goes to the production of my physical cds on earth friendly materials in Zero Carbon Footprint Digipacks from Oasis.  This goes to the release of my digital album on iTunes etc. This goes to making sure the design details of the album are perfecto. This goes to good old fashioned heartfelt music :) As I said, regardless of whether the goal is met, all profits from this fundraiser stay in the "Reason for rain..." Album fund to be added to by other fundraising means! So please be as generous as you feel inclined - every little bit helps get us closer to this goal!


Based on your level of funding - I have some great perks that I'll be offering including - signed copies of my previously unreleased EP "Droplets", posters, postcards, t-shirts, and even a couple house performances for those local fans!! (please be advised that I cannot promise performances outside of the New England area due to possible travel limitations)


Share!!!

To make this possible - please reach out to friends, family, fellow music lovers through whichever networking tools you use! - Whether it be facebook, youtube, twitter, blogs or my favorite stand by - chatting over a cup of steaming herbal tea at your favorite local coffee shop :) Get the word out there. Every little bit counts! Everyone can make a big difference and receive my thanks in return :) As well as enjoy the end result with me :)
